Hello! Guy-in-a-thunderstorm here!
Once again, a huge thank you from myself and the whole team for your support. We were blown away by the response and positivity, and we couldn't wait to get the ball rolling on pre-production. No, really, we've started on some animation tests already.
PLAY

campaign.story:
Metal Skin Panic: MADOX-01 has a special place in our hearts for several reasons. Not only is it the directorial debut of the extraordinary Aramaki Shinji (Bubblegum Crisis, Megazone 23 III, Appleseed, Ghost in the Shell: SAC 2045, just to name a few), it was also the first title AnimEigo released, well over 30 years ago!
MADOX is one of our personal favorites because it not only combines action and comedy with realistic mechanical designs, but also delivers a powerful moral lesson -- "Read the @^#^@ Manual".
We have wanted to release MADOX in HD for many years, but have been unable to do so because suitable film assets were not available. Everyone thought they had been lost, but in reality the original print was at Tokyo Genzōsho, sitting in the bottom of a locked filing cabinet stuck in a disused lavatory with a sign on the door saying "Beware of the Leopard Tank", wondering why all the other OVAs were getting released in HD and it wasn't.
As far as we can tell, the only record of its location was mangled by a manically depressed fax machine, and only the heroic efforts of our crack team of Combat Archaeologists managed to uncover the truth.
At which point, we emailed Tokyo Genzōsho and the reply was, "Yeah, sure, we've got it. Also, we like Gojira."
The TLDR
We'll be doing things in much the same way as our previous Anime Kickstarters, so everything should be familiar to you because you backed those, didn't you? As usual, the goal is to do a definitive reference edition of the title. The Basic Blu-ray will be packed with everything MADOX-related we can dig up, and the Premium Set will add a detailed artbook and a chipboard case. We'll be doing one of our embroidered patches, and may do extra goodies if there is enough interest. As with our previous releases, this will be a limited edition, one pressing, and once it's gone, it's gone!
OVA Synopsis
In the first test of a revolutionary personal battle-suit, the MADOX-01, Ace female test-pilot Kusumoto Elle smashes an attacking tank force and humiliates Lt. Kilgore, Japan's most-macho tank-jockey, in the process.
Kilgore swears he'll get even, and he gets his chance when the prototype MADOX literally falls off the back of a truck in the middle of Tokyo.
Meanwhile, the MADOX, which fell off the back of one truck, off a bridge, and into the back of another truck, has found its way into the hands of college student Sugimoto Kōji. Intrigued by the MADOX, Kōji makes the big mistake of fooling with it without reading the manual first, and soon finds himself locked in the suit and zooming around downtown Tokyo.
Unfortunately, the homing signal the now-active MADOX transmits results in a no-holds-barred response by Kilgore; even more unfortunately, even though Kōji doesn't know how to fight, the MADOX does a pretty good job on automatic (it's got "Full Self Driving" capability), resulting in a firefight the likes of which the local residents haven't seen since the last time Gojira hit town.
Concerned about the property damage being caused to some of the world's most expensive real-estate, Elle dons a second prototype MADOX and tries to find and rescue Kōji before Kilgore's many minions totally trash Tokyo.
And apart from the attempts to destroy the suit (and it's driver), Kōji has his own problems: if he breaks his date with his girlfriend, he will lose her forever -- and he's a tad overdressed for the occasion!
Will Kōji be late for his date? Or will Kilgore make him "the late Kōji?" And more importantly, is it possible to eat Convenience Store shrimp in a battlesuit? The answers to these and many other questions await you in the 41 action-packed minutes of Metal Skin Panic: MADOX-01!
Disc Contents
We're packing the disc with as much content as we can gather, and the contents will almost certainly expand as we go through production. However, at a minimum, you'll get:
A new HD transfer of MADOX-01, created especially for this edition, in both the original 4:3 presentation (pillarbox) and a 16:9 version approved by Director Aramaki.
The original SD "Weapons of MADOX-01" featurette, that describes the real-life weapons systems featured in the show.
English subtitles, both our regular colored subtitles, colored SDH subtitles, and SDH captions.
Our English dub, with SDH captions.
Color and Line art galleries.
All the bonus features included on the 2003 DVD release,  including a commentary track, two interviews (one of which is mostly Robert embarrassing himself), the original Japanese documentary, and an Easter Egg IMDB describes as a "disturbing behind the scenes look at AnimEigo."
List of all Kickstarter backers on the disc.
New package art designed by Director Aramaki and illustrated by Mercy Rabbit. Director Aramaki will create 3 draft designs and the backers will vote on the one that will be fully realized. Also available as a limited-edition poster in both JIS B1 and B0 sizes (the latter hand signed by the artists).
6-panel printed insert containing a poster on one side and a list of backers on the other.
Easter Eggs and other hidden content. Or maybe not. It'll be up to you to find out.
As with all our Blu-rays, the disc will not be region-locked.
Design sketches for the new artwork
A frame from the transfer (click for full-resolution version)
About the New Transfer
The new transfer of MADOX was performed under the supervision of Director Aramaki at Tokyo Genzōsho from the original print of the film, and clocks in at almost 700GB of uncompressed 2K video. If the project reaches the second stretch goal, we will also perform a digital restoration pass on the film, doing additional color grading, dust and scratch removal, image stabilization, camera flicker reduction and splice removal. Film grain reduction will not be performed, as some of you have strong opinions about that... :)
If restoration is performed, both the original transfer and the digital restoration will be included on the disc. All additional work will be supervised by Director Aramaki.
Reward Levels
The @^#^@ Manual (Digital Production Materials) - $5
Online access to all the art and other production documentation, plus you will be listed on the disc and Amaray poster insert.
Basic - $30+ shipping
The basic set, a region-free BD-25 Blu-ray + poster insert. Includes all the digital rewards.
Premium - $60 + shipping
The basic set plus the Production Artbook (at least 70 pages, hopefully more -- we're still hunting down materials), together in a sturdy chipboard box.
Patron - $150 + shipping - Limited Reward: 80 Available
Includes everything in Premium, plus you will be listed as a Patron when the disc loads in addition to your listing in the regular disc feature.
Prominent Patron - $250 + shipping - Limited Reward: 20 Available
Includes everything in Patron, plus you will be listed on the first page of the list of Patrons in a larger font.
Perfectionist Patron - $250 + shipping - Limited Reward: 4 Available
Includes everything in Patron, plus you will receive a set of the production check discs. Note that any bugs in the final discs will be your fault! :)
Greyscale Shikishi Patron - $1000 + shipping - Limited Reward: 20 Available
Includes everything in Prominent Patron, plus Mr. Aramaki will create a greyscale MADOX-related shikishi based on your request and inscribe it to you personally (these are not intended for resale).
Shikishi Patron - $2000 + shipping - Limited Reward: 20 Available
Includes everything in Prominent Patron, plus Mr. Aramaki will create a colored MADOX-related shikishi based on your request and inscribe it to you personally (these are not intended for resale).
The price of this reward will drop occasionally until it sells out or reaches a reserve price. All backers who select this reward will get the same price as the final backer.
Due to the way Kickstarter works (we can't change the price of a reward after someone selects it), all backers will be initially be charged what the price was when the first person selected this reward ($2500), but we will issue partial refunds shortly after the campaign concludes.
Example of Mr. Aramaki's shikishi style. For the colored Shikishi, he plans to use colored markers on top of a greyscale Shikishi..


Add-ons
We have a tradition of producing limited-edition bonus "goodies" with our sets, available only to backers. They vary from set to set (we tend to do weird things backers suggest), but one thing we always do is a commemorative embroidered patch. For the Unobtainium Edition, we're going to do posters and a "RTFM" patch. Is that "Read the @^#^@ Manual" or "Run the @^#^@ Mecha"? You decide.
The patch and posters are available as an add-ons.
If you have an idea for a fun item, let us know. If enough of your fellow backers want one, and it won't hasten Robert's inevitable descent into madness (too much), we'll make it!
Stretch Goals
We're going to try something a little different this time. We've developed a menu of stretch goals, and each $25,000 raised in addition to the basic goal of $50,000 will allow the backers to collectively allocate a point towards menu selections.
During the campaign, we are running a public poll so everyone can express their preferences and see what menu items are the most popular. Then, after the campaign, we'll have a private vote by the actual backers of the project to decide the final preference order (and since Robert is a voting systems nerd, we'll use his favorite system, Wright-STV)
Register your preferences in the poll here
The Current Menu
 New Commentary featuring Director Aramaki, Yamane Kimitoshi, and Koizumi Satoshi. (1 point)
 Digital Restoration Pass. The resulting restored version will be included on the disc in addition to the original transfer. (2 points)
 Madox Redux. It turns out there's a scene with an animation mistake that Director Aramaki would like to fix. We'll hire him to do so, and make any other tweaks he deems necessary. These changes will be incorporated into the restored version, and we'll create a special feature that A/B compares the changes. (2 points)
 New Trailer. Director Aramaki wants to create a new 90 second MADOX-01 trailer, with new original music and sound effects. Are we going to have to tell him "no?" Well, are we?! (3 points)
 Shipping Fees
We have World-wide English-language rights, excluding Japan, including orbits gravitationally bound to the Earth (seriously!). The ongoing drama that is Brexit has made it difficult for us to provide EU-friendly shipping, and we also have to charge VAT on UK sales now. Thus, the situation for International Backers is as follows:
 Canada: We will ship from a Canadian warehouse or direct from the USA using DDP (Delivered Duty Paid) shipping; the shipping fee includes all customs duty, taxes and fees.
 UK/EU: We will ship from a UK warehouse or direct from the USA using DDP (Delivered Duty Paid) shipping; the shipping fee includes all customs duty, fees and VAT (and is higher for this reason). 
 Everywhere Else: We will ship from the USA; you will be responsible for any customs duty, taxes and fees.
Currently estimated shipping costs for the blu-rays:
 US: $5 for Basic sets, $7 for everything else.
 UK/EU: $25 for Basic sets, $30 for everything else.
 Everywhere Else on Earth, except Japan: $20 for Basic sets, $25 for everything else. 
 Everywhere Else not on Earth: contact us for a quote.
 Japan: Don't contact us for a quote. We can't ship to Japan.
Currently estimated shipping costs for the posters:
 US: $10 (Priority Mail Service).
 Everywhere Else: contact us for a quote after the campaign; these items are too big to ship by USPS International First Class!
EU customs rules are changing in Summer 2021, and we're not quite sure right now how this is going to affect shipping logistics. If it turns out we have to ship directly without DDP service, we will refund EU backers the appropriate amount to move them into the "Everywhere Else of Earth" category). Similarly, if something happens that significantly reduces our shipping costs, we'll make an adjustment.
Q&A
Why is it the Unobtainium Edition?
First, because for the longest time, the print was unobtainable. Second, because when this limited-edition goes out of print, it will become unobtainable. And finally, to build a MADOX, you need unobtainable materials. 
How are you making the 16x9 version?
The raw resolution of the film transfer is 2400x1743 pixels, but as you can see from looking at a raw frame of the transfer, not all of that is actual image. For the 4:3 version, we find the largest 4:3 region of each film reel that always has image in it and scale it down to 1440x1080. For the 16:9 version, we find the largest rectangle on each film reel that always has image in it, and scale down it so it is 1920 pixels wide. This results in an image that is more than 1080 pixels tall, so for each shot in the film, we pick the 1080 pixel segment that results in the most pleasing presentation. In both cases, the film transfer resolution is higher than Blu-ray resolution, so we are always downscaling, never upscaling.
The 4:3 version has the full original presentation of the film, while the 16:9 version crops off a bit at the top and bottom of each frame, but presents the remainder at a higher effective resolution.
Original 4x3 presentation
Full transfer image with maximal 16x9 centered framing
Final 16x9 framing (adjusted vertically to maximize interesting image; in this case, so you see Kilgore's chin)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While we should be able to meet or beat release date, a video production project such as this can suffer unexpected delays. In particular, one side-effect of the excellent feedback we get from backers is that we expect a certain amount of "feature creep" as people come up with great ideas that "simply must be done", and these tend to stretch the schedule a bit.

Our policy is that when a critical-path item causes a delay, we use that extra time to try and improve other aspects of the project. All of our previous projects have ended up shipping a few months late (each time for new and "interesting" reasons), but what we ended up shipping was better than what it would have been if we'd hit our schedule.

The bottom line is that we will take the time to get things right, even if that means slipping the release date, and that we will keep you fully informed every step of the way -- we typically post updates at least once a month.

Some people tell us that the stories we recount about things going wrong are one of their favorite parts of our projects, but we promise we don't do it deliberately. We don't have to fake incompetence, it just comes naturally (for Robert, anyway).
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers, as mentioned in the previous update, we left the straw polls open until the end of the week, and have tabulated the results.
As expected, the preferred allocation of the 5 available stretch goal points are Digital Restoration, Madox Redux and Commentary.
When it comes to new artwork, choice "C" was both the favorite first choice and favorite second choice, so we're going to go with that.
Wow, the campaign had an excellent final day, and significantly exceeded our expectations. Now the pressure is really on to deliver something that exceeds your expectations.

Dear Backers,
Hard to believe, but there are only a little over 3 days remaining in the campaign. That means it's time for the obligatory post where I exhort you all to remind all your friends that they should back the campaign, even the ones who aren't quite sure who this Annie May person is.

Dear Backers,
Thanks to you, we've passed the $150K mark, which means there are now 4 stretch goal points available. As the Poster Addon announced in the previous update has automatically unlocked the New Artwork stretch goal, the stretch goals straw poll is currently indicating that you'd prefer the Digital Restoration and MADOX Redux stretch goals!
Poster Update

Well, on the surface things have calmed down a little since the launch, but behind the scenes we've been very busy.
We're Doing Posters!
Based on your suggestions, we've been talking to Director Aramaki and Mercy Rabbit, and they've agreed to let us create posters based on their new MADOX artwork.

campaign.story:
NOWWA PRESENTS: BulletVille

OUT NOW:

Talkfunding deep dive - Watch the creator of BulletVille diving in the details of the campaign.
Talkfunding backstory - Interview with Yohami, the creator of BulletVille, about the backstory of the game.
UPDATE: Thank you everybody for helping us reach our goal! BulletVille is going to become a reality thanks to you. 

Although time left is limited, we prepared a stretch goal for the campaign. 
If we reach $125k, we will design a hero through a polling system with our backer community!! We are very excited to think about what the result could be!
 * Pre-alpha footage captured in-game.


BulletVille is a badass, brutal, fun, fast-paced third-person parkour hero shooter & platformer inspired by the classic team arena shooters of the past, mixed with modern game mechanics, featuring unique parkour movement, hero classes, vehicles, tons of guns and many game modes for unlimited hours of gameplay.
BulletVille is currently planned for release on PC and Mac, PS5, Xbox Series X, Nintendo Switch and mobile (iOS, Android).

Want to get a feel of the game? 
You can play a teaser of the Alpha 1.0 on G.ROUND.

And join BulletVille's 150,000+ fan base?
Have a look at our Discord server.



BulletVille borrows inspiration from many great games to create a new, unique experience.

 Frantic shooting gameplay from games like Quake 3 Arena
   Diverse cast of game modes like Overwatch
   Character progression from games like Paladins
   Third-person high mobility from games like Warframe and Infamous 2
   Vehicle combat from games like Borderlands 2 or Battlefield
 And much more in development to keep your eyes on!

From bandits to robots to cats in boxing gloves, vagabonds and marauders of any shape and size are welcome on New Montana! Choose your hero, master their abilities, and blow new holes in your enemies with their unique weapons and play-styles!

“Hand over your booze, your money, and your guns. In! That! Order!”
The reigning king of the biggest bandit clan this side of the District. Formerly a top surgeon on Earth, Hunter Cassidy’s life came crashing down around him when bandit loan sharks from New Montana killed his wife and daughter. In a drunken rage, he hijacked a shuttle, took his revenge, murdered the bandit clan’s leaders, and assumed command of the whole clan as its new king - just in time to wake up with the worst hangover he ever had!

Hunter's Gameplay
Due to his troubled past, Hunter has learned clever ways of getting revenge. He’ll act as a comfortable place for most players to immediately pick up and play, with Recon capabilities and powerful weapons. His signature Rocket Launcher is his pride and joy, but he might break a bottle over your head instead just for fun.

“A dance costs extra, but I’ll kill you for free.”
The sharpest shot to ever sling suds. A troublesome teenage genius, Lacey Rose’s bad attitude and cynicism turned an honest life of jumping between minimum wage jobs into a living nightmare. Her zeal for life returned when she heard of the Treasure Rush on New Montana, where she now works as a saloon dancer and moonlights as a treasure hunter, on the hunt for a fortune or an awesome death.

Lacey's Gameplay
Lacey brings her moves from the Saloon to the Battlefield and will dance, roll or slide her way to victory. Before the dust settles, she’ll wrangle her enemies or force them to break out in a boogie before ending their misery with her trusty Shotgun.

"SOMEBODY GET GEARTOOTH A GUN TO EAT!"
Geartooth is the human equivalent of a cannonball-sized bullet shaped like a fist, with a heart of gold to fall back on. Once the most decorated (and most cybernetically-repaired) commando in the entire galaxy, a life without war left Geartooth with a whole in his soul. He’s come to New Montana seeking the thrill of warfare, the bounty of treasure, and the constant sound of gunfire.

Geartooth's Gameplay
True to his backstory, the man really does eat bullets and brushes off explosives like flies. Being in the military, he’s seen some tough things, but always knows how to bring up the morale of his troops. And if he ever gets lonely in the jungle, his AI turret, ‘Milkshaker’ is there to keep him company and watch his 6.

“Will he scratch? Will he bite? WILLY PUNCH!”
A cat in boxing gloves with an addiction to monster hunting (yes, you read that right.) Willy’s existence is, in and of itself, a complete head-scratcher. Is he the last in a long line of universally renowned beast-hunting cats? Is he the end result of some mad scientist’s experiments that escaped and embarked on a never-ending quest to rid the universe of monsters? Is he God itself? Nobody knows, and if you ever get close enough to ask him, he’ll put out your lights before you get the chance.

Willy's Gameplay
Willy is little but he packs one hell of a punch. His weapons are his Left and his Right and he truly only wants to hurt people. Watch out for his pounce and uppercut, but you may as well call the morgue yourself if you piss him off. Sometimes he’s cute and will take a nap anywhere though. Strange fella.

“Would you be willing to fill out a survey regarding your death?”
The greatest mind in the universe with the heart of a child and an endless hunger to discover the meaning of life, through the study of death. Born in the heart of a dying star with no known creator, the Angel is a hyper-advanced AI entity based on New Montana for one reason: to satisfy her unexplainable fascination with life itself, by gathering test subjects for her experiments into death.

Angel's Gameplay
A flying Cyborg with precision aim and a real threat to life as we know it, Angel holds celestial power inside of her waiting to burst out. She has some extra mobility layered in to make her quite agile which helps get into great vantage points to give her Sniper Rifle a deadly angle..

“I was born to murder. I learned to charge for it.”
The highest-rated, highest-priced assassin in the universe. The last surviving Mechassassin created by a pseudo-religious terrorist sect called the Order of the Dark Light, K-05 racked up over 1400 kills before they said their first word. Due to a glitch in their programming that causes them to envision the extinction of all life in the universe, K-05 currently plots to fund a campaign of omnicide by working as the galaxy’s most expensive mercenary.

 K-05's Gameplay
A killer that moves in silence, or can disappear in a puff of smoke, K-05 is a master of Murder. His Katana slices through enemies quickly from close, but his Sai can pin targets down at range and pull himself in to get a swift kill. The Premier Assassin in New Montana.

“Murderdogs! Murderdogs! Murderdogs!”
Runaway child of the universe’s richest man and last of the Murderdogs. Born the last of Tarvos Wayward’s daughters, Orion found an escape from her extremely sheltered and strictly-controlled life by joining the New Montana Murderdogs, a hyper-derby team known for their violence. Soon becoming their star player before she was discovered, Tarvos bought and immediately dissolved the team to spite his daughter, for which she burned down his estate and escaped into the night, vowing to take on her own father and everything with his name on it.

Orion's Gameplay 
Orion has a strong penchant to burn everything!..and skate around peacefully while the fire rages. When you’re on her team, she’ll get you back in the fight quicker in multiple ways and when she’s not burning or smoking the place out, she’s picking up penalties for aggressive behaviour.

“Today is the greatest day since yesterday!”
The biggest bucket of bolts that ever blew a hole in the hull of a Hypercruiser. A hobby project by an apprentice roboticist/mechanic, Trax is made of all the scrap her creator Trish ‘liberated’ from bandit vehicles, with a couple of heavy assault cannons thrown in. His personality upload was interrupted by an invasion of Trish’s workshop, during which the half-baked happy-go-lucky Trax blew away the assailants. He now eagerly jumps at the chance to join in the fun with his murderous friends while Trish is away.

Trax's Gameplay
Explosive weapons for hands means some great zone control tools at Trax’ disposal. Being made of car parts, Trish made sure to keep power under the hood and some Spy Gadgets just in case. If the rocket hands weren’t enough, he’s got a few more tucked away for the right time.

Grind on rails, climb up walls, commandeer vehicles and mechs—if you’re standing still, you’re doing it wrong! With a million ways to move around the battlefield, you’re sure to find a method of murder that’s right for you!

Slide
Double Jump
Hop over rails
Run on walls
Climb walls
Slide down walls
Grind on rails
Grapple swing
Grapple Pull
Glide
Hang onto ledges
Teleport using portals



New Montana is a beautiful place to live, once you look past the constant death and destruction. Fight in the city, in the desert in the sky, or on the moon, among other scenic vistas! Don’t stop to take in the landscape, or else that castle might be your crypt!
Tarvosham (Old London)
In its glory days, Tarvosham was the pet project of Tarvos Wayward, whose love of Victorian aesthetics inspired him to design the entire district of New Montana just a short distance from his front door. Powered entirely by steam (generated by underground nuclear power chambers), Tarvosham was strictly for people of class, sophistication, and proper dress sense. On her way out of the burning Wayward Estate, Orion personally lay waste to Tarvosham until its citizens were forced to evacuate. 

High Stratos (Sky City)
Up where the air is clear and the hum of the neutron thrusters lulls you to sleep at night. High Stratos was originally designed to host dignitaries and officials from the Union of Galactic Species on New Montana; with features like luxury accommodation, furnished conference rooms, free WiFi, and a two thousand kilometre vertical separation from the planet’s surface.

Osaka-Ku (Nu Tokio)
Proof that gentrification can happen anywhere, even in space. Osaka-Ku was green-lit as part of a business deal between Tarvos Wayward and macro-industrialist Makemake Gyokai. Gyokai planned to use Osaka-Ku’s economy to buy New Montana for himself, and turned it into a bustling sector for small restaurants and high-rise apartments. However, when Tarvos Wayward began the Treasure Rush and scrapped New Montana’s laws, most of Osaka-Ku’s citizens ditched the planet altogether. 

Marauder Mesa (Wild West)
Technically not a mesa, but bandits aren’t exactly topography majors. Marauder Mesa started out as little more than a camp for the planet’s first settlers. Once its treasures and history were unearthed, they established Harmony Vale with houses, a general store, and—of course—a brothel.

The District
The District is what happens when the guy who owns the planet you’re building a highway on announces he’s scrapping every law on the planet during your lunch break. The District was originally meant to be an interchange and layover spot along highways across New Montana. When Tarvos Wayward threw all of the already crime-riddled planet’s laws into the fire, the entire construction crew abandoned the site to flee the planet before the carnage began. 

The Golden Wasteland
Because of course a planet as worthless as New Montana is half-desert. Don’t let the name fool you; the operative word here is ‘Wasteland’. You’d be hard-pressed to find a tumbleweed in this arid landscape. But one thing you’ll find plenty of? Bones. Just below the shifting, never-ending surface of the sand dunes is a graveyard of foolish treasure hunters, mercenaries and people who never learned how to use a map.

Castle of Aarrgh (The Frozen Post)
Either the owner of this castle died while naming it, or they were just a big Monty Python fan. Not even Tarvos Wayward can explain the existence of this random medieval castle built on a random craggy shore. (Or is it a reef? Maybe a delta…?) The only logical conclusion is that some rich asshole with more time than sanity decided they wanted a castle and spent their life building it. It’s a solid castle, but without a king. Or a kingdom. Or any point to its existence. 
Waypoint Station
There’s a Waypoint Station on almost every planet in the Union of Galactic Species; a contract between them and the Wayward Group made sure of that. One of Tarvos Wayward’s thousands of interstellar spaceports, New Montana’s Waypoint Station is built on its moon, Helenia. With space fore even the largest commercial vessels, every Waypoint Station is complete with fuelling points, overnight rooms and a members-only commissary, as well as transports to the planet’s surface. 

The Scarlet Temple (Forest Temple)
The Scarlet Temple is a dark red stain on the Union of Galactic Species’ history. Before the UGS claimed the planet that would eventually be named New Montana, it was the base of the Order of the Dark Light, a pseudo-religious fanatical sect responsible for the abduction and slaughter of millions of children across the universe. They built the temple to house laboratories, where they spliced the DNA of their victims to create the genetically-perfect Mechassassin. Only one such soldier, K-05, ever left the temple. 

Anam-Ka’Rui (Alien Temple)
A mysterious, unsettling structure in the heart of the Golden Wasteland. Its name is said to have been whispered by its discoverer, after he fainted upon setting foot inside. Tarvos Wayward has yet to formally acknowledge this citadel’s existence, but theories as to its origin continue to pop up on conspiracy networks across the galaxy.

NOWWA (Now, Winners Announced) is an independent studio run by Yohami Zerpa, which develops casual games for mobile platforms. In 2017, after nearly two decades of developing games for other studios, Yohami decided to go indie and create a game that mixed all his favourite influences from media and culture, ranging from victorian horror to futuristic cyberpunk, talking boxing cats and AI androids, ninjas and pirates. A few months and prototypes later BulletVille was born. Yohami is the main driving creative force, art director and manager.
NOWWA is comprised by an all-stars team:

 Robert brings his AAA experience with networking, replication and server side code, and a vast knowlege of the intricacies of the Unreal Engine, supported by Mohamed 
 Lewis polishes the locomotion sets and makes sure everything runs smooth and feels smooth for the players, with an obsessive eye for detail
 Phil and Nicola use their genius in marketing and social media to make sure the world knows about BulletVille
 Garrett works as game designer, level designer and keeps an eye on all tasks and brings structure into the project, with a cool head and a calm hand
 Robbin and Blaze are talented level designers that know how to adapt their creations for BulletVille's high mobility. 
 Breiner, Aaron and Siavesh do the rigs and animations
 Joshua, Scott, Russ, Dragos, Alexandr bring the very diverse locations of New Montana into life with environment design and stylized textures
 Siavash is an amazing animator who brings our heroes to life! 
 AkiraX3, Jesus, Mauro, Arty work on 2D design, interfaces, banners and logos
 Kyle, Joe, Kevin, Romain and Christian turn the concepts into 3D models, characters and props
 Peter, Crackers, Alexis take care of the lighting and shaders
 Stiven is a talented kid who works on UI and game modes
 Nick uses his long experience with SFX design to make our sound palette unique and distinctive
 Jask takes care of our community, especially the huge BulletVille Discord
Emmy-winner Oscar Fogelström creates our lush and rich soundtrack, with collaboration from Murray Atkinson 
Mega-talented writer / voice actor Reece Bridger brings life to Trax, is writing every line of dialogue & lore and, last but not least, handles casting and management of other voice actors - our illustrious list includes Aimee Smith, Alexis Monteith, Cassie Ewulu, Daniel Dorse, Griffin Puatu, Jenna Kathleen, Lizzie Hofe, Malcolm Ray, P.M. Seymour, Terrance Drye, Thaddeus Walster, Tom Schalk and Yong Yea! 
And Tim watches in the back taking care of admin and finance 



Because we’re an independent game studio with big goals and bigger dreams.
We’ve gotten this far bootstrapping the project as a REAL indie game, untarnished by pesky big corporations and dirty publisher tactics, and we’d like to keep it that way!
We’ve got private backing that allowed us to get this far, and enough to finish the core game.

How does this Kickstarter campaign and a backing of 100,000 USD help us? 
Well, the funding will allow us to grow our team and do QA, pay for artists and external developers to speed things up, do more skins, maps, game modes, and heroes.
Every dollar above our target will speed up development of the game and extend its scope even more - your pleasure!
Here’s what you can do to help!
 Like, share and retweet this video (link) recapping our kickstarter to new players!
   Back our campaign! 
https://discord.gg/xP32KCRj
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Writing highly complex software such as video game code with numerous components has the implicit risk of bugs that cannot be easily identified or fixed. But our indie studio team consists of people all around the world who really know what they're doing. The accumulated experience of certainly more than 100 years in game development and the transparency we always provided on our progress with BulletVille is the insurance that you get your reward in time.

We are self-funded out of personal income and proceeds from casual games we made so BulletVille will be launched in any case, it's just a question of time and scope - your backing will allow to deliver the beta/full version earlier and with more maps, heroes, modes and skins.

Covid is a risk and could slow down development but will not prevent us from delivering BulletVille and the most impacted part is the time and place of the BulletVille release party due to travel and social gathering restrictions. We will communicate according to the further developments.

By far the biggest risk, which we are also unable to mitigate completely, is—Tarvos Wayward himself. 
Given his fortunes, he may snap up all available rewards, just to show he can. Like the dog that licks… you known... Tarvos may even be capable to takeover Kickstarter itself, so be quick in backing us! ;-)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Sustainable Distribution
Physical items shipped with Green mailing service or transported by ourselves (to the BulletVille release party). Flight CO₂ offsetting via https://www.atmosfair.de/en, if train usage in the first place is not feasible.

campaign.story:
IMAGINE WE HAD A PERFECT REPLICA OF THE AMAZON – A DIGITAL TWIN – WITH EVERY ROCK, TREE, AND SETTLEMENT CAPTURED IN HIGH-RESOLUTION 3D 
What could we do with that information?
We could map trees and document their size, height, width -- maybe even their species -- and calculate how much carbon they contain.
We’d discover where water moves through the landscape.
We can help level the playing field by delivering high-resolution data to local stakeholders to help them defend land rights. 
We’d learn about the rich history and prehistory of this region, find unknown archaeological sites, ancient road networks, and ecological treasures.
We could better measure and map carbon stocks
But perhaps most importantly -- we'd know whether our efforts to fight the climate crisis were working.
WE ONLY HAVE ONE SHOT TO SAVE THIS PLANET. THERE'S NO MARGIN FOR ERROR. AS SCIENTISTS, WE NEED DATA TO KNOW WHAT WORKS.
Right now, in 2021, that dataset DOES NOT EXIST. 
The answer? A high-resolution LiDAR scan of the Earth's surface, starting with the areas most threatened. 
Courtesy of Conscious Design // Unsplash
IT SOUNDS LIKE SCIENCE FICTION, BUT WE ALREADY HAVE THE TECHNOLOGY TO DO THIS.
And, it’s happened before.
In 2019, we watched in horror as the Notre Dame Cathedral went up in flames. The iconic spire collapsed and the roof was all but destroyed.
Miraculously, though, art historians Andrew Tallon and Paul Blaer scanned the Cathedral using LiDAR in 2010.
Image created by Andrew Tallon & Paul Blaer
Now, their LiDAR scan is the most comprehensive record of the Cathedral and it’ll be invaluable to the reconstruction.
 WE NEED A SCAN LIKE THAT, BUT FOR THE AMAZON 
We’ve already lost 50 percent of the world’s rainforests, we’re losing 18 million acres of forest each year, and rising sea levels will make whole cities, countries, and continents unrecognizable.
Unless we have a record of these places, no one in the future will even know they existed.
Organizations like CyArk are doing incredible work to scan historical monuments. But nothing similar exists for the earth’s landscapes – until now.
Profile of a LiDAR point cloud from a tropical forest

I’m Dr. Chris Fisher, National Geographic Explorer, archaeologist, husband, and father.
I was trained as a traditional archaeologist, using methodologies that’ve been around since the 50’s.
That all changed in July 2009 in Michoacán, Mexico, when I stumbled across an ancient urban megalopolis – 26 square kilometers – a lost city with thousands of building foundations. An archaeological site so big that it would take me decades, the entire rest of my career, to survey fully.
Instead, my colleague Steve Leisz, suggested using a new technology, LiDAR, Light Detection And Ranging.
LiDAR involves shooting a dense grid of infrared beams from an airplane toward the ground. What you get is a high-resolution scan of the earth’s surface and everything on it. Not an image but a dense 3-D cloud of points, like this:
PLAY

In just 45 minutes, the LIDAR scan collected the same amount of data as what would’ve taken decades by hand!
Every house foundation, road, building, terrace, and pyramid in incredibly high resolution, representing thousands of people who were born, loved, lived, and died in these spaces. And what’s more – the quality of these data was not comparable to traditional archaeological research – it was much, much better.
I knew this technology would change the entire field of archaeology in the coming years, and it did.
The next time we used LiDAR in my work, it became the subject of Douglas Preston’s book, The Lost City of the Monkey God.
Courtsey of Douglas Preston
That book became an instant bestseller (maybe you’ve read it!) but most importantly, it showed the potential of LiDAR – as a tool for archaeologists, ecologists, and geologists. But also, for conservation.
It made me wonder -- what if we used LiDAR to scan the entire Earth? It would be one of the greatest data sets in human history. A perfect record of our planet at one moment in time.
That idea became The Earth Archive, a non-profit organization & mission I launched from the TED Stage in 2019:
THE EARTH ARCHIVE IS AN UNPRECEDENTED SCIENTIFIC EFFORT TO LIDAR SCAN THE ENTIRE SURFACE OF THE EARTH, BEFORE ITS TOO LATE
Its purpose is threefold:
1) Create a baseline record of the earth as it is today to more effectively mitigate the climate crisis. The only way to measure change is to compare two sets of data – a before and an after. Right now, we don’t HAVE a high-resolution “before” data set for most of the planet. So we don’t know how things are changing and whether our efforts to combat climate change are making a positive impact. These data can be used by local stakeholders and indigenous groups to help solve issues of land tenure and conservation. Part of our mission is to help build grass roots capacity to store and use these data at the community level. 
2) Build a virtual planet, a digital twin, accessible to any number of scientists so we can better understand our world today. Archaeologists like me can discover undocumented settlements. Ecologists can study forest composition, tree size, age, and distribution. Earth scientists can study hydrology, geology, and ecosystems. And planners can use all this information to design sustainable conservation areas, the best places to put needed infrastructure, and resilient and sustainable communities.
 Preserve a record of the earth for our grandchildren’s grandchildren so they can study & recreate our lost cultural and ecological heritage. As science & technology advance, they’ll apply tools, algorithms, and AI to LiDAR records collected today, ask questions, and analyze them in ways that we can’t currently conceive of. We see this as the ultimate legacy that we can leave for future generations. 
Like Notre Dame, we can’t imagine how these records will be used, but we know that they’ll be critically important.
WE'RE MAKING THIS DATA AVAILABLE TO SCIENTISTS AROUND THE WORLD -- FOR FREE.
The Earth Archive is what scientists need to more effectively fight the climate crisis
Courtesy of Ryk Porras // Unsplash
WE KNOW IT WORKS BECAUSE WE’VE DONE IT BEFORE
Since founding the Earth Archive, we’ve brought together a broad coalition of partners including:
Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais
Instituto Colombiano de Antropología e Historía
Universidade de São Paulo
Universidad Tecnológica de Pereira
MapBiomas 
Leaning on 30+ years of research experience in Latin America, we’ve cultivated relationships with local government officials, indigenous peoples, scholars, and stakeholders who are eager to get started. We are helping to jump-start local grass roots efforts.  In other words --
We have the technology, our team is ready, we have permission to do the scans, and the only thing we need to scan is YOUR support.

An example of recent deforestation
Image taken from LiDAR showing deforestation
HERE’S HOW YOU CAN HELP
Every $60,000 we raise covers the cost of scanning a 300 km2 region of the Amazon – that includes hiring local pilots to fly & operate the LiDAR machine, then transfer, backup, and store the data.
The more you fund, the more we scan!
… and the more we understand, conserve, and preserve.
The more we scan, the cheaper it gets. Scanning the entire Amazon will cost roughly $20 million. We will accomplish this – it’s only a matter of time.

HERE’S WHAT YOU’LL RECEIVE
Check out the side panel for full details on our 10 INCREDIBLE prize backs >>>
But first, a preview:
Courtesy of Chris Sarsgard // Unsplash
Join me on a fly-fishing day trip in my home state of Colorado, capped off with a night at one of Fort Collins’ most beloved restaurants. It’s the vacation you need and don’t want to miss. Ask me anything – and let’s see if you can catch more fish (you can’t, sorry).
We teamed up with designer Jennifer Silbert of Rewilder to create a Zero Waste Earth Archive backpack using upcycled materials (airbags!). Each backpack diverts the equivalent CO2 from the landfill as planting 6 trees, driving 300 miles in a passenger car, or charging your smartphone every night for 49 years!

And finally, if you’re looking to leave a legacy…
Courtesy of Andres Martina // Unsplash
Our highest prize includes your name & inscription in the Metadata of the Earth Archive. Now and in the future, people will know your name because of the contribution you made.
Pick your prize in the side panel. You can’t go wrong! >>>
WHEN YOU INVEST IN THE EARTH ARCHIVE, YOU’RE INVESTING IN THE FUTURE OF HUMANKIND.
You’re betting on the survival of our species.
In the power of science and technology to improve our lives.
In our collective goodwill and our love for the Earth.
We hope you’ll join us in preserving our planet – one LiDAR scan at a time.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risks when LiDAR scanning are weather and equipment malfunction or failure. In either case, the scan would be rescheduled for a later date.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
The Earth Archive is designed to last as long as we do -- we meaning the human species. If all goes according to plan (and we won't live long enough to know if it does!), 4,000 years in the future, humans will study our world using the data we collected in 2021. Just like how we study ancient Egypt using hieroglyphics from 2000 BC. Find us a Kickstarter project with a longer-lasting design than that!
Reusability and recyclability
All of our prizes were chosen with reusability in mind -- the t-shirt & backpack all can be reused again & again. 3/10 prizes have no physical component whatsoever, which is also intentional.
Sustainable materials
The zero-waste REWILDER backpack is made from upcycled material from car airbags. Designed to save lives, this high tech airbag material is sourced from factory end rolls trashed during airbag production. Each airbag backpack diverts the equivalent CO2 from the landfill as planting 6 trees, driving 300 miles in a passenger car, or charging your smartphone every night for 49 years!
Sustainable Distribution
Whenever possible, we will pack your prizes in the same eco-friendly package to reduce shipping waste & carbon emissions from unnecessary shipping.
Something else
The Earth Archive's entire mission is to gather & distribute data to help scientists understand & mitigate the effects of climate change. Sustainability is our #1 value and the reason for doing this Kickstarter.

Amazon Scan Digital Download

Amazon Scan Digital Download

Take a trip up North, and you’ll find Chris Fisher fly fishing in the rocky rivers of Northern Colorado. support.title: Peak Performer
support.descp:
In one of the most remote corners of the Amazon rainforest stands Pico de Neblina, a 9827 foot rock pyramid, the tallest mountain in Brazil. It’s been there for thousands of years, watching over the forest, and it will be there, as far as we know, for thousands of years to come.
If you’ve made it this far, you aren’t looking for a souvenir, you’re looking to leave a legacy. That’s why our highest prize includes your name & inscription in the Metadata of the Earth Archive.
Now and in the future, people will know your name because it was right there all along.
INCLUDES:
Your name and/or custom inscription in the Earth Archive metadata
Any other prize on this list that you desire

comments.content: Sorry to hear the campaign failed. Reminds me of the old saying, "The Pentagon can easily get billions for new weapons projects but public schools have to hold bake sales to get enough school supplies for teachers and children."

This is such a great idea and it deserves much more attention. I only found it by clicking on the projects ending soon tab in the app. I hope you are planning a relaunch and trying ways to spread the word about this so that it gets to more eyes. There are more than enough purple interested in something like this to get it funded, you just have to find them.
I know I would have missed this project entirely if I hadn’t gotten an email from Kickstarter that listed this as one of the “Projects we love”. It was, sadly, the first I heard of this project.

I agree with the earlier posters though, crowdfunding is almost an art and a successful project often has a specific and labor intensive plan for the 30 day funding period. The guys over at wyrmwood gaming have had some incredibly successful projects, and have i think, put out several videos on what goes into a successful kickstarter.
For support gadgets or support videos games there are peoples but for scientific projects :/

Part of the problem is likely that people haven’t heard of it. It only got mentioned to me yesterday, the lack of activity in regards to updates and comments is also a factor. This project is nearing the end of 30 days and it has 7 comments. As for gadgets and games getting better funding, that is do to several factors; both have very active online communities that will hype up projects, another is that there are more of them on Kickstarter this means they get recommended to people who have already backed similar projects.
Oh no! If this doesn’t get funded - what about my doppelgänger??? That was legit my favorite part of this! (Although I think if it was a backer level thing, people would have opted in!!!)

This campaign is really interesting, it's a real shame that there haven't been any updates. I think the lack of activity might put people off. With such a big goal and such a large finding ask I think the project would have benefited from some more updates and more community engagement, so that people passed this project on to others and perhaps there would have been more of a chance of hitting the target. Unfortunately, even though I love this project, it doesn't seem like it'll get close to funding in the time left. If you ever decide to relaunch the project I hope you keep this in mind
I would add as part of the linguist tier having Croo(Cloo?) as well as other Amazonian Indigenous languages would be a fantastic choice.

campaign.story:
In 2020, I returned home from another tour with Schäffer the Darklord and the Doubleclicks to a world that had drastically changed.  To everyone's surprise, we were all suddenly locked down in an unprecedented quarantine, while my wife and I had our first son during the COVID19 pandemic.  We worked from home, watching as the country became more divided, hoping things would return to normal.  Meanwhile, I started writing new songs, wondering what kind of life our son would have and imagining what the world would be like after this was all over.  Suddenly, I had an album of personal songs ready that documented the whole experience.
A photo by Tyler Harms from my last tour, Feb 2020. Thank you Tyler!
This album's original title was a tribute to one of my favorite Public Enemy records, but I later changed it out of respect for their mission.  The record features insights on fatherhood, cryptocurrency and speculations on what a post-COVID19 world will feel like.  I am offering a few exclusive levels, including digital downloads, CDs, shirts, a USB with rare music (and my entire catalogue) and even a customized acrylic 24" x 30" painting.  Also, you can get customized drawings and songs!
Back in the studio! Joyful smiles!
The album will contain ten brand new tracks and will be available to all Kickstarter supporters at least a week before it is released commercially.  With production by Rich Matthew (who I worked with on Notes from Toontown, the Dewey Decibel System, the Jeff Sessions and more), this album documents an unprecedented year and returns to some of the more familiar rock-aesthetic of my early work.  Thank you all for your continued support these past few years.  
Some of the other albums and projects available on the USB.
I can't wait for you to hear my new album, Blockchain Planet.  Thank you for checking out my new Kickstarter campaign and for your support.

Your homie,
MC Lars
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As having released music via Kickstarter for ten years, I have learned to keep goals and promises manageable and will continue to work with trustworthy partners to make the best project possible in the perfect amount of time. 
 
My combined track record for release consistency and intense touring histories should give any backer reasonable assurance that I will complete this project on time, and that it will be even better than imagined!
 
The album will continue to come together quickly, and if there are any unexpected delays, I will let everyone know ASAP.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Cristina Agostini-Fitch, Chris McNabb, Beck Kitsis, Zach Fleming, and Adam Kolodny tech scouting our location
STRETCH GOAL OF $8,000!!
WOW! Thanks to your overwhelming generosity, love, and support, we have successfully met our initial $17,000 Kickstarter goal for VALENTINE!!! Earlier in the year, if you had told us that any of this would be happening, we never would have believed you. But now, thanks to your incredible help, we have the funds needed to move into production this June, and to do so safely!!! THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!! 
WE ARE OFFICIALLY SETTING A STRETCH GOAL OF $8,000!!! This will not only cover unforeseen location and transportation costs that have developed during the course of pre-production, but also help with our sound mix, color correction, music, DCP, and film festival submissions. With these crucial final steps, we'll finally be able to release the film into the world. OUR CAMPAIGN ENDS ON MAY 20 at 10:30AM ET. It is our hope, that by the end of it, we will have the budget we need to finally share our story.
VALENTINE is a short film about a couple that heads to the Catskills for a romantic getaway. However, over the course of the night, issues surrounding gender & identity threaten to unravel the seams of the relationship.
Nan Goldin
I was 26 years old when I realized that I was transgender. My gender had always been a constant source of tension for me. No one explicitly told me that to be trans was to be othered or hated or laughed at, but they didn’t have to -- it was written into the media I consumed.   
Nan Goldin
When I finally came out as nonbinary, I had already been dating my partner Beck, a ciswoman, for about two years -- it was as much a reckoning with her own identity as it was for mine. Based on a true experience, VALENTINE explores how shifting identities can affect a romantic relationship and test the strengths of love between two people. 
Black Swan (2010)
Too often do I see movies with this type of story end in total rejection of the trans character. In our film, we hope to show a more nuanced relationship in all of its complexities, one that feels authentic to our own lives.
Euphoria (2019)
As a filmmaker, I am committed to creating stories that center the trans experience, so that the next generation of trans kids searching for validation and affirmation can see themselves and their stories reflected back to them onscreen. To have that in my own childhood would have been everything -- perhaps I could have spent more time just living my life, rather than imagining it.
Philip-Lorca diCorcia
Chris McNabb (Co-Writer/Co-Director/Editor)
CHRIS MCNABB (they/them) is a Brooklyn-based filmmaker, two-time Emmy Award-winning editor, and Sundance Documentary Edit & Story Lab Fellow. They edited the feature-length documentary WHOSE STREETS? (Magnolia Pictures), which premiered at the 2017 Sundance Film Festival to critical acclaim and was later nominated for two Gotham Awards, a Critics’ Choice Award, and a Peabody Award. Their past nonfiction work also includes the feature documentary NARROWSBURG (2019 Camden International Film Festival, DOC NYC 2019), the interactive documentary {THE AND} (IDFA 2014), and the accompanying short film {THE AND} MARCELA & ROCK (Sundance Film Festival 2015). In addition, Chris recently edited two short fiction films, THE RAT (Sundance Film Festival 2019) and THE THREE MEN YOU MEET AT NIGHT (Fantastic Fest 2020). Currently, Chris is editing a documentary about a high-profile musician for a major studio. They are also editing WALK BY ME, a follow-up to the 1990 Sundance Filmmaker Trophy Award-winning documentary METAMORPHOSIS.
Whose Streets? ed. Chris McNabb
Beck Kitsis (Co-Writer/Co-Director/Producer)
BECK KITSIS (she/her) is an award-winning filmmaker and musician based in New York City. In 2019, she was selected as a Sundance Screenwriters Intensive Fellow, a Women at Sundance Financing Intensive Fellow, and a member of Film at Lincoln Center’s Artist Academy at the 57th New York Film Festival. Beck’s debut short film THE THREE MEN YOU MEET AT NIGHT (2020 Fantastic Fest) premiered at the Maryland Film Festival and went on to win multiple awards, including Best After Dark Short at the Indie Memphis Film Festival. In addition, Beck produced the documentary NARROWSBURG (Camden International Film Festival, DOC NYC 2019), the short horror film THE RAT (Sundance Film Festival 2019), and the experimental short THE INCONCEIVABLE MOUNTAIN (NoBudge - Best Films of 2019). Currently, Beck is co-writing/producing the Sundance and Cinereach supported feature-length horror film STRAWBERRY SUMMER and in pre-production on her next short film, VALENTINE. Beck also co-founded NITE SHIFT, a New York-based film and media collective formed in 2016. 
The Three Men You Meet at Night, dir. Beck Kitsis
Katy Drake Bettner (Producer)
KATY DRAKE BETTNER (she/her) will produce damn near anything but is most excited about enabling talented creatives to scope, advance, refine, and execute their unique vision. Recent credits include SWALLOW (Tribeca), WILD INDIAN (Sundance), CUSP (Sundance), ALWAYS IN SEASON (Sundance), PRAY AWAY (Tribeca), THE FIGHT (Sundance), and RAISE HELL: THE LIFE & TIMES OF MOLLY IVINS (Sundance). Katy is a member of the Women at Sundance Leadership Council, has served as an advisor for the Sundance Creative Producing Lab and Summit, and has advised for the Women in Film/Sundance financing strategy summit, as well as the Documentary Producers Alliance. In 2019, Katy and Amy Redford (dir. THE GUITAR, pro. PROFESSOR MARSDEN AND THE WONDER WOMEN) created BetRed Stories as a collaboration hub for their shared projects. Katy and her husband Paul Bettner (Words with Friends, Age of Empires, New Super Luckys Tale) founded Playful Studios in McKinney Texas in 2012. She has a specific affinity for the Texas creative community and is most proud of being blocked by the states indicted Attorney General, Ken Paxton.
Zach Fleming (Producer)
ZACH FLEMING (he/him) is a Brooklyn-based producer and filmmaker. He produced the award winning short film PARTY DRESS, which won GirlGaze’s female filmmaker competition, judged by industry heavyweights like Shonda Rhimes, Gia Coppola and Joey Soloway. In the commercial world, he’s produced work for brands like Ben and Jerry’s, Burger King, LoveWellness, and Zola (a commercial for the latter got the CEO of Hallmark to step down), among others. He most recently produced the short film (YOU'LL MAKE IT IN) FLORIDA, which played at dozens of festivals around the world, including Fantastic Fest, Florida Film Festival, IndieLisboa, Sarasota Film Festival, and the Phoenix Film Festival, where it won Best Live Action Short. Zach’s last short film STAYCATION screened at Boston Underground Film Festival and The Lower East Side Film Festival before its online premiere on NoBudge. His music videos have been featured in Spin and Impose Magazine.
Adam Kolodny (Director of Photography)
ADAM KOLODNY (he/him) is an award-winning cinematographer based in New York City. His music videos for Japanese Breakfast, Conor Oberst, Frankie Cosmos, Charly Bliss, Jay Som, and Mannequin Pussy have gained praise from publications like Rolling Stone and Pitchfork (twice appearing on the "Best 25 Music Videos of the Year" list). His work has screened at many festivals, including Sundance, SXSW, and Raindance. Recent credits include the Viceland series THE DEVIL YOU KNOW, the short film THE THREE MEN YOU MEET AT NIGHT (Fantastic Fest 2020), the narrative feature DALE'S LATE, as well as camera work on the 2017 Sundance Grand Jury Award Winner UNREST.
Road Head by Japanese Breakfast, DP. Adam Kolodny
Told Slant (Composer)
TOLD SLANT is the songwriting project of Felix Walworth (they/them), a Brooklyn based lyricist and producer. Walworth started the project in 2011 as a means of marking a stylistic shift in their songwriting, specifically a shift toward understated, ambling arrangements and simple, illustrative lyrics. They have been highlighted as one of the top most influential artists of contemporary independent music on NPR, Pitchfork, The FADER, Rolling Stone, Stereogum, and more. Most recently, they scored the short film THE RAT (Sundance Film Festival 2019).
Port Authority (2019), Casting Director: Kate Antognini
Kate Antognini (Casting Director)
KATE ANTOGNINI (she/her) is a New York-based casting director and street scout for feature films, TV shows, and commercials. Kate's recent credits include the Nathan Fielder-produced narrative-documentary hybrid HOW TO WITH JOHN WILSON for HBO, as well as the feature-length films GOLDIE (Berlin 2019) and PORT AUTHORITY (2019), which was executive produced by Martin Scorsese and premiered at Cannes Un Certain Regard. Currently, she is casting RUNNER, a feature from Cinetic & Easy Riders films.
Cristina Agostini-Fitch (Production Designer)
CRISTINA AGOSTINI-FITCH (she/her) is a production designer, art director, and prop stylist who splits her time between New York and Puerto Rico. Recent credits include (YOU’LL MAKE IT IN) FLORIDA (2020), BREAKING AND ENTERING (2020), and THE ENTITLEMENT (2018), as well as music videos for Gabriel Garzón and Pinc Louds. She also works in the commercial wold with clients like La Mer, Essie, and Maybelline.
Amit Gajwani (Costume Designer)
AMIT GAJWANI (he/him) was born in Mumbai, India. At the age of 12, he moved to the United States. The confluence of the two cultures has had a direct affect on his approach to design. He also found a love for historical costumes during his travels around the world. The combination of historic and cultural influences are evident in his designs. Amit’s work can be seen around the world in celebrity commercials, fashion advertisements, and films. Recent film credits include BRAID (Tribeca Film Festival), KATIE SAYS GOODBYE (Toronto Film Festival), WHY NOT CHOOSE LOVE: A MARY PICKFORD MANIFESTO, ODD MAN RUSH, and MODERN PERSUASION.
Katie Says Goodbye (2016), Costume Designer: Amit Gajwani
Isadora Dias Vieira (Assistant Director)
ISADORA DIAS VIEIRA (she/her) is a versatile filmmaker working to build groundbreaking narratives that challenge the status quo. She believes that dismantling the dominant gaze in cinema can also be an inside job. Most invariably her work and research is about the representation of women and underrepresented or misrepresented realities in media. With over ten years of industry experience, she has worked for some of the biggest production companies in the world navigating through fiction, documentary and experimental film.
Anthony Thompson (Production Sound)
ANTHONY THOMPSON (he/him) is a sound mixer and audio visual technician who has worked in narrative and documentary production for a number years. Recent credits include THE THREE MEN YOU MEET AT NIGHT (2020), DON'T LOOK (2018), CREEDMORIA (2016), FALL TO RISE (2014), and GIMME THE LOOT (2012).
Elle Simone (Production Assistant)
ELLE SIMONE (she/her) is an actor, writer, production and media consultant, and all around jack-of-all-trades from Southern New York. She recently worked on films such as JUST CHICKEN and OLD HEN, as well as projects for Penguin Random House Audio, The Laurie Berkner Band, and Queer Kid Stuff. She graduated from Ithaca College in 2015, focusing on acting and theatre studies. She graduated from SUNY Westchester in 2018, studying Digital Filmmaking. She is currently working on starting a Twitch channel and developing her own original content.
Irene Dambriunas (Production Assistant)
IRENE DAMBRIUNAS (she/her) is a pastry chef and baking instructor based in Queens, NY. She has been working in restaurants, coffee shops, and bakeries across NYC since 2014, and she always has loud, heavy tunes playing while she works. Pies are her favorite dessert to prepare, often drawing inspiration from horror movies and fantasy elements in her pie crust designs. She believes that scones are a truly underappreciated pastry. Currently, Irene is an instructor and recipe developer for Invictus Enterprises, a non-profit organization training neurodivergent young adults to run their own bakery in Brooklyn. You can check out more of her work on Instagram at @blackmetalpastrychef.
Keiran McCann (Graphic Designer)
KEIRAN MCCANN (she/her) is a Brooklyn-based design professional with 8+ years of experience. She has a unique ability to bring creative, project management and effective strategy together – a skillset honed from her educational, professional, and personal experiences. With innovative thinking, passion and collaboration, her goal is to elevate the brands she works with by producing beautiful designs that meet business objectives. She is currently working as the Design Director for the real estate fin-tech startup EasyKnock, where she is responsible for conceptualizing, creating, and managing the output of design collateral across a multitude of channels.
We are currently in pre-production and aiming to move into production this June. In order to do so, we need to raise at least $17,000 to rent camera gear, lighting equipment, props, costumes, and -- most importantly -- to cover COVID costs to keep our team safe.
We believe that producing VALENTINE will ultimately help make more room for future stories from queer and nonbinary filmmakers. Making this film as a grassroots, independent production will ensure that we are able to tell our story with unwavering commitment to authenticity and social impact. However, this approach comes with its fair share of challenges. In order to take on this project and raise the funds necessary to make the film, we are asking for the generous support of our community.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any other short film, there are financial risks involved in producing VALENTINE. While we will continue to apply for more grants, we are aware that they are incredibly competitive, so we cannot rely on grant funding to finance our film. Instead of putting the fate of our project in the hands of a few decision-makers, we have decided to turn to our community of friends, filmmakers, and activists at Kickstarter to fundraise the additional money we need to make VALENTINE a reality.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear Valentines,
WOW!!!! THANK YOU!!!! We can’t believe we’re writing this update right now, but thanks to your overwhelming generosity, love, and support during these first five days, we have successfully met our initial $17,000 Kickstarter goal for VALENTINE!!! Earlier in the year, if you had told us that any of this would be happening, we never would have believed you. Even just a couple of months ago, Beck and I simply couldn’t imagine a world without quarantine, never mind a world where we might be able to raise the budget necessary to make our film. But now, thanks to your help, we have the funds needed to move into production this June, and to do so safely. THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!!

campaign.story:
Hello Everyone!! 
     This album has been something I’ve wanted to do for a long time and its finally coming to fruition!  My singer/songwriter pseudonym K.C. Jones has been a side project I’ve done for a while but never released a record as and I am so proud and full of love for this album as a whole.  Unfortunately everything is expensive and I have accrued a good bit of debt over this passion project.  If you can help me get it out there to the world friends and neighbors, I would be forever grateful.  This has been a financial sinkhole of a year but I’m trying to keep on trucking and produce art even if it means doing one of these crowdfunding situations that I’ve never done before!  “Queen Of The In Between” includes ten of my original songs that I recorded in Eunice, LA in the spring of 2019 with some of my best friends and favorite musicians- Joel Savoy, Chris Stafford, Jim Kolacek, Trey Boudreaux, Megan Constantin, and Leah Graeff.  We all put our heart and soul into this album and I am ecstatic for you all to hear it!  Any and every donation of any amount is appreciated, and I’ve got some sweet little goodies as rewards too, so check them out and check out the project regardless of your ability to donate.  Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and please keep supporting music and the arts in any way you can.
With love and gratitude to you all, 
              Kelli Jones
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I suppose the biggest risk involved in this is that I (and everyone that has worked on the project) have put so much energy, love, and money into this all because we believe in it and think it’s an amazing project that we want everyone to be able to hear, I would hate for all of us to come out in debt and regretting any part of this process. This is a challenging age to put out original music and to get it out into the world, but we’re attempting it nonetheless, so any help is amazingly appreciated!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Spirit Crisis is a 2D adventure video game depicting a dark tale set in a mad time  when the Inquisition often deals with cases of heresy, witchcraft, demonic possession, vampirism and sanctification.
What's good or bad? You will have to choose through unusual events. Only the most audacious players will be able to solve their inner moral conflict.
Become a night agent and deal with hilarious and mysterious characters who will take you through an undergroud XV century experience. Are you prepared for this legendary  adventure?
REFERENCES
Video games such as CASTLEVANIA, INDIGO PROPHECY and MANIAC MANSION  were very important references in the development of the conceptual ideas and mechanics.
Inspired by legendary historical characters, anthropology and mythology of Europe, the gamer will interact within an approached, fantastic and parodic context of the XV century.
FEATURES 
2D side-scrolling adventure platformer video game.
Walk, run, jump, climb, push and pull objects, interact, talk, work, research, think and decide the path of your game with a complete new old-fashioned moral mental system. 
All the characters and tiles were drawn pixel by pixel, and animated frame by frame. 
15 chapters to discover amazing landscapes, ruins and dungeons through the town and the coast. A wild environment adapted to the adventure narrative.
5 unexpected crazy bosses.

A DARK VIDEO GAME SIMPLE TO PLAY.

SYNOPSIS 
SUMMER, 1498 
A remote village on the coast of Italy is going through a dark age. A wave of misery hit people with repression. Taxes and confiscations are paid to maintain a paranoid institution, the Holy Inquisition. 
A commission had been sent to the town due to allegations of desecration of holy places and public disorder that occurred during the feast of 1st. of May of the previous year. Since the establishment of the holy office, the midwife has been judged and executed, another woman is a fugitive, and for a month the oldest of the fishermen has been imprisoned accused of heresy, necromancy and conspiracy against the Mother Church.
My name is Francesco Endymion. Here I am in the temple, mesmerised by the threatening speech addressed to those who dare to leave the Lord’s Way. IT ALL BEGINS NOW!
THE CHARACTERS 
LANGUAGES 
 English, Spanish and Italian.

SKETCHES 


ARS NOCTEM CREW  
ABOUT ME
My name is Jorge Crepaldi. I’m a 33 year old Architecture graduate with an interest in anthropology, mythology and underground culture. I’m currently unemployed and I have coped with the pandemic by focusing on the creation of this video game.
When I decided to give shape to Spirit Crisis, I prepared myself studying narrative, game development, animation, game scene design, game characters design, some heretics books, and video game programming. I really hope you join this project and be part of what became a complete start up dream for me.

I've received invaluable help during the production from a crew of Inquisitors in charge of the assessment of the project.  
Jessika Martínez -La China-: Architect. Campaign coordinator.
Alfredo Cortez -Cagua-: Graphic Artist.  He’s making a hand art work to accompany the text narrative.  
Maurizio Crepaldi -Er Nano-: Astronomy enthusiast.  He’s making the astronomy map according to the time and the mysterious Italian location.  
 Alejandra Granda -Ale-: Architect.  English translator.  
 Melissa Gonzales -Meli-: Journalist.  Italian translator. 

 Thank you guys for all your time and dedication.
HOW WILL I USE THE MONEY ?
Your economic contributions will go towards reaching the stretch goals, keeping me focused on finishing the game on time, as well as compensating the crew for their precious help. 
Part of the money will go to taxes and production costs. 
Thank you all for giving me strength to make this video game possible.
THE PROGRESS
At the time of releasing this campaign, I have been able to solve  all the necessary mechanics that allow me to guarantee the development of the rest of the game without further difficulties. Also, the narrative of the story is completed. All the animations for the players, the NPCs, and objects are 90% ready. The scenes are 20 % ready. The rest of the artwork is in the process of being digitalized.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge of this campaign is the sound effects. Yet, I’m working on it, and I rely on the technical support needed to deliver a proper result. Once the stretch goal number 3 is reached, the sound effects will be delegated to a specialist. 

The risk is that I’m currently looking for a job. In any case, I’m very good at managing my time and I’m fully committed to this campaign and to give the rewards in the stipulated times. 

I’ll notify all the advances of the production to the supporters through the Kickstarter account,Twitter and Instagram. Any consultation should preferably be made by e-mail.

Email: spiritcrisis@hotmail.com

Instagram: spiritcrisis.videogame

twitter: @crisis_spirit

https://spirit-crisis.itch.io/
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey all! I've got lots of information for you this month.
To start off, I wanted to share with you the Deep Iron set of weapons that will be coming out in the Farmlands. You'll be able to get deep iron ore in which you can craft ingots and craft lots of other fun things.

updates.update_userinfo: May updates and other exciting news!
updates.update_content:
Hey All!
It's been a great month! After my last post about farming, the dedicated testers have been hard at work testing the balance and crops. With tweaks and adjustments, I think we have finally settled on the right mix of what farming should be. Here is a picture from one of our testers who planted everything that will be available in the Farmlands! Can you guess what each crop is?

Hey everyone!
This week Kindred and I have been working on our jam game for our community game jam. Along with that, I've also been working on something really fun: farming and cooking for Swords 'n Magic!
I've been behind the scenes balancing (with the help of DD, one of our amazing community moderators) and creating seeds to farm and recipes to cook. Kindred will be making me all the models I need so we can get it in the game and out to our dedicated testers to start testing the balance and feel of farming, then cooking will come shortly after for testing.

Hey everyone!
Sorry for the lack of updates lately. March was kind of a crazy month for me, thanks to Janna's surgeries and us being in and out of hospitals. But luckily she's fully recovered now and we're back to work like usual.
Right now the game is in a bit of a state of transition. We had a lot of loose ends to tie up before the Farmlands would be ready to release and part of those loose ends is tidying up some back end code. Some of our features were haphazardly dropped into the game due to deadline crunches and those features are now wreaking havoc on our performance and workflow. So while we sand off the rough edges in the Farmlands, write some more quests and lore and introduce all sorts of new creatures and enemies to the zone, Moz is working hard on overhauling some of our older systems to run better for this big update.

Hey everyone,

This is a pretty big announcement to make and it's taken me a few days to figure out everything that needs to be said.

TL;DR: My wife is going through some medical problems and I'm juggling family and the game the best I can right now. The team and I have also decided to hold back game updates for the time being while we finish up some big features like the Mac build, crafting, housing and the next zone.

Swords ‘n Magic and Stuff is NOW LIVE! I can’t believe we’ve made it to Early Access. This couldn’t have happened without your support.
Swords ‘n Magic has been developed alongside its community since the very beginning on Twitch, on Discord, and now on Steam. Our community has always given their input on every aspect of the game. We feel that this is the only way for Swords ‘n Magic to rise to its full potential - hand in hand with the community, with your feedback and support the whole way through and we can’t thank you enough for it. This is why Early Access was an obvious and easy choice for us.
