campaign.story:
I posted my first guitar version of a video game theme on YouTube about 8 years ago now and I absolutely fell in love with recreating themes that shot me back to cherished times of my childhood. I haven't stopped since and I know that right now I'm better than I ever have been. This album will easily be the best thing I've ever released. I guarantee it will be bigger, better and more epic than ever.
In the past I've had very limited budgets to make albums. You can help me smash that barrier and make this album everything that I know it can be.
Kickstarter is all or nothing, so if you want this album to see the light of day pre-order it right here to make it happen!
Even if you're unable to pre-order the album please SHARE this page if you want to help this project. Sharing is caring. And if you don't share you are a square. That rhymes so you know it's true.
The album artwork will once again be created by the great Jean-Pascal Fournier.
I think I've come up with some pretty awesome rewards so check 'em out.
We can make an insanely kickass album together!
STRETCH GOALS:
$12,500 [VICTORY!]: I will make an ENTIRE ADDITIONAL ALBUM of epic Movie/TV themes and send a digital copy to EVERY backer that receives Versus Video Games 3.
$15,000 [VICTORY!]: Physical CD versions of the Movie/TV theme album to every backer of a physical tier. This is something I've wanted to do for a long time and have had a lot of requests for. I would love to be able to do it properly and give you guys even more for your pledges.
$20,000: I realize this is a long shot, but if we're able to accomplish this goal I am going to make another entire EP (5-8 songs) based on one game or a game series. Which game/series it is will be left to the votes of backers and all backers will receive the EP via digital download
If you're unfamiliar with my YouTube channel, here's a taste of some of the videos I've made through the years:
Thank you for being awesome and for making my musical journey what it is. I love making these albums and I'm so grateful to you for making it possible.
- Daniel

The only risk is failing to reach the goal. Kickstarter is all or nothing so I would have to rethink how I can accomplish this project. 

Other than that, barring some horrible accident that involves me losing my arms, there's no risk of it not happening. I've made albums and fulfilled pre-orders several times before.

campaign.story:
Help us fund a feature-length documentary about the people who create and use cryptocurrency. Wait, what's cryptocurrency? We're glad you asked. It's a new form of digital money that's based on math, consensus, and sharing. Bitcoin is the best-known form of this stuff, but there are many "coins" (known as "altcoins," meaning alternatives to Bitcoin). All money comes from a shared agreement: we decide it has value, and then it does. These new currencies are an evolution in that process, and computers are involved.
But technology aside, we're focused on the personal stories of the people directly involved in creating cryptocurrencies and building the communities that surround them. The media usually focuses on fear-mongering (“Bitcoin was used to launder money!”) or hype (“this changes everything!”). We’re cutting through the noise to tell more personal stories, which are just as fascinating.
We're a documentary team based in Portland, Oregon. Specifically:
Adam Cornelius is the award-winning director of the documentaries Ecstasy of Order: The Tetris Masters and People Who Do Noise.
Adam's films have screened to hundreds of thousands of people in theaters, film festivals, galleries, museums, and online. His most recent, Ecstasy of Order: The Tetris Masters, won the Audience Award at the Austin Film Festival and premiered at the International Documentary Festival Amsterdam, the largest festival of its kind. Here are some smart quotes about EOO:
"…one of the best video game films of all time."  -Destructoid
"…will delight fans of the highly addictive game." -Variety
"…there are intriguing characters and dramatic showdowns, and the film does a solid job of building up its central mystery…" -Wired
Chris Higgins is a writer. He contributes to This American Life, Mental Floss, The Atlantic, The Magazine, and has written a few books.
Chris has been in print for more than 20 years. He's also a widely published photographer and former professional sound guy. Here are some good reads:
Rise of the Unipiper - The origin story of Portland's unicycling, bagpiping, cosplaying hero.
He Took a Polaroid Every Day, Until the Day He Died - A man's life in pictures.
Did Blowing into Nintendo Cartridges Really Help? - Answering our generation's greatest question.
We have already interviewed Billy Markus, creator of Dogecoin, the second best-known cryptocurrency (after Bitcoin, of course). We've also shot interviews in New York, Alabama, North Carolina, and Oregon—and that's just the start. Here are a few names to go with the faces you see in the video above.
Josh Wise, NASCAR #98, with the Dogecar
Billy Markus, Dogecoin Creator
Josh Mohland, Dogetipbot Creator
Moolah/Dogecar Crew in Talladega
We have to emphasize: that's a tiny sample of what we've already shot. We've got dozens of hours of interviews spanning four cities, and we're just getting started.
Humans have created currencies for millennia, but it’s rare that we see an entirely new form of currency created and adopted around the world within just a few years. This moment matters. Years from now, people will look back on 2014 as the year cryptocurrency went mainstream (Dogecoin was on broadcast TV, people!). We're here to capture that history as it happens.
In some ways, cryptocurrency is a reaction to the Great Recession; it intersects with an impulse people have to better understand and control how money works. The subjects of this film are regular people with a vision of a new economic reality based on consensus, community, and shared innovation.
Everyone has heard about Bitcoin, but it’s just the tip of the cryptocurrency iceberg. We’re digging into the stories of those who embraced Bitcoin technology and took it to the next level: those who invented new coins, built businesses around them, and created communities to support each other.
We're fascinated by cryptocurrency, and want to make a film that explores the questions it raises. What does the rise of cryptocurrency reveal about the nature of money and economic concepts that we previously took for granted? How will banks and governments react? Why are some people embracing cryptocurrency while others seem to fear it? Why did we blow $1,200 making a mining rig that heated Adam’s apartment this winter?
We're making a film that explains what this stuff is and why it matters. This doesn't mean it'll be boring, but it does mean this film will help explain cryptocurrency to anyone who doesn't know much about it.
We started production on our own dime in January 2014, and we project that we'll keep shooting through at least the end of 2014. Post-production and a festival run will take us through at least the end of 2015.
It's important to point out that while we've been shooting for almost half a year, the core story here has changed several times. Some documentary projects set out to shoot a very controlled situation—those filmmakers have the luxury of knowing exactly what they're going to get on camera, they just need to go there and do that thing. In our case, the story is evolving so fast that we just have to roll with it. We are storm-chasers, speeding along behind (and sometimes inside) a cryptocurrency storm. We hope that by showing you some footage we have so far, and our previous projects, you'll understand that the final film will be awesome, though we can't predict every aspect of what will be in it.
But let's be clear. This documentary has some very specific parameters:
It's a feature film (not a short) that will screen in theaters, in festivals, and online.
It is made by professionals who have done this before.
It is both by and about cryptocurrency nerds. Adam and Chris have both mined various coins, built rigs, and studied this subject.
It features regular people. We're talking to and about the people (like Billy Markus and Josh Mohland) who invent amazing things at home.
We've been shooting for five and a half months now. We have some things to show you.
Adam & Chris in NYC
We traveled to New York City in February to document the first Dogeparty, a celebration of Dogecoin and its culture. It ended with a surprise for the Bull of Wall Street.
We put together the rough cut below based on that trip. (Note: this is truly a "rough cut," meaning it meets our standards for a YouTube video, but not the real film...the real film will have color correction, a proper sound mix, and so on.)
We also flew to Talladega in May to document the Dogecar, a Dogecoin-wrapped NASCAR vehicle driven by Josh Wise and sponsored by the Dogecoin community. Here's another rough cut from that shoot:
We've already got over 20 hours of great footage, but we'll need another 100+ before we're finished—that's where you come in.
Is there a cryptocurrency story we should be covering? We’re listening. We have a solid idea of what we’re looking for, and our backers are invited to help us find it. (The short version: we want compelling narratives driven by people on the ground doing things. New coins, community-building efforts, major or innovative mining/pool activities, activists who are strongly for or against cryptocurrency are all fair game.)
We have our eyes on a bunch of altcoins. We're looking closely at Vertcoin, Darkcoin, Devcoin, Anoncoin, and Ripple. We also see potential in some of the wackier coins like FedoraCoin, Murraycoin, 42 (a Douglas Adams-themed coin), and RonPaulCoin. This is a rich world; it's a matter of finding the best stories within it...and frankly, a coin could be released tomorrow that would take up half our screen time.
As we shoot, we'll release photos, updates from the road, and even some raw footage to backers via Kickstarter. We’ll update you at least once a month throughout this thing, explaining what we’re up to and where we’re headed next. We're looking for your help both in funding the film and in being on-the-ground spotters of important new stuff.
We're also on Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram. Follow along, leave us comments, and join our community!
Here are a few samples of what things look like behind the scenes:
Kyle Drake, crypto-economist, being interviewed
Adam Cornelius setting up a complex shot.
Making a professional documentary isn't cheap. We have the basic gear to do our shoots (cameras, lenses, audio), but we need to pay for:
TRAVEL - We plan more shoots in (at least) New York City, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Seattle, and Portland. If we exceed our basic budget, we'll add more locations.
CREW - While we've shot a lot with our core two-man crew, funds to pay small location crews are necessary.
ANIMATION & SOUNDTRACK - The film will include animation to explain some core cryptocurrency concepts (like the blockchain) alongside expert interviews. We'll pay pro animators (including producer Vince Clemente) to do this right. We're also working with Portland hacker-jazz pioneers Megalo to make the soundtrack.
EDITING - We'll edit the film ourselves. This is a months-long process that we've done before; we need a small budget to give it our full attention during that time.
DISTRIBUTION & PUBLICITY - Getting the film into festivals, theaters, and home video is expensive. We've done this with two feature-length documentaries so far, so we know what this takes. Making a movie is one thing; getting people to watch it is equally important. We have budgeted appropriately.
GEAR - Our basic budget assumes we use the pro gear we've got, but the scope of this film requires some rentals for special occasions. When we need to step it up for a special event, we'll bring in even higher-end gear (for film nerds: read "4K") to capture crucial moments. We're also buying some extra drives for data protection.
The breakdown looks like this:
We're asking for your financial help to make our vision a reality. We're also asking you to join our team in a broader sense—cryptocurrencies are by their very nature communities, and this film is no exception. We want you to help us spot stories that may be falling through the cracks. In return, we promise to deliver a kick-ass film.
Most of the rewards are pretty self-explanatory, but we want to emphasize: all downloadable rewards are DRM-free, region-free, and available anywhere in the world. We're partnering with VHX to offer downloads of both Coined and Ecstasy of Order: The Tetris Masters for backers at the appropriate levels. You'll receive a voucher code to redeem to receive your download(s).
Here's a peek at some of the higher-level rewards:
The CTWC Tetris Cartridge
Note: these are not signed yet! (You get a signed one.)
At the $100 level, you get an NES Tetris cartridge played at the Classic Tetris World Championship. We have a nice pile of these, and they'll be signed by Adam Cornelius (director) and Robin Mihara (star) from Ecstasy of Order: The Tetris Masters. We'll film the signing, just for kicks. Above are three examples of these cartridges, pre-signing.
Note that because these are vintage Tetris cartridges, they do have some wear and tear, but they are all playable (...and they have all been used in championship play). Set your own max-out record in style!
Signed Chris Higgins Books
These are digital. You'll get real ones.
Want signed first editions of Chris's three most recent books? Sure you do! Chris wrote the title essay for Breakfast on Mars, wrote a rad essay for The Magazine: The Book (Year One) about The Classic Tetris World Championship (called Playing to Lose), and wrote The Blogger Abides. He'll sign all these and ship 'em to you. Plus, super-secret bonus, he'll go through his extensive library of mental_floss back issues to find his old work there, sign that TOO, and include it. This is about a week's worth of reading, folks!
Note: the mental_floss issues may not be 100% perfect (some shelf wear), but will be pretty solid. Everything else is in mint condition.
The CTWC Poster
The ultimate Ecstasy of Order super-fan reward: this is a promo poster from the first Classic Tetris World Championship, featured in Ecstasy of Order: The Tetris Masters. It's signed by the main competitors featured in the movie: Jesse, Matt Buco, Trey, Jonas, Harry, Thor, Ben, Dana. Adam and Robin will sign it too, if you want. As far as we know, this is the only poster in the world with these signatures. Has mild wear and tear, plus small mounting holes top and bottom.
"Coined" Mining Rig
Gregg Abbott, Mining Rig Maker
We'll work with Gregg Abbott, Portland food cart owner-slash-mining-rig-maker, to design and build a Coined mining rig. This process will be filmed for the movie's bonus features, showing the same basic steps Adam and Chris went through in December 2013...but with an expert along for the ride. We'll sign the rigs and ship 'em off to you—get a piece of movie memorabilia that happens to be functional!
NOTE: If you can pay your way to Portland, Oregon, come on over and build with us! Please contact us first if you have any questions. Be aware that these rigs are designed and built with education and movie-making in mind; this is not resale of a fancy rig. If you want a fancy mining rig, go buy one from a pro. If you want to see how hobbyists do it and own a piece of signed, onscreen memorabilia, back our project.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Like any documentary film project, the primary risks we face are:

1. Access to people and their stories. We already know that a big part of this film is Dogecoin, and we have lots of Dogecoin related footage already. But to make the film sing, we need several more big stories like this. We're confident that we can secure these stories and bring you a compelling film that weaves them together (finding and telling stories is what we do for a living), but if we're talking about risks, this is #1.

2. Technical problems. Computers burn out, hard drives crash, etc. We have plenty of ways to mitigate these problems. Chris is a former IT guy with tons of experience here, and Adam has made several feature films without losing his footage. We've got this covered.

3. Delays. If you've ever backed a documentary (or any creative project), you know that things can take longer than expected, or a new story might arise that changes everything. Because we have already shot part of the film and have done this stuff before to completion, we believe our timeline is realistic, but part of the project is speculation: what will happen in the coming year? It could change the course of the film, and possibly the timeline.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello internet (and real-life) friends,
We're just a few hours away from the close of the Coined Kickstarter campaign, and obviously the funding goal won't be met. So that's a good news/bad news thing.
The main thing we want to convey today is thank you for your support, and we will keep making things. The specifics of what we make next are hazy; Adam and Chris will be working on another Classic World Tetris Championship this fall, and Chris is working on multiple secret projects. We'll keep you posted as soon as the next project becomes public.
So What's the Good News?

Hello ever-growing list of backers,
It has been a big day! Today alone, we've brought in 4% of the film's total budget (!). This is thanks to your generosity both in forking over actual money, and in sharing this project with your friends. Thank you.
We've also gotten some good press, thanks to resident PR wizard Kate Kiehl. We've been mentioned in The Wall Street Journal, TechCrunch, Bitcoinist, and a zillion others I won't list here (yet). Those, together with , have brought a bunch of new people in. Welcome!

Hello Kickstarter friends!
It's only been 48 hours since this project opened, and we're just shy of $3,000 pledged. That's a strong start, and we're just beginning the big media push.
The first thing we'd like to highlight is an audio interview on The New Disruptors, a podcast about creative people who make things. Adam and I spoke to Glenn Fleishman at length about Coined as well as Ecstasy of Order: The Tetris Masters and all sorts of other things.

campaign.story:
Update: Stretch Goals
I've been polling the existing backers for ideas for stretch goals.  The popular requests so far are 1) introduction to 2D (basic) gaming, 2) Videos, Videos, Videos, and 3) Business-style apps that connect to a data source, such as a JSON feed. 
Stretch Goal #1 ($15K)  The most popular request by far has been for videos, so the companion web site will be modeled after my http://www.joyofbootstrap.com site but also include a link for a video.
Stretch Goal
All the code examples in the book will be downloadable, of course, but if we hit this goal you can also click the button  "View Video" for a quick tutorial of the code in action.
Introducing Swift
Swift is an innovative new programming language by Apple for building iOS and OS X applications.  When iOS 8 and OS X Yosemite are released this fall, you can submit apps that use Swift to the App Store and Mac App Store. 
According to Apple, writing code in Swift is interactive and fun, the syntax is concise yet expressive, and apps run lightning-fast.   That sounds pretty good to me!  
So how are you going to learn Swift?  So far, there is only one book available on the topic, and it's published by Apple.   Unfortunately for beginners, it is full of sentences like this one: 
“When a closure’s type is already known, such as the callback for a delegate, you can omit the type of its parameters, its return type, or both.”
Excerpt From: Apple Inc. “The Swift Programming Language.” iBooks. https://itun.es/us/jEUH0.l
That might be perfectly concise for the advanced developer, but I think most of the book is just too advanced for most beginners. 
I'm confident I can write a book that's easier to understand for most people.  
Be Ahead of the Crowd
You want to be ahead of the crowd, not behind it, when Swift is officially released. You want to learn all you can and be ready to leverage Apple's latest and greatest.  Let's get started!
Announcing Swift
 Book, Source Code, Videos
This project will produce a book in Kindle, PDF, ePub, and paperback formats, and an associated website "www.joyofswift.com" (not yet live) featuring instructional videos showing how some of the code works.
This book with be the 4th book in the "Joy" series, which are designed to put some joy in the task of learning to program.   My other published books are "The Joy of PHP" and "The Joy of jQuery".
Top-Rated Author
My book The Joy of PHP has 50 reviews on Amazon as I post this project.  Although the ratings move up and down all the time, it has often been the #1 top-rated book as well as the #1 best seller. I have also written The Joy of jQuery and I'm wrapping up The Joy of Bootstrap.
Rated #1 by readers
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk is, of course, that good writing is hard. Inevitably writing a book takes longer than you think. Also, Swift is a moving target, not yet officially released. I'll do my best to keep you all informed.

I haven't quite finished "The Joy of Bootstrap" yet, but this new announcement from Apple is just too good to sit on. I'll work hard to get Joy of Bootstrap out to my backers then dive into Swift as Apple puts puts out updates to the beta of Swift.

With three books published now I KNOW I can write an awesome book that does Swift justice. I've done it before, and it is something I enjoy. I won't be off watching TV or doing something else when I should be writing because I love to write. I've set a realistic timeline on this project, and I am confident I can deliver. The risks are minimal.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Angular is is a web framework backed by Google designed for building single-page web applications.

campaign.story:
LAST DAY TO GET 5 REMARKABLE DOCUMENTARIES YOU CAN WATCH RIGHT NOW!

Reportero (EMMY NOMINATED!!!)
Rivers of Men
Unique Ladies
2501 Migrants
Ilusíon Nacional
Fine print:  Each film is a password protected screener link.  Passwords expire in 1 week.
#BringAmbulante2CA
For two weeks, from September 21 to October 4, Ambulante will embark on its first major U.S. tour throughout the Greater Los Angeles area to create unique exhibition spaces and program free documentary cinema happenings. 
Our mission is simple: Democratize documentary culture. Since 2005, Ambulante.Org has annually organized an epic three-month tour across Mexico presenting remarkable international documentary cinema in areas with limited access to film. Thanks to a grant from the Ford Foundation, our efforts of adapting the successful model in the United States are underway! 
BUT WE NEED YOU TO MAKE IT HAPPEN: 
We are less than three months away from our festival tour and we still need to secure supplemental funding to realize the large scale of the touring festival.  We are asking our new public to be principal supporters and join the Ambulante movement at this vital stage.
OUR PROJECT GOAL:
We like to occupy alternative, outdoor and makeshift spaces while offering the best quality screen and sound for a truly cinematic experience. The funds we raise on Kickstarter will go towards investing in state of the art projection, transportation costs, as well as providing meals and gas mileage to our awesome volunteers.  The more backers and funds we raise, the more terrain we can cover to #BringAmbulante2CA
There is no other organization that travels as far and wide to exhibit DOCUMENTARY cinema outdoors and for free to the general public! Join us in bringing Ambulante to the diverse communties of Los Angeles this year!
 WHAT IS AT STAKE:
Ambulante in California is a pilot program. How successful we are this first year will determine if we can activate Ambulante tours across the United States. Here's a trailer of the 2014 Spring tour in Mexico which gives a glimpse to the wide scope of programming Ambulante offers.
PLAY

WHAT IS OUR PLAN IN CALIFORNIA:
Each day, in partnership with local organizations, the festival will program one free screening event and invite the filmmakers, subjects and other special guests to engage in conversation with audiences after the film. Naturally, we also want to organize some happening after screening parties and musical performances that will be free and open to the public.
WHAT KIND OF FILMS DO WE PLAY?
Just a few of the documentaries that Ambulante has toured in the past. Click on image to go to archive.
Our programming vision is to promote the discovery of the most innovative filmmaking and inspired storytelling art of non-fiction film. We are excited to announce our freshly curated and eclectic Ambulante California lineup of films from all around the world, while also highlighting vibrant Mexican documentaries.
IT'S NOT ALL ABOUT THE BENJAMINS
Honestly!  Your help in spreading the word on social media is priceless. You can help us shape the festival.  Like our founding members, Diego and Gael say, "The cool thing about Ambulante's design is that it's a platform the public owns and self-determines as their space for cultural and social exchange without outside restrictions."
WE ARE LOOKING FOR A RELATIONSHIP
The ladies of Ambulante; Managing Director, Marie-Ève Parenteau., Executive Director, Elena Fortes, and Ambulante California Director, Christine Davila
It takes a passionate collective of people with relentless energy to produce the growing global reach of this festival.  We want to introduce and welcome you to the Ambulante Global community.  Every backer will be sent a series of exclusive videos; anecdotes conveying the story of Ambulante from our filmmakers, staff and volunteers.  We also captured some personal and thoughtful video conversations from our Kickstarter shoot with Diego and Gael that you won't want to miss.
Our super bionic and tireless staff in Mexico responsible for producing the longest and farthest reaching documentary film festival in the world!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Although this is a new social and geographical context, Ambulante has over nine years of experience showcasing films across 16 countries, and it has created strong alliances with international documentary film industry, grassroot organizations and cultural institutions. 

Everywhere we have traveled, the fundamental reason we have been successful is because the general public has adopted, embraced and transformed Ambulante to fit their wants and needs. 

We've joined the Kickstarter community to seek collaborators, partners, supporters and friends to undertake this exciting new endeavor together.

From the bottom of our hearts, thank you so much for being a part of this special project that means so much to us!

-Gael, Diego, Pablo, Elena, Christine, and the rest of the Ambulante & CANANA family!



*************
MORE ABOUT AMBULANTE

Ambulante is the 2005 non-profit organization founded by actors and filmmakers, Gael García Bernal, Diego Luna, Pablo Cruz, and Elena Fortes. For nine years Ambulante has focused on supporting and promoting documentary film as a tool for social and cultural transformation. The tour travels across 12 states in Mexico over the course of three months to areas with limited access to film to diversify and democratize documentary culture. The objective is to reach a broader audience by screening films in a wide array of venues and offering most of its programming for free. For more information visit our website www.ambulante.com.mx


EN ESPAÑOL
Ambulante es una organización sin fines de lucro dedicada a apoyar y difundir el cine documental como una herramienta de transformación cultural y social. Ambulante viaja a lugares que cuentan con poca oferta de exhibición y formación en cine documental, con el fin de crear una audiencia participativa, crítica e informada, y abrir nuevos canales de expresión y reflexión en México y en el extranjero. Desde su fundación en el año 2005, Ambulante A.C. realiza cada año un festival de cine documental que recorre varios estados de México durante 3 meses. 

Gracias a la beca de la Ford Foundation, ya está en marcha en Estados Unidos nuestro esfuerzo para adaptar este exitoso modelo de festival itinerante de cine documental impulsado por la comunidad. Sin embargo, para poder realizar nuestra primera gira en Los Ángeles, California, del 21 de Septiembre al 4 de Octubre, aún necesitamos completar nuestro presupuesto de producción. Ya que probablemente no nos será posible confirmar un patrocinio tradicional antes de nuestro lanzamiento, estamos pidiéndole a nuestro público que se una y apoye el movimiento Ambulante en esta etapa crítica.

NUESTRA META:
Como meta de financiamiento, nos hemos propuesto alcanzar el presupuesto mínimo necesario para hacer realidad esta primera edición del festival. Queremos organizar funciones y actividades en lugares alternativos, improvisados y al aire libre, en los que podamos ofrecer proyecciones de calidad para lograr una experiencia comunitaria extraordinaria. Los fondos que recaudemos en Kickstarter serán invertidos en la logística de las proyecciones. Como planeamos desplazarnos por el área metropolitana de Los Ángeles con el objetivo de llegar hasta los barrios más desfavorecidos que cuentan con poca oferta de exhibición, los fondos también cubrirán gastos de transporte, comida y gasolina para nuestros voluntarios. Conforme más backers tengamos y más fondos recaudemos, más territorio podremos recorrer en #BringAmbulante2CA.

QUÉ ESTÁ EN JUEGO: 
Ambulante en California es un programa piloto. Nuestro éxito en Los Ángeles este primer año determinará hasta qué punto podremos expandir la plataforma a diferentes estados y localidades de Estados Unidos en el futuro. 

Aquí está el tráiler de la Gira 2014 en México, en el que puedes comprobar el nivel de la programación que ofrece Ambulante.

CUÁL ES NUESTRO PLAN EN CALIFORNIA: 
La edición inaugural de Ambulante California 2014 viajará a los vecindarios más multiculturales de Los Ángeles para capturar y activar audiencias. En colaboración con distintas organizaciones, el objetivo es incentivar intervenciones artísticas de carácter social, presentar historias que reflejen la diversa herencia de las comunidades y promover la apreciación intercultural desde diferentes perspectivas. Ambulante en el contexto de Los Ángeles favorecerá la vinculación cultural comunitaria a través del documental, generando un diálogo de interés local y global en el marco del vasto y dinámico ecosistema de las subculturas de la ciudad.

Todos los días, en colaboración con organizaciones locales, el festival programará al menos una función, e invitaremos a los cineastas y otros invitados especiales a entablar un diálogo con el público después de la película. También organizaremos actividades diversas tras las proyecciones y presentaciones musicales, que serán gratuitas y abiertas al público.

NO SÓLO SE TRATA DE RECAUDAR FONDOS 
¡Lo decimos en serio! Tu ayuda para correr la voz en tus redes sociales es imprescindible. Como a los fundadores de Ambulante Diego Luna y Gael García Bernal les gusta decir, una de las misiones de Ambulante es proporcionar una plataforma que le pertenezca al público y en la que exista un intercambio cultural sin restricciones. Con esto en mente, dependemos de la participación de nuestro nuevo público para ayudarnos a moldear Ambulante en los Estados Unidos.

QUEREMOS ESTABLECER UNA RELACIÓN CON NUESTROS BACKERS: 
Se necesita un colectivo de gente apasionada con mucha energía para hacer posible el festival. Queremos que llegues a conocer a nuestros fundadores y al staff a través de las actualizaciones del proyecto. A cada backer se le mandará una serie de videos exclusivos: detrás de cámaras y anécdotas que revelen la historia de Ambulante contadas por cineastas y voluntarios. También capturamos conversaciones con Diego y Gael, rescatados de nuestro video de Kickstarter, que no te puedes perder.

Ambulante Global surge a partir de 9 años de experiencia en la planeación y producción de la Gira de Documentales en México, y representa el primer intento oficial de establecer, a largo plazo, la presencia de Ambulante fuera del país. Con el paso de los años, Ambulante ha acumulado una valiosa experiencia en la producción de festivales de cine en una variedad de contextos geográficos y sociales. En un esfuerzo por alcanzar nuevos públicos, Ambulante ha logrado involucrar a una gran variedad de socios y colaboradores en la organización del festival (complejos cinematográficos, organizaciones de la industria del cine, instituciones, organizaciones no gubernamentales, universidades, etc.). El festival ha conseguido establecer una trayectoria impecable y prestigiosa, respaldada por los testimonios de invitados de ediciones pasadas, múltiples invitaciones a participar en festivales de cine internacionales, y por diversos reconocimientos como el Premio WOLA de Derechos Humanos 2011 por la promoción del documental como una herramienta de cambio. 

Durante esta edición, Ambulante Global buscará extender su red de colaboradores, trabajar con distintos socios locales y crear un contexto adecuado para la recepción del cine documental, además de potenciar el impacto y la visibilidad de este importante género.

Desde 2007, Ambulante ha presentado selecciones de documentales en más de 33 ciudades en 17 países en colaboración con distintos festivales, organizaciones, exhibidoras e instituciones. Ambulante ha viajado a Argentina, Australia, Canadá, Colombia, Costa Rica, Cuba, El Salvador, España, Estados Unidos, Guatemala, Inglaterra, Nicaragua, Noruega, Sudáfrica, Suecia, Tanzania y Kosovo.

En todos los lugares a los que Ambulante ha viajado, la razón fundamental por la cual ha tenido éxito es porque el público ha adoptado, acogido y transformado Ambulante para que encaje dentro de sus deseos y necesidades. Nos hemos unido a la comunidad de Kickstarter en busca de colaboradores, socios, aliados y amigos para emprender esta aventura juntos.

Muchas gracias por ser parte de este proyecto tan especial.
-¡Gael, Diego, Pablo, Elena, Christine, y el resto de la familia Ambulante y CANANA!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Sailor Moon is the magical girl anime that has captured the hearts and imaginations of boy and girls worldwide; and we at @ Productions are definitely not exempt from this. After learning about La Solider (a Sailor Moon inspired cosplay group) via Tokyopop's facebook page, @ Productions began work on In the Name of the Moon. Over the past 2 years we've had the opportunity to meet with all kinds of fans, attend several conventions, and see just how influential Sailor Moon has been. With In the Name of the Moon, we hope to revisit the nostalgia of discovering Sailor Moon and to portray the friendship that it has inspired. 
Release dates: 
Early Access for Kickstarter Backers: June 30, 2014
Episodic Release: July 1-5, 2014
General Release: July 18, 2014
Stretch Goals
We will add foreign language captions around the release date of the general release which is July 18, and a bit later for Japanese. 
$2600 - Spanish Captions (Reached!!!!!!!!!!)
$3000 - Korean Captions  (Reached!!!!!!!!!!)
$3500- Japanese Captions (Reached!!!!!!!!!!)
$4200 - Theatrical Release In Washington D.C. (Reached!!!!!!!!!!)
$5000 - Theatrical Release In New York, NY 
$6000 - Theatrical Release In Los Angeles, CA
Story:
In the Name of the Moon is a feature length documentary about the 9 college friends who form the La Soldier Cosplay group. Born from the love of Sailor Moon, we watch as the group works to relive the nostalgia of appearing in full force for the first time since their inception. Exploring themes of con culture, cosplay, growing up, fandom, and friendship in both the academic and social realms; we see how the hobbies and things we love unite us and push us to do what we never thought was possible. 
A bit about @productions:
We are motion graphic artists/editors with a passion for nerd and geek culture. Looking to use our powers of creativity to unite all peoples in truth and love (read: make cool videos), we set out to document our subcultures with style. Corporate video makers by day and "those video people at the con" on the weekends, we've created a nice little pile of videos that are just waiting with their sad puppy dog eyes for you to watch them <3
Why We are Kickstarting:
We love creating these videos and so far we have been funding these projects ourselves, including anything from travel expenses to equipment purchases and rentals. However, a project of this magnitude needs and deserves just a little extra love and care by way of finishing costs, such as Color correction, and captioning and subtitles, so that hearing impaired moonies can enjoy this documentary. Additionally we'd like to be able to purchase the perfect music for this awesome feature, as well as hire quality voice over talent. 
Rewards and Release
By funding this kickstarter we get the opportunity to take this video to 9000, so we've arranged our thanks by way of an early release! ITNOTM will be online, in its entirety to our kickstarter backers of $10 or more on June 30, 2014. For everyone else there will be an episodic release starting July 1, 2014 each day until July 5, 2014 (Sailor Moon Crystal Day!). The general release of the documentary in its entirety will be on July 18, 2014. 
2"x3" Chibi Usagi Sticker. Chibi Senshi prizes will be done in this style!
4"x6" Chibi Senshi Sticker Sheet
 Music for this video is "Night Owl" by Broke For Free (http://brokeforfree.com/)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Wait... wasn't it supposed to be released in 2013?

Yes, it was supposed to be released in 2013. This project became much larger than either of us anticipated! So rather than rush this project we decided that it was best to delay the release. We felt comfortable with the delay, because our intention was that the documentary would coincide with the release of Sailor Moon Crystal, which was also delayed.

We love our fans and delivering on time is something that we strive toward. Since the video has completed its production phase and is now assembled as a 2nd draft rough cut nearing the final cut, we are confident in hitting our June 30 deadline. We are working super hard to prevent any more delays from happening.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Introduction
Tolkien spoke of a secret fire. I believe that we all have something in us that when roused, enables us to make real the dreams we imagine. Music is the greatest gift man shares with the universe, and the fire to create something musical has been ignited in me. It's been a long time since I've stepped into a recording studio… too long. Join me and These Grey Men from the beginning. Share in the process, and be a part of the inspiration behind this collection of re-imagined cover songs, and live performances to follow!
The Story 
About two years ago, I began to feel somewhat incomplete. I was touring and having a great time with my friends in System Of A Down, but something was missing. After some soul searching, it hit me that I hadn't given anything new artistically to the world in far too long. Though touring was fantastic, it didn't fulfill a fundamental need that was growing day by day within me. A need to step into the studio with a blank canvas and share what comes out with fans across the world. 
On one of my many trips to visit friends and family in LA,  I was scrolling through the 10,000 or so songs in my iPod, and as different songs would come on - for reasons I can't explain - I would rearrange them and change the melodies around in my head. I began noting the songs that changed the most profoundly, and a list began to form. Over time, it became clear that what I had on my hands could be the project I was yearning for.  
Enter Mr. James Hazley, my close friend and co-conspirator since high school, who also happens to posses a wealth of musical talent. A close friend for decades as well as former drummer for critically acclaimed underground band Cockeyed Ghost, James brings to the project his vast knowledge of music, songwriting and producing. Also feeling a bit dejected musically, James was ready for the challenge I presented him: to take songs and completely re-imagine them, while maintaining their original integrity. We took some risks with these songs. We pushed boundaries. We pushed ourselves. I hope you enjoy listening to this album as much as we enjoy making it for you!
The Project
The album will cover a range of songs from artists such as Radiohead and Outkast to David Bowie, and will include an all-star band that we're in the process of developing now. For this project, lots of different styles are going to be Incorporated, especially drum-wise. The sound is going to be rock-derivative, and will also include some hip-hop songs explored through the lens of rock. There are no limitations artistically for this project. 
I want this project to be an experiment, not just in sound, but in the mutual participation of artist and fan. I want to involve you from the very beginning, not simply in contributing to the financing of this project, but in truly being a part of the process of the creation of the project. The ultimate goal is not just to deliver to you a finished product, but to give you a piece of the project every step of the way. 
Many of the rewards that you see to the right were designed to allow and encourage you to be involved in the process, from interacting with us over the phone or in person, coming into the studio with us via Skype, owning parts of instruments that were used during the recoding process, being involved in creating our merchandise and coming out to see us when we tour. I want you to be as invested in this project as I am... kind of like planting a tree and watching it grow. Everyone who makes a contribution of $10 or more will receive a download of the album. 
Drum Sticks
Hand Painted Cymbal
Signed These Grey Men Drumhead
Throughout the lifetime of the project, we'll also provide you with real-time updates on artists who confirm their participation, as well as updates and content from rehearsals. 
Breakdown of Cost
The recording process will cost upwards of $75,000 including engineer, recording space and equipment. Factoring in touring costs will also cause this number to grow substantially. 
Because we are currently developing this project without the financial and marketing support of a record label, we are covering all of the expenses associated with this project out of pocket, which, as you see, can be quite costly. Knowing how expensive making and touring music can be, we've set our fundraising goal at what we believe to be an attainable $55,000. Any money that we're able to raise beyond that amount will thus also go into recording and touring costs.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk would be to not put ourselves out there creatively. Without risk, the world wouldn't enjoy some of the greatest accomplishments of man, and this includes music. 

Raising enough money to record and tour a record is in and of itself, challenging, so I'd like to thank you for rising to the challenge with us, and for supporting this project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Kickstarter backers! Thank you again for your support and patience, we are currently in the process of fulfillment and rewards will be arriving in the next couple weeks based on where you live. 
If you have not sent us your updated mailing address or received the following dispensed rewards please reach out to us here or at: velvethammermanagement@gmail.com.
Physical rewards already fulfilled:

To all of my Kickstarter supporters:
Thank you for being patient while this project has been in the works. I’m glad to announce that we have finally finished recording the album. More details will come to light in the next few months, and we will be releasing the album in January. You all will be the first ones to get it. I hope that you will all enjoy it and it will have been worth the wait.
All the best –
John Dolmayan

Hi everyone,
Thank you all for your patience. We are in the studio continuing to work at this project to make it the best it can be. Backers will be receiving rewards as we can fulfill them. We can't wait to share this music. 
These photos were taken yesterday as we were working on vocals for one of the tracks.

I know this update is long overdue… Between System touring last year, family commitments, and the holidays, things certainly have been busy, but we’re back! I’m happy to say we’re back in the studio working on overdubs for the project and I should have something for all of you to hear soon. I’m really excited about how this is turning out, and I can’t wait to share it with all of you. Thanks for hanging in. I’ll have another update in the coming weeks… -John

Many of you have been asking, so I’m excited to announce that after a short hiatus on the road with System Of A Down, I’m back to work on These Grey Men. I appreciate how much anticipation there is with amongst you, our fans. I can’t wait to share the new music with you very soon! - John

Hi Everyone,
Quick update from the studio: John has finished tracking drums and is onto the next phase of the album as time allows.. He is very excited will update you soon!
Thanks,
TGM

Hi Everyone, 
Sincerest thanks to you all for supporting our Kickstarter campaign. It wouldn't be possible without you. 
A little update on the project: we've booked a studio and will begin recording in mid-December. We'll send out another update very soon!

Thank you to everyone who helped get our first week off to a great start! We've been reading though your comments and messages, and are truly thankful for your warm words of encouragement and enthusiastic support. At nearly $13,000, we're currently at almost 25% of our goal of $55,000. Please help to pass the word on to your friends by sharing this campaign to any fans of System Of A Down, or of rock in general. 
As we continue to rehearse, and to solidify the list of songs that we will be including on the album, we know that some of you have some questions that you'd like answered in real time, so I will be hosting a live Facebook Q&A on my official Facebook page (that's the John Dolmayan Facebook page) this upcoming Monday at 12PM Pacific Time. I look forward to hearing your thoughts and answering more of your questions then.

campaign.story:
LOOKSERY APP AT A GLANCE:
A RICH SET OF VIDEO FILTERS: Record new messages or select video selfies from your phone gallery; edit in real-time with Looksery photo and video filters filters.
MOST POPULAR MOBILE PLATFORMS: Cross-platform app for your iOS and Android devices.
FILTER ADJUSTMENTS: A wide range of customizable parameters for filters.
WHAT WILL YOU GET?
Looksery is an app for photo and video messaging, where you can apply real-time filters and effects. The basic app, which you can get by pledging $5 or more, includes 10 well balanced presets, where several filters are combined together to be used simultaneously. You can make your face look thinner or fatter, change the size of your nose, and the shape of your chin.
Aquamarine Eyes + Thinner Face + Smooth Skin
Hazel Eyes + Smooth Skin + Thinner Face + Vignette + Color Effect
Green Eyes + Smooth Skin + Wider Chin + Vignette + Color Effect
Blue Eyes + Smooth Skin + Thinner Face + Color Effect
It is very easy to create professional looking photos in Looksery. With just few taps on filters you can enrich colors, add vignette and make eyes look brighter:
Green Eye Color + Change Nose Size + Color Preset
Green Eyes + Thinner face + Smooth Skin + Color Preset
THE MORE YOU PLEDGE, THE MORE YOU GET!
In addition to the basic set of effects we offer multiple PAID OPTIONS for your choice (check our rewards charts for details). There are fun filters, such as 3D avatars or astonishing effects to surprise your friends.
X-Ray Effect (PAID FILTER)
 You can record videos with the talking scull or make a photo.
Scary Face (PAID FILTER)
 We track your emotions and filters repeat your moves.
Zombie (PAID FILTER)
Zombie filter will be applied when your mouth is wide open, so you can start recording a video with a normal look and suddenly transform yourself in a zombie.
Gecko (PAID FILTER)
Using 3D avatars you can express emotions in a very unique way. We track your face, and connect an avatar to your movements. Each avatar has its own style, and you are welcome to choose your favorite character!
Panda (PAID FILTER)
PLEDGE $5 AND GET ONE PAID EFFECT FOR YOUR CHOICE!
THE HOSTING PLAN - DO I NEED IT?
We offer you cloud storage, so you can always browse your videos and share them privately or publicly. You will be able to share links or embed videos to any website.
We have developed our own code for video face tracking, and designed unique video filters which work in real-time. The Looksery app is programmed using  C++, GLSL and ASM and we use some of the features of the OpenCV library. Our tracking and initialization algorithms are based on the Active Appearance Model.
Currently we have 5 patents pending, involving real-time face-tracking and the technology that modifies it.
The app has a user friendly interface and you can change your appearance with just a singe tap.
 APP FEATURES:
Real-Time Face Filters and Video Effects
Filter Adjustments
Integrated Chat
News Feed
Public & Private Video Sharing
Quick Post To Social Networks 
Automatically Saves Photos & Videos to Your Gallery
No matter how many people are on a video, Looksery recognizes the face closest to the center and tracks it quickly and precisely, simultaneously applying filters.
There are a number of real-time filters and effects for videos and photos that we have developed for you in our first version. 
Single Effects:
CHANGE EYE COLOR
SOFTER SKIN
CHANGE NOSE SIZE
CHANGE FACE SHAPE
CHANGE CHIN SHAPE
Presets: 
CHANGE EYE COLOR + SOFTEN SKIN + THINNER FACE + VIDEO COLOR FILTER 
CHANGE CHIN + NECK SHAPE
3D Avatar Fun Effects: 
ZOMBIE
SKULL
SCARY FACE
X-RAY
3D ANIMATED PANDA
 We are designing some funky new filters and crazy effects, so you can make fun and terrify your friends. 
Compatible with iPhone 5/5s/5c
Requires iOS 7 or higher
On iPhone 4/4s Looksery will work without real-time filters. Filters can be applied as post-effects to already recorded videos and captured photos.

We plan to release the version for Android mobile devices in November 2014, and it will be compatible with ICS 4.0 and later OS's.
The technology that drives Looksery was built from scratch by our team. We are the first company to bring the full power of such complex face tracking technology to mobile.
This means you can now do so much more than just adding a few generic pictures or animations to your media; it is the ability to completely modify your appearance and exchange video messages as 3D characters.
With Looksery you can explore different filters that change entirely the way you look and enhance videos. Each person has a unique Looksery experience, and we can't wait to see your perfect look!
We hope that our technology will give rise to a new generation of selfies and videos, but we need your support to make it real!  
We have prepared a feast of great rewards: new filters and features, different storage plans and nice goodies, and of course special thanks to all our backers and their friends.
Goodies
We have some nifty new items for you, all branded with the Looksery logo and Zombie effect illustration:
T-Shirts Black or White (Unisex)
Hoodies (Male or Female)
White Caps
Glow-in-the-Dark Frisbees 
Pen - USB drive 8GB
Chat Stickers
Pledge $30 an you get a great pack for two including 10 chat stickers.
Filter Customization Options
When you pledge $40 or more you get different customisation options for your filters.  Normally you can apply pre-defined filters; with filter customisations you can play with different filter adjustments to find your perfect look. You will have a set of special features to apply more accurate changes.
Hall of Fame 
We have a Hall of Fame where we want to post our thanks to all our backers. For everyone who pledge $200 and more, we will offer the opportunity for them to post a message or a review about Looksery on our website. This is a unique opportunity that will only be offered to our Kickstarter backers.
Pledge $300 and get our EARLY BIRD DEAL. We have prepared for you an iOS beta and exclusive video editing with one of Looksery filters. Hurry to get the deal as pledges are limited!
Exclusive Video Editing
This is your chance to be the first to try the Looksery filters before everyone gets the app. Send us your video selfie (max. 1 hour in length) and we'll be happy to edit it for you with one of our Looksery filters.
Top Tip: To have the most accurate recognition result, please don’t turn your head more than 45 degrees.
Exclusive Filter Design
Yes, you got it right, we will design a filter just for you! Pledge $1500, help us make this project successful, tell us your idea and we'll start working on your personal filter. You will be directly involved in its creation, and we will send you sketches throughout the design process, so you can choose the best result. 
Looksery mobile app is in beta now, and we plan to improve the usability and integrate more options for filter customisation. Also we plan to continue creating new face filters and run professional QA to make sure all your feedbacks are properly taken care of.  

In case of success we are planning to release the first version of Looksery app for iOS in August 2014 and for Android in November 2014.

WHY DO WE NEED FUNDING?
Designing and programming applications is a complex and continuous process that requires a lot of funding. The money funded we will use to finish development, undergo beta testing, and polish UX/UI. We want to bring you a seamless user experience. 

After we release an app for iPhone, we will start working on iPad and Android versions. We want to deliver Looksery app on all platforms by the end of this year. 

We love what we do and we want to deliver you the app very soon!

ABOUT LOOKSERY TEAM
Looksery mobile app development was started a year ago. We are a team of talented and ambitious guys who decided to transform a creative concept into a real product. 
Our photos were captured with Looksery app on iPhone's 5s front camera.
The challenge was to bring this complex and expensive technology onto mobile platforms and deliver it to you in a fun and affordable way. We need your support to make it real and that's why we came to Kickstarter! 
STAY IN TOUCH
Please spread the word about our project among your friends and support our effort to give everyone full creative control over their videos and photos!

Thank You, We Love You!

As featured in:
CNET | TechCrunch | Business Insider | CNN | TUAW
High resolution images and videos for PRESS download here. For press inquiries, please contact julie@looksery.com.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our team is working hard to meet the deadlines of our roadmap, but there are certain issues that may take place:

1. Surely we have a beta prototype of our app, but it is still in the development process and we don't exclude unpredictable issues. It may take time to solve them.

2. App Store and Google Play reviews usually take up to 14 business days after submission. If they ask us to make changes the release may be posponed. We will make sure that all qualifications meet Apple’s and Google's standards for quicker approval time!

3. If there is a delay in the release of Android version, it may take more time to deliver rewards for backers who has Android devices.

You may find all project updates on our Kickstarter page. We are open for communication, please feel free to ask questions.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Did you miss the funding window? Not to worry! Slacker backers (people who weren't quite on time) can go and back the project at the Catlateral Damage website.
Notes on stretch goals  
Steam Workshop integration means that we'll release all of our developer tools to the public so that the community can easily modify the game and share their creations with other fans. As a player you'll have access to lots of user generated content!  
Yes, there will be other animals in the pet store. What kind? Let's hit this goal and you can find out!
The PlayStation 4 version of the game will come out about 6 months after the Steam and OUYA versions, likely in summer 2015. All backers will be able to choose between EITHER the PS4 version or the Steam + OUYA + DRM free download version. Alternatively backers can get all versions by adding an $3 extra to their pledge (the PS4 keys cost us $3 each).
Catlateral Damage is a first-person destructive cat simulator where you play as a cat on a rampage, knocking as much of your owner's stuff onto the ground as possible. It's a highly original, experimental concept that was born out of a game jam last year. Oh, and it's based on a real-life mischievous cat!
My childhood buddy, Nippy, in real life and in-game.
See the world from the perspective of a cat! Like other first-person games, you can walk and look around, jump, and crouch. Unlike other first-person games, your primary weapons are your two cat paws, which you can use to swipe at and knock objects onto the floor.
Catlateral Damage garnered a bit of attention back in January (see the What People Are Saying section below!), and lots of people have asked to play a full game with more feline destruction. In fact, the demo was so popular that it was Greenlit on Steam after only 8 days! So now I'm making the full game, which will come out on Steam (Windows, Mac OS X, Linux), OUYA, and as a DRM free download. The anticipated release window is Q4 2014.   
Intrigued? Go play the demo now, in case you missed the big flashing yellow button surrounded by cat paws up top.
 YouTube Features & Let's Plays
Let's talk about all the new features and content that will be going into the game thanks to your support! In Catlateral Damage you will be able to:
Chase (or ignore) mice. You can play with or catch them! 
Sit in a box, lie in a sunbeam, or both at once 
Chase a laser pointer and completely freak out 
Hack up a hairball. Why not? 
Find long lost cat toys under the couch and play with them 
Explore/hide underneath the bed 
Trip out on catnip 
Stand at a doorway and be indecisive about going in or out 
Meow using state of the art, cutting edge meowing technology 
Act indignant because you are the higher species 
Knock over this TV:
Here's a more thorough explanation of where the game will be going.
Your goal is to reach the fancy mansion down the street and destroy the super secret, super valuable object hidden within its locked safe. You start in your home apartment, traversing and trashing various houses on the street until your reach the mansion. In each house, you start in a locked room and make messes in rooms to unlock adjacent ones. Once all rooms are sufficiently sloppy, you nap in a box (yes, really) before moving on to the next house. Each residence is larger and contains more valuable possessions than the last. You may even encounter special locations on your journey...
Procedurally-generated gameplay: Every time you play the game will be different as all houses, rooms, and challenges are procedurally generated. As you play the game more you'll unlock different cats, with different special abilities.
More cats and special abilities: As you progress through the game you'll have to make choices about which cat to use for which level, because cats have different special abilities! Some cats jump higher than others, while other cats are stronger and can knock over heavier objects. Some cats prefer to destroy plants, while others hate electronics.
Collectibles and power ups: What cat doesn't like to collect things? Hunt around for secret objects (or maybe just cat toys you have previously lost?) which can help unlock new abilities. And power-ups enhance your cat's abilities, like catnip which temporarily makes you a super-powered furball of terror!
Tons of polish: I'll focus on getting the controls as perfect as possible, so that moving around really feels like you’re a cat. I'll also spend lots of time focusing on the user interface and experience so the game feels as great as possible. It sounds boring but you'll appreciate it! I'll also add in achievements, leaderboards, and Steam trading cards. 
Lots more content: Tons of new objects to topple! A glorious soundtrack, fun sound effects, and more! This messy room is a merely a prelude to the destruction you'll cause as a cat.
TL;DR – There's gonna be a TON of new stuff, and I'm going to make this feel like you're a cat as much as possible.
A sincere thank you and access to backer updates and newsletter. I may occasionally send you a cute pictures of cats. Not too frequently though.
THIS IS NOT A TIER! It's an add-on - if you increase your pledge for any of the below tiers by $10 then you'll get an extra copy of the game! You can get as many extra copies as you'd like, just increase by the appropriate amount. If you back the HIPSTER CAT tier or higher then the extra copies will also be early access! ADD-ON COPY does not work with the KITTEN tier, nice try!
A DRM-free digital copy of the game for PC, Mac, or Linux (and/or Steam key and/or OUYA key) when it releases later this year and full game soundtrack.
A DRM free copy of the game PC, Mac, or Linux (and Steam key and/or OUYA key), full game soundtrack, and you get your name in the game credits! I'll also send you a special backer-only digital book (PDF) with special cat pictures and developer commentary. It will be awesome.
You get special early access to the game before it comes out! Play the game early, give feedback, and tell your friends how great it is before it goes mainstream. Note that early access will be for PC, Mac, and Linux and only available with Steam keys. Includes the BACKER CAT tier.
The HIPSTER CAT tier plus games from friends of ours! Includes Steam keys for Goat Simulator, Octodad: Dadliest Catch, The Stanley Parable, Go Home Dinosaurs, and Slam Bolt Scrappers.
THIS IS NOT A TIER! It's an add-on - if you increase your pledge for any of the below tiers by $50 then you get to put another cat photo into the game! You can add as many cats as you'd like, just increase by the appropriate amount. All of your photos will be displayed together in-game as a set.
Make your cat famous! Send us a photo of your cat and it will appear as a framed poster or picture in-game. Includes the HIPSTER CAT tier.
Make your dog famous! This is just like the LOLCAT tier, except just for dogs. Because this is a game about cats you have to pay an extra dollar for this, and I expect you to submit an unflattering, silly picture of your dog. Includes the HIPSTER CAT tier. 
The best of both worlds! Get your cat (or dog) in a framed poster or picture in-game, plus we'll send you Steam keys of our friends' games (Goat Simulator, Octodad: Dadliest Catch, The Stanley Parable, Go Home Dinosaurs, and Slam Bolt Scrappers). Includes the HIPSTER CAT tier, and an extra second copy of Catlateral Damage for a friend!
A game for you and one for your cat! Your cat can't play the video game, but he or she will LOVE this sweet Catlateral Damage laser pointer. You also get a snazzy Catlateral Damage t-shirt (we haven't figured out the design yet, but trust me, it'll be snazzy) plus the GAMER LOLCAT tier for you. Add $15 shipping for non-US addresses.
Play as YOUR cat in the game! Your cat will be famous, and appear as a playable character, complete with name and fur color. Includes LONG CAT tier. This was originally $400 but it sold out, so I've put up a second round of 10 slots. Once this is gone that's it, I can't add a third round!
BUSINESS CAT tier, and you get listed as a "Fat Cat Producer" in the credits, which includes a picture of you and/or your cat as opposed to just your name. You also get to have lunch with me and the folks at Fire Hose Games to give feedback on the game, talk about cats, or discuss quantum mechanics - whatever floats your boat. You have to provide your own travel arrangements, or you can Skype in. You'll also get 5 extra copies of the game for your best friends.
Do you love cats? Are you not messing around? Then this is the tier for you! Eitan (Fire Hose Founder, helping me with this game) will adopt a cat for each person that pledges this tier! There is no limit! Troll him and make him adopt 20 cats, he'll have to do it! Eitan will periodically send you pictures of the cat, and you are invited to come and hang out with him or her when you are in Boston. Includes FAT CAT tier, with a total of 10 copies of the game to share with your best friends.
I started creating Catlateral Damage last year. I had a full-time job working as a video game tester, and would spend nights and weekends on this game, pursuing my dream to become an indie game developer. In March of 2014 I lost my job, which allowed me to start working full-time on the game but also came with the burden of not having an income. If the Kickstarter campaign is successful, I'll be able to continue putting all my effort into creating the game and releasing a great, polished experience for you to play!
I've been developing video games for about 8 years now and I've been a gamer for the majority of my life. I was also partially raised by cats, so I have extensive experience with feline behavior. Catlateral Damage is truly something I was meant to create.
If you want to learn more about me, check out this interview on Gamasutra. You can also check out my website for some other projects I've worked on. Feel free to follow me on Twitter, too!
I’m not working on the game alone, either! I've been given the opportunity to work alongside Fire Hose Games as part of their indie accelerator program. They will be providing marketing, additional development, and other resources on top of the work I'll be doing on the game. They’re the guys who made Slam Bolt Scrappers and Go Home Dinosaurs. They’re also big time cat lovers so it was a natural fit. Eitan (the founder) has spent way too much time at my place playing with my cats.
When they aren't sleeping or wrestling with each other, Wil & Lyn help out with the research and marketing aspects of the game's development. Wil is a 1-year-old orange tabby and Lyn is a 4-1/2-month-old polydactyl manx.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This project is actually very low risk! The main challenge with creating this game so far has been working as a solo developer. However working with Fire Hose Games has given me the extra support that I need to make this happen so I’m not alone in a bubble.

Another risk with this game is underestimating how long it may take to add certain features and content to the game. Features may be delayed due to bugs or unplanned content might need to be created. Luckily the game isn't especially complicated (no online multiplayer). We've planned for some amount of bug fixing and unexpected problems in the schedule so we’re not too concerned.

If anything were to happen to me due to an Act of God or other such event, I believe the game is in the dependable hands of Wil & Lyn, the fully-capable feline game developers featured in the video. If for any reason they are unable to continue the project, I'm sure the team at Fire Hose Games can handle it!

Finally, we're participating in the OUYA double our funds program, which will reduce our risk even further and help us to get the game on console. Here are the details.

Double Our Fun(ds)!
We're participating in OUYA's #FreeTheGames Fund, created by OUYA to support developers making new and creative console games. OUYA will match your pledge dollar-for-dollar up to your goal amount (and a max of $250,000), so help us get there and make a great game for everyone! To be eligible for this match, we commit that this game will be an OUYA console exclusive for a period of time. To learn more about OUYA, go to www.OUYA.tv.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Wow, can you believe Catlateral Damage launched a year ago? Since then, the game has received several new content updates and tweaks, a PS4 version, and now a VR version for the HTC Vive! To celebrate, the game will be 50% off from now until the end of the month.

Long time, no see!
Things have been pretty quiet lately, huh? That’s because I’ve been hard at work on a few things, like a PlayStation 4 version of Catlateral Damage! The game will be launching in North America on March 22, with a week-long 20% off discount for PS Plus members. (European version coming soon!) The PS4 version contains all the content of the Steam version, plus this:

What's up, cool cats?
A new update is now available for Catlateral Damage on Steam! (Updated DRM-free versions coming very soon!)
I've added a brand new bonus level just in time for Halloween: The Furightful Lab! This level is a basement laboratory filled with potions, science equipment, and other spooky things to swat onto the floor. To access it, look for a Jack-o'-lantern in regular levels (which show up more frequently in October) or select it in Litterbox Mode. Thanks to our friends Jason Wiser at  for creating the furniture and physics object art for this level and for creating another awesome music track!

updates.update_userinfo: Catlateral Damage is coming to PS4!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
The latest update for Catlateral Damage is now available! This one includes a bunch of cool new stuff for you to play around with.
First off, I’ve added several new objects to knock over based on other great indie games like Guacamelee!, Octodad: Dadliest Catch, The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth, and Goat Simulator. (You can check out all the cameos in this album.) In addition to these cameos, I’ve also added a new bonus level: the Box Purradise! This level is made up of tons of cardboard boxes and has lots of cat food and toys to swat at. There may be upgrades and power-ups hidden within the different box structures, too.

updates.update_userinfo: A new Halloween level is now available. Welcome to the Furightful Lab!
updates.update_content:
Long time no see! I hope you've all been enjoying Catlateral Damage so far. Just a quick reminder: If you like the game, please help us out and leave a review on Steam! Thanks!
Moving on, I'm happy to say that I'm getting some brand new stuff ready for an update that will be out on September 1! This update will include some reworking of Objective Mode scoring, saving/loading levels in Litterbox Mode, Japanese language localization, and a bunch of cameos from other indie games. Here's a sneak peek at some of the new toys you'll be able to swat onto the floor:

Just a quick update! The OUYA keys I mentioned in the last update are now available for House Cats ($10+) and Backer Cats ($15+)! You can access these keys on the Humble page where your Steam copy, soundtrack, etc. are located. If you haven't redeemed your page yet, you can do so by entering your email address in the Humble Key Resender. With that, all rewards have been sent out. Sweet! I hope you all enjoy the game!
And, what the heck. Here's another photo of Wil & Lyn. You can never have too many.

Whew! It took a little while but as of right now you can all get your DRM free copies, game soundtrack, and developer commentary PDF via the Humble Key Resender (the same place you got your Steam copies). A lot of bug fixes have gone in since launch so these versions should be more stable, and if you happen to have an older computer the game should run much better now. Thanks for all your patience!
At this point, most backers should have all of their rewards. Hooray! I'm still waiting on OUYA keys for House Cats and Backer Cats, but I'll notify those backers when these keys are ready. Once again I can't thank you all enough for giving me the support I needed to make this game a reality.

updates.update_userinfo: OUYA vouchers are now available for House Cats and Backer Cats!
updates.update_content:
Wow. It's done! Catlateral Damage has launched and is up for sale on Steam! INCREDIBLE!
The latest build has new levels, including the mansion and the modern deco home. There are tons of bug fixes, new additions, trading cards, and tweaks to make the game more fun. If you've been waiting for launch to go play the game, now is the time to check it out!
Important stuff: If you like the game and enjoy playing it then we ask that you please leave us a review on Steam, or tweet about the game today to let people know that it's out. Reviews matter to Steam's internal ranking system when it comes to storefront promotion, so you'll be doing us a big favor. Twitter matters because it'll help us to increase our signal as we shout that the game is out :)

campaign.story:
We'll be relaunching!
The Anti-Gravity System.
     Magnetic Coupling Hardware.
Meet the family: AG Pack, Rover, Lander, & Fuel Cell.
The Anti-Gravity Pack along with the Rover (pencil case), Lander (laptop bag) and Fuel Cell (accessories bag) allow you to put everything in its place and get out and explore. 
The Rover and Fuel Cell use male Fidlock hardware and are interchangeable - connecting to either the AG Pack or Lander. Take just what you need or put them all together and carry everything an adventure might require.
//PLAYFUL INNOVATION, QUALITY, & AFFORDABILITY.
PLAY

     When you pledge, you're not just helping the Anti-Gravity system become a reality, but you're showing your support of a brand that is dedicated to creating connections to our childhood, and delivering a high quality product at an affordable price.
Ventilated shoulder harnesses, adjustable sternum strap, and concealed stash pockets.
Lander and detachable Fuel Cell. The Lander is designed to fit a 15" MacBook or laptops of comparable size.
//DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT:
Design inspiration came from spacesuits and the modularity of shuttles.
Inside each of us is the desire to escape and explore. Our journey may take us as close as the backyard or as far as the moon. Either way, there is a basic human quality that leaves us craving to break free and find a new frontier.
The Tessel Anti-Gravity Pack is inspired by space exploration and the endless possibilities of an uncharted imagination. The modular features of each product invite you to disconnect from the repetition of life and embark on a new mission.
//WIN AN ANTI-GRAVITY PACK:
Win the one and only Apollo colorway AG Pack.
For a chance to win the only Apollo Anti-Gravity Pack (white front, gray back), Instagram a photo of yourself and show us your love for space and adventures. Use these hashtags: #tessel #agpack #agpackgiveaway #everydayanadventure and tag us! Our favorite will win the Apollo and four runners-up will win the Deep Space version of the AG Pack. (We can't see private accounts - so please inbox us the photo!) We will pick the winners on July 11.
Feel free to be our friends on Facebook, Instagram, Tumblr, and Twitter.
Every day an adventure.
//SHIPPING INFORMATION:
International shipping available in select countries during our Kickstarter.
 Photos by Chelsie Clarke
Watch the inspiration for the pack here:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This isn't our first rodeo. Through our experience with the Tessel Jet Pack Kickstarter, development, and distribution, we've got a decent idea of what it takes to deliver your rewards (on time). We have visited the manufacturer and know that the Anti-Gravity system is executable (all the images you see are the manufacturer's development samples). Distribution is already set up for when the bags are completed. Really all that's left are a few tweaks to the design, and having the necessary funds to order materials and get production started.

Here's how we'll accomplish this dream.

Production Schedule:
June-July: Raise funds for manufacturing through Kickstarter
July: Travel to our manufacturer in the Philippines to finalize the pieces for manufacturing and place the order.
August-October: Production of pieces.
October-December: Shipment of pieces to our distributors.
December-January: Send out all rewards to our backers.
January: Release the Anti-Gravity system on our website and in select stores.

We understand there are issues that may arise in material availability, lead times, politics, foreign affairs, holidays, etc. We will post updates throughout the process of production and shipping - including updates while we're in the Philippines. Any delays will be communicated through our Kickstarter updates.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Your friends,

Hey Kickstartians!
As you know, we made the decision to cancel our funding on the Anti-Gravity Pack System. We're excited to revamp our campaign and relaunch soon. We are grateful for your support and ask for your support when we relaunch - which will definitely help us get a very quick start and get some good momentum starting out. 
We'll present the concept better, we'll have a smaller goal, and we'll try and get some solid media coverage lined up. Any help or feedback between now and then is welcome.
You guys are the best!
