campaign.story:
NOTE:  After our campaign is complete, please visit us at www.TheSpacePlan.com
News Flash: STRETCH GOAL ESTABLISHED - If the campaign reaches $22,500 we'll be able to add a hyperlink to each of the hundreds of boxes on the updated ISP making it both more interesting and useful than ever before!
News Flash:  National Space Society Backs ISP Campaign!
News Flash:  All Backers at the $25 level or higher will get a free 1 year membership to the Space Frontier Foundation.  New "package" rewards posted including international shipping option.
In the late 1980s, an Integrated Space Plan (ISP) was developed to give a visual representation showing how the major space infrastructure elements fit together (see image below). The original plan by Ron Jones at Rockwell International adorned many walls at research institutions, universities, and aerospace companies, and even the wall of the NASA administrator’s office. We understand that a few copies of the ISP are still to be found on the walls of some NASA Field Centers.
Original ISP
Now it is time to revisit the ISP and fully update it for the remarkable events coming over the next century! But updating the plan is just the first step, we have much more planned...
PLAY

Many people talk about “The Space Program” but there are many different efforts to move humanity to the stars. Of course the United States has its projects, but so do the various nations of the European Space Agency, Russia, China, Japan and India. Many people don’t know that there are more than 50 national space programs!
To add to this confusion, there are more than 100 commercial efforts to develop space capabilities. These range from launch providers to a host of supporting technologies and contractor companies. Many non-profits, and academic research programs are also heavily involved in this field. Then we consider the ‘big ideas’ that are space programs in their own right, like asteroid mining, space elevators, space stations, space-based solar power, and settlement of the Moon and Mars.
Joining with Ron Jones, Integrated Space Analytics will update the ISP with the latest developments in the space industry, including its increased internationalization and commercialization. The ISP will also be published on a public website to allow in-depth exploration of the connections across the entire industry. It will be a valuable tool for people in the industry to understand the desired space infrastructure, and its influence on our economy.
Our goal is to introduce to the public the breadth and complexity of our efforts on space exploration and development. For that purpose, this project will re-introduce the Integrated Space Plan format and its benefits as a visualization tool. We will update the ISP to reflect today’s programs and the current view of how our future in space will develop. It will be inclusive in nature containing commercial, national, academic, military, and non-profit projects. The associated website will be interactive, with discussion groups and other feedback mechanisms. Most importantly, the ISP will show which projects are most urgent and must be prioritized because they are the building blocks our future will be based on.
Space Shuttle
What are the rewards of our campaign?  Our main tangible reward is your very own copy of the Integrated Space Plan...large, or GIANT in size.  The reward to everyone is an updated online version of the ISP...so the whole world knows what our future in space can and should be!
The ISP, originally created toward the end of the Cold War between the USA and the USSR, was a symbol of hope. It was an acknowledgement of our common human goals. The ISP was intended to portray the global vision of the worldwide space leadership regarding our future in space, back to the Moon, then on toward Mars, asteroids, and eventually to other stars. The Integrated Space Plan understood, implicitly, that the only way to develop lunar and martian bases, large space stations, space elevators, space based solar power systems, and to harvest asteroids, was have a system that depicted who was planning to provide various capabilities...and when.  Anything this complex does indeed require a complex planning capability.  The updated ISP will be a valuable tool in both comprehending the challenges and opportunities ahead, but also the interconnected nature of space development. 
Supporting Organizations:
Our new, soon-to-be updated Integrated Space Plan will remain firmly fixed on those same ideas. The updated ISP will show how the various pieces of our future space architecture can work together. Since the last update of the plan, much of the content, like the International Space Station for example, has gone from science fiction to technological reality; and the vision of the future where commercial firms help lead the way into space has come to pass. In the early days of the space race there were two nations participating; there are now over a dozen nations funding large scale space efforts.  The Integrated Space Plan matters because it is the roadmap for the future of humanity.
Why is it important to revive the Integrated Space Plan now? Not since the Apollo program has the United States defined a common vision for space architecture development. This has impacted the space programs of many nations. As a result, the global space program lacks consensus on goals, and the leadership to push the boundaries of this frontier.
Endeavour & Intelsat
Each commercial, academic and national space program, taken collectively, adds to the worldwide effort to go to space. Each has their own plan, and each operates from their own agenda and with their own resources. This is a good thing! This makes for a vibrant, varied and continually expanding global space program. It is our hope that a revived ISP that takes advantage of the power of the Internet can help build an international understanding of long-term goals and near term objectives. The Integrated Space Plan 2.0 will show how each of these independent efforts fits within this larger context. This will help shape a global vision and an intelligently defined stepping-stone approach to expansion into space.
Why are we raising funding on Kickstarter?
For the updated Integrated Space Plan to have any purpose, people have to see it. Kickstarter is a great way to introduce a product to a lot of people, in a short period of time, and on a tight budget. In other words...perfect for us.
What will we do with the money we raise?
Well, a good chunk of it will be used for printing and mailing out the ISP itself for our backers’ rewards, and of course some goes to our generous hosts at Kickstarter and Amazon for providing this crowdfunding opportunity. The remainder will go to for the purpose of making, maintaining, and expanding the uses of the updated Integrated Space Plan. Doing the actual update of the ISP will be a lot of fun for space nuts like us, but we also understand that it is going to be a very large and complicated task. Lucky for us, we have the creator of the original ISP onboard to help guide the process! We also know a lot of people in the space industry who are doing much of the actual work that the ISP describes – and many of these people have pledged their support to help make the ISP as complete and accurate as possible. Even though we’ll be donating a lot of time into this effort ourselves, we know there will be costs involved along the way. Once the ISP is updated, we have an even more ambitious use for it. We will be posting an interactive version of the ISP online! We also have several additional planned features that we’re going to keep under our hats for now ;) 
And finally, after this current update is completed, we intend to keep updating the ISP on a regular basis to make sure it continues to be an accurate reflection of current and anticipated events for space development. We’ve calculated that our $18,000 goal is enough to get us into the volume printing discounts for the ISP posters and still have the resources needed to create and maintain a solid interactive website. 
If we raise significantly more than our goal through this Kickstarter effort, then we will be able to make the ISP a much more expansive resource with some really great additional educational and space industry specific capabilities.
Proposed Lunar Base
ISP Kickstarter Team Members:
Why is the Integrated Space Plan so desperately needed...because a picture is worth a thousand words!
 * In the period around 1990 when the Integrated Space Plan was developed and released to the public it was embraced by many of the space community's top leaders.  These are a few of the quotes from the ISP's debut.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The space community is composed of a large number of very bright people with differing opinions on priorities, destinations, mission architectures, and fundamental objectives. The primary challenge of our project is to survey the collective knowledge of the community and synthesize it into a form that the majority of the community will embrace.

The primary risk of our campaign is that it will take longer than projected to do the necessary research, achieve internal consensus on the results, and publish our findings in poster form and online.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Last Call for Integrated Space Plan Kickstarter at T-minus 20 Hours
updates.update_content:
As I write this our campaign has about 20 hours left. Although we’ve successfully raised over $12,000 – we are $3,900 short. For those of you new to Kickstarter, it’s an all or nothing platform. If we don’t reach the campaign goal of $16,000, we will have no funds to update the Integrated Space Plan or to create the Race to the Moon poster.
I know that we can raise $3,900 in our last day because in our last two campaigns we averaged over $6,000 on our last day. However, this doesn’t mean that we will reach the goal…it just means that we can. The stakes are high. Our small volunteer team provides the most detailed long-term depiction of what we need to do in space over the years to come.

updates.update_userinfo: Urgent: Kickstarter For Integrated Space Plan & Race to the Moon Poster Ends Monday
updates.update_content:
Over the past five years you’ve helped us create and update the Integrated Space Plan, and in that time, it has grown and developed into an important reference source for policy makers, business leaders, space advocates, futurists, and more! 
Currently, our campaign to update the Integrated Space Plan (ISP) has only 5 days left. This means we need to raise an additional $7,800 in those 5 days, otherwise the campaign will fail, and the project will receive $0. Nada. Nothing. No funding to design, print, and distribute the 2019 ISP or the Race to The Moon poster.

updates.update_userinfo: We've Launched A New Kickstarter For An ISP Update & A Race To The Moon Poster
Axe Capital Boosts ISP Campaign Into Orbit
updates.update_content:
Team ISP:
When we were planning our campaign we thought it would be appropriate for today to be our last day.  Today in 1961 Yuri Gagarin became the first person in space and today in 1981 the first space shuttle was launched.  These events laid the foundation that we're building upon today.

updates.update_userinfo: Integrated Space Plan Race - 3 Days Left
updates.update_content:
Team ISP:
With three days left in our campaign we stand at 71% of our campaign goal.  We have supporters from 29 US states and from 18 countries around the world.  Our current leading states are California and Florida and leading nations (other than the US) are the United Kingdom and Norway.

Team ISP:
April is a special month in space history. In April our first astronauts, the Mercury 7, were announced with great fanfare. If you were around in 1959, you probably envision those fine men as the guys on the left. If you were not around in 1959, your mental image may be that of their Hollywood counterparts on the right.

Team ISP:
Today SpaceX made history and unlocked the future for all of us!  For so many years many "experts" claimed that it was impossible to bring back a rocket's first stage and land it.  Others held the opinion that even if it were possible to safely land a first stage, that the wear and tear from the first flight would make it impossible to reuse it.
Elon Musk and SpaceX have shown that it is possible to reuse a first stage, opening the door to dramatically lowering launch costs.  The future that the Integrated Space Plan has depicted since 1989 has never been closer than it is today.

updates.update_userinfo: We're Putting The Band Back Together
updates.update_content: Team ISP:

updates.update_userinfo: Kickstarter For New 2017 Edition of Integrated Space Plan Launched
updates.update_content:
ISP Backers Of Our 2014 Campaign:
About a week ago I contacted you to let you know we were launching a new campaign to enhance the Integrated Space Plan and update it for 2017.  It's fantastic that many of you have already backed our new campaign and I thank you for your commitment!  We're off to a good start and we've raised almost a fourth of our goal.
During our campaign's first week we've seen breathtaking announcements from SpaceX & Blue Origin.  SpaceX plans to send 2 tourists to the Moon and back next year and Blue Origin plans to begin payload deliveries to the Moon's surface...perhaps as early as 2020!

Backers:
Thanks to your support we were able to bring back the Integrated Space Plan in 2015.  We updated all the contents, created a beautiful full color ISP with the help of our friends at 212box, and brought the ISP to the web for the first time.
But since the contents of the 2015 ISP were determined about 2 years ago, tremendous strides have been made.  Blue Origin & SpaceX have shown us that first stages can be recovered and reused.

campaign.story:
** Watch the first PHD Movie here: phdmovie.com
** NEW Stretch Goals Added!
** NEW Rewards Added!
What is this?
In 2011, we took a huge risk and did something that had never been done before: an independently produced movie adaptation of an online comic. The PHD Movie, based on Piled Higher and Deeper (phdcomics.com), featured real grad students and scientists in many of the lead roles (including producer and director), and was screened at over 500 Universities and Research Centers worldwide (including Antarctica!) during its release.
We want to create a film that follows up on the characters from the first movie and tells more hilarious and heart-felt stories from the front lines of Academic research.
Many of the people involved in the first movie are starting to move on, so our window to make this is short! Let's make something amazing happen!
What do I get if I contribute?
You get to see the movie! All rewards give you access to the movie once we release it.  BUT HERE'S THE THING: At $100K, our Kickstarter goal is only enough to cover the production costs for a 30 minute sequel (film production is very expensive). So, the more we raise, the longer and better we can make the movie! Help make the movie better for everyone by telling your friends and spreading the word!
In addition to the rewards, all backers get behind-the-scenes access to our writing and production updates. You get to see what Jorge and the cast are doing and watch early clips from the movie!
How can I help?
We know grad students have a limited budget, so there are other ways you can help. The most important thing is to spread the word! Post this on Facebook, Twitter, or Tumblr throughout the campaign. Tell your labmates! Tell your parents!  Tell your Professor! Ok, maybe don't tell your Professor (unless they are PHD Comics fans).
In addition to helping us spread the word, we will need a lot of extras, actors for small parts, and musicians.  If you are interested and live in Southern California, please contact us!
Why a sequel?
Why do a follow-up project? During the release of the first movie, we got emails from people all over the world who had seen the movie:
'Your movie helped me get my academic life back in perspective.' -Kaitlyn, Michigan Tech U.
'It gave me so much comfort to know that I'm not the only one suffering!' -Amanda, Queen's U.
'Oh it's brilliant! Simply a marvel!' -David, Tech. U. of Denmark
'I realized my feelings about my research are normal.' -Sinikiwe, U. of the Witwatersrand, South Africa
We think the first movie resonated with a lot of people because it showed something that you don't typically see in other movies or shows: that scientists and researchers are human, and they are passionate and funny. A sequel would let us tell more stories about these characters and help communicate to the public what it's like to be an academic.
What is PHD Comics?
If you aren't familiar with PHD Comics, it is one of the longest running comic strips online (www.phdcomics.com). About 7 million people visit the website each year, with readers from every continent. To catch up, check out this list of TOP 200 PHD Comics. We're also the same people who started PHD TV, a science and discovery outreach channel on YouTube with over 4 million views.
What's the movie about?
Whereas the first movie was about creativity and passion, the theme of the second movie will be the Quest for Significance (significant results, feeling significant). The general plot finds Cecilia about to submit and defend her thesis. Expect lots of jokes about the agony of writing, dealing with your committee, more jokes about being a Teaching Assistant and overcoming the dreaded Impostor Syndrome.
Sketches from Jorge's notebook as he brainstorms ideas for the movie. You'll get access to more of these when you back the project.
If we raise enough, the plot will take the entire Smith lab to a remote academic conference, where we'll meet a host of new characters, including some from the comics archive like Mariko and Prof. Smith's Nemesis, Dr. Sangeeta (dun dun dun!).
How will the money be spent?
Production costs include equipment rental (nice cameras, lenses, lights, rigs, stands, sound board, mics), crew, location fees, insurance, security, transportation, food (we can't power this movie on ramen noodles alone!), support staff, props, actors and extras. Post-production costs include editing, color timing, sound engineering and mixing, composer, music recording, musicians, music rights, computers, hard drives and software.
Stretch Goals! 
We made our minimum, now let's see how awesome we can make this movie!
(Unlocked!) $110,000: Exclusive comic! Jorge will post a special comic for backers only.
(Unlocked!) $115,000: Tajel gets married wedding scene. If it fits the final script, we'll have enough to stage the wedding scene.
(Unlocked!) $120,000: Longer movie! We'll stretch the budget to give you more of the story we want to tell.
(Unlocked!) $125,000: The University with the most Backers gets a free screening and live Q&A with Jorge and a member of the Cast and Crew. If you're a backer, we'll hang out before the movie and give you free food (it might be ramen).
(Unlocked!) $130,000: All backers at or above Full Professor will get a signed 8.5x11 print of their favorite PHD Strip.
(Unlocked!) $135,000: Longer movie! We'll stretch the budget to give you more of the story we want to tell!
(Unlocked!) $140,000: ????? Mystery! For Backers only.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every film project is risky, and many things can happen on set and during post-production. However, our team has produced and distributed one movie before, plus over 57 high-quality videos for PHD TV (phdcomics.com/tv). In addition we will have production insurance and contingency plans.

The biggest issue will be making the most of our funds. Our goal of $100K is really only enough to film a 30 minute movie. We will film as efficiently as possible without sacrificing quality.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
About the Artist
My name is Sarah Marie Zarzour. I am a 22-year-old self taught oil pastel artist who lives in Fredericksburg, Va. I first made myself known to the online community by making my facebook page: Sarah's Canvas
Here I post progress photos, host contests and coupons, and share local events that my art will be part of.
Step-By-Step example of Kovu the dashchund!
Early Influence
My life in art started as a love for animals and nature. I grew up in Evanston, Wyoming and truly loved my life out west: exploring the canyons, going to the rodeo, gazing at the stars in a crystal clear sky that stretched for hundreds of miles.. and wrestling pigs to win a piggy bank! Yes, when I was a child, I wanted to be a vet, until I was old enough to realize that my severe allergies to cats would never allow it. At the same age I was fascinated by cartoons and decided I would become an animator. 
Education
When I turned 19, I got my GED and started attending the Media Arts & Animation program at the Art Institute of Washington in Arlington. However, after 3 semesters, I stopped going there due to an expensive yet poor education. Now I attend my local Community College to get my certificate in Business, and I plan to one day get my degree in Art or Business from the University of Colorado.
working hard in 2012 - nothing has changed...except the blonde hair!
Since founding Sarah's Canvas in May of 2012, I have drawn many pet portraits (cats, horses, but mostly dogs) for people all across the country! I even have one international portrait in Scotland!
"Minnie the Pug" 9x12 in Scotland
One thing that makes my art & business unique is that I record my drawings in progress and turn them into time lapse videos, so you can watch my pet portraits come to life in just a few minutes! You can find all my art videos here: YouTube.com/SarahsCanvas 
Time Lapse Drawing of a Snow Leopard
PLAY

Goals
My work has opened new doors for myself in printmaking and I would like to create an art-filled calendar in time for the holiday season! My goal is to make 50 new pet portraits by August 5th, 2014! That's where you come in! Pledgers 3-12 will all have their pet's portrait drawn & receive a copy of the Pet Portraits 2015 Calendar in August!
size: print / original
6x6: $16 / $60
9x9: $19 / $90
9x12: $21 / $110
14x17: $27 / $175
18x24: $35 / $250
Can I receive the original art before your Kickstarter Project ends in June?Certainly! Please pledge for a print for now, after the artwork is complete I will send an invoice via PayPal for the difference and ship the portrait to you ASAP once I'm paid. You will still receive your print and calendar in August! :) If you can wait till June 9th, please pledge for the original and you will get a signed copy of the Pet Portraits Calendar in August!
Can I have more than one pet in the portrait?
Absolutely! But here is my size guide for the # of pets you want drawn:
Simply attach as many photos of your pet(s) in an email to Sarah@SarahsCanvas.com and watch your pet turned into art within the week! Of all these portraits, I will select my top favorites to be showcased in the 2015 Pet Portraits Calendar! Pledgers 8-12 will received a personally signed calendar along with their original custom pet portrait!
Cool huh? And that's just ONE MONTH! :D
*Remember, your custom art & feedback might make it into the calendar!*
With your support, I will be able to pay for supplies needed to make my original artwork, as well as for the ink and paper I will need to make lots of prints and calendars; and finally, to send my artwork all over the country, and even the world, is a reward that you are giving ME by backing this project! Thank you! Sincerely,
Sarah Marie Zarzour
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've given myself the month of July to finish any portraits that have been commissioned by my backers as well as make the calendar. That way, I will be ready to send prints, original art, and calendars, in August, when the Fall season is approaching and plans for the holidays and new year start forming!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
I understand why a few of you are frustrated (WHAT'S TAKING SO LONG?).
Fortunately, my laptop has a new internal hard drive and I can finally complete my Kickstarter Project! I am sooo sorry for the delay... know that your artwork is safe and I am eager to complete my calendar and send everything out in the next week or so. :)

Hello everyone!
If you hadn't heard, I recently moved to Colorado. I started out living in a room in someone's house but it was "not right" to say the least. So I had to move again, this time into an apartment with 3 other roommates my age. :)
I took a hiatus from drawing in August because I could not work in that environment... Instead I soaked up the rest of summer, traveled around with new friends and gained inspiration from the artists and musicians in CO.
I'm finally settled in my new place and I'm tackling my commissions. Many of you are wondering when I'll ship your portrait- please continue to show patience; I will mail all the prints with the calendar at the end of the month.
If you ordered an original, you will receive it asap.
Thank you for your understanding! :)

I have been struck with the happy stick! My Kickstarter Project made $1,973 which is well over my goal of $1300! THANK YOU! I can't thank my backers enough! I am astonished at the amount of support I received through my campaign; I couldn't dream it would be this successful.
Thank you again! You make it possible for a 22 year old to live her artful dreams!
I'm deeply fulfilled and thankful! :)
-Sarah M Zarzour

campaign.story:
In case you don't know who David is, he's known mostly for his appearances on Tim & Eric Awesome Show Great Job! and his public access show, The Junior Christian Teaching Bible Lesson Program. Some of his popular songs include "Salame", "Father & Son", "Puberty" and "Marcama". He's communicated with aliens and has a large collection of puppets.  He also loves trains. 
With this album David is talking about important issues that the public needs to know about like the benefits of exercise and eating vegetables.  Also there will be songs about The Pickle Man and Mr. Moose (the orange ghosts that tickled David and his sisters in their sleep as children), teleportation, James Quall being on crack, David's love for nature, David's thoughts about rap music, and a few songs revolving around David's long-lasting quest to find a girlfriend. 
The music on this album is very futuristic and electronic, using advanced technology from the 80's, because that's what the kids like these days.  It's made by Jonah Mociun (also known as Th' Mole) and it's great.  Jonah is working very hard to make David sound better than ever before.  You can take a listen to some snippets of drafts below and decide what you think for yourself: https://soundcloud.com/whateveryourheartdesires/david-liebe-hart-teleportation-through-space-preview https://soundcloud.com/whateveryourheartdesires/liebehart-you-dont-love-me-draft/s-3oHuL 
We need money to pay for Jonah's gas expenses since he has to drive 10 hours to visit David for recording and rehearsing for live shows (coming soon to a town near you!).  The extra money will go towards the gifts that you will receive, and if there's more after that it will go towards touring an awesome live show featuring puppets, video projection, aerobics & David's standup comedy. If there's money beyond that it will go towards filming a top secret TV show pilot starring David and directed by Jonah which we are very excited about.
(Who am I, the guy typing this?  I'm Jonah. I'm 36, been doing music semi-professionally since about 2000. I have a very cute chihuahua named Wizelle. More music and info about me here - http://spaz.org/thmole.  I met David from interviewing him for my radio show and before I knew it I was helping him do web stuff and soon we were working on music together. It's been awesome getting to know David and I'm proud to call him a friend. He's a truly good hearted person and I'm happy to try and help his career while making really cool music with him.)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Once the album is complete (it's almost complete now), we'll send it around to a bunch of record labels and hopefully get a nice deal so we can spread the positive messages and glorious sounds to the furthest reaches of the globe, tour all over the place, make cool music videos, and all that. But even if we don't get a record deal we'll still release the album by ourselves and it will be great. We really appreciate any support. Thank you very much. Salamé!!!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Here are lyrics for "The Pickle Man & Mr. Moose" from the album, which is 99% complete!  This is one of David's favorite stories from his childhood to tell people, and I think it's pretty hilarious.  In the recorded version, after the lyrics below, I interview David to get some further details about these "orange ghosts" and it's pure comedy gold.  The song is pretty cool, all in all, in my opinion.  I made the music based on cheap toy keyboards, beefed up with 808 kick drums, etc. and I added my own falsetto background vocals.  I'm very excited for you to hear it, along with the rest of the album.  However we have quite a ways to go, as far as funding the Kickstarter, so I hope some wealthy/generous people step up and help soon!  Please keep your fingers crossed, help us spread the word, and remember you do have the option of increasing your pledge! In any case thank you very much for your support.  Me and David both sincerely appreciate it. <3 <3 <3

updates.update_userinfo: What is so special about David?
updates.update_content:
I recently received the following message regarding the Kickstarter: 
Hi, Jonah. I have some questions I hope you can answer about the album, the Kickstarter fund, and other things, before I make any decisions about donating. "I appreciate absurd humor-- Tim and Eric Awesome Show is one of my favorite sources of comedy of all time, which is how I've come to know about David Liebe Hart. But lots of people could use money to do things they want to do, myself included. What's the purpose of this album? Maybe it doesn't need a purpose. Art doesn't always need reason or meaning. But let's face it, the music isn't fun to listen to. It is to be appreciated in an ironic way. I would never listen to this music of my own accord without watching some accompanying video, like Mr. David Liebe Hart singing with a puppet, a la Tim and Eric. The satire of public broadcasting techniques helps sell the music which otherwise has no serious aesthetic value, other than expressing the thoughts and feelings of a washed-up man who is almost 60 years old.

campaign.story:
Hi, My names Jodi Ann Bickley and 15 months ago I started a project called One Million Lovely Letters. I started it on a night I was at my lowest and needed to create a lighthouse for myself. After a brain infection and a suspected mini stroke in late 2011, I had been diagnosed with pretty severe M.E which meant I could no longer work my two jobs and had to spend a lot of time either in bed or in the house. I wanted to create something to get up for, something that would ignite my spirit. So I created the website within twenty minutes and stated that if you were having a bad day, I would handwrite you a lovely letter. The letter you’d want from your best friend on your worst day. I put the website link on facebook and twitter and within an hour I had received over 100 emails from all over the globe. People who were in their own storm clouds and going through their own battles were reaching out to me and since that day my whole life has changed. In the last 15 months I have written just over 3000 letters, to people in 30 countries with a further 4000 requests in my inbox – a number that is growing daily. The website has been viewed in just over 150 countries and the project has made headlines in the UK, America, Australia and Greece. 
The project was also turned into a book, which recently became a Sunday Times Bestseller. I also got the opportunity to give a TED talk about One Million Lovely Letters which has been seen by just under 15,000 people.
What I started is extremely simple, it’s one human being reaching out and saying you know what I’m a little bit broken too and if you need someone to walk up that mountain or go through that storm with you. I’m here. Every day I get stories of loneliness, depression, heartache, abuse, bereavement, people who just need a little reminder of how incredible and strong they are or would like someone else to be reminded.
For the last 15 months the project has survived on my benefit money and stamp donations from people I’ve sent letters to. I have battled to get to a point, health wise where I can now take the project out as I’ve seen what it’s done in the last year and that’s from my living room – the thought of what it could do beyond that is the most exciting thing in the world. The project has gone global, it is bigger than anything I could have ever imagined and to be able to take it to the next step would be actually life changing. It would mean that this would be my job. I would be able to go out and involve people and give workshops. In the workshops we would create care packages of lovely letters for the strangers that write in or create a wall of encouraging lovely letters for that specific community whether that be working with schools, community centres, festivals, support groups, young offenders, an elderly tea group – any group of people that want to be involved, can be. 
As I currently work from my house it's a little dangerous to put my address on the internet, having funding means I will be able to set up a PO Box that I can make public, that people will then be able to send their own lovely letters too. These letters I am then going to use in 'Find the right words' exhibits all over the UK and beyond where people can visit and find the letter that feels like it was written just for them. The exhibit will start full of letters and by the end, it will be empty and many more people will have benefited from the project.
Each week I’d have two days where I can pay the expenses of three volunteers to come in and sit and write letters with me to get through the many requests that I have and that continue to come in everyday. Getting people involved and giving them the opportunity to have that joy that I get from the project would be an absolutely amazing thing.
In fifteen months, the project has made a massive social impact – I’m connecting with people all over the world via letters, empathy and kindness, but there is so much more that is possible – so much more the project is capable of. The project has become too big for just my hands and now I need some extra help, for the project to grow and continue. I don’t want it to be something I just did once until I got better and went back to being a barmaid. I want it to be something I get to dedicate my whole life to, something others can be included in and share the magic of. I have shown what I can do from my living room, let me show you what I’m capable of with a helping hand and let out into the world. This is my life, this has been all I have done single handedly and all I want to do and with your help and support the project will be able to move forward and I will earn a living from the thing that has not only changed my life but the lives of many other people too.
Examples of Letters:
The Money Bit
What will £10,000 pounds do for my project?
My target this year is to send 7,000 letters - with £3,000 I will be able to buy 5,000 stamps, a mixture of 2nd class and worldwide postage. 
Pay for volunteer expenses - £1,200 will pay for the travel and tea for three volunteers a week to come into One Million Lovely Letters HQ and help me through the letter pile.
Travelling with the project - £1,500 for the year will go towards me paying for travel expenses to take the project out in workshop form.
Setting up a PO Box - For the year I will be able to get a PO Box for people to send their own lovely letters to for £324.00
Stationary & Workshop Materials - £780 to stock One Million Lovely Letters HQ with paper, pens, envelopes. glitter, stickers and all other bits of wonder that make the letters feel like little bits of magic. 
Living costs - Alongside working on the project full time I am going to work a part time job to earn money to put back in to the project and help it grow even further. With £3,200 of the money I am going to put towards living costs, which will give me approximately £266 pound a month so I can dedicate more time to the project. 
***** This is where the extra pennies go if we go over £10,000! *****
A One Million Lovely Letters office - This will be the place I can invite volunteers to come and help me write letters and keep all things OMLL (as I've said up there ^^ I'm currently working from my front room which is lovely for just me but for bringing more people in I think it would be just the best to have somewhere central that can be where One Million Lovely Letters lives and people have room to sit! For a whole year this will cost - £1,800
Employing two letter writers: Along with volunteers, two people would be employed by One Million Lovely Letters part time. Because of the amount of letters they will also have access to the Lovely Letters inbox and will be introduced on the website as part of the New Lovely Letters team. One person will be based in the UK and one in North America who can dedicate time every month to helping get through the letters, so we can keep up. I would like to be able to pay £200 a month (as it would not only include letters but materials, which really adds up!).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Having M.E means that I am at risk of having another crash, however I have worked extremely hard this year to get to a point where I feel I am managing it and I feel able to take the project to the next level. However, by getting more people involved in the project, it will mean that if I do have another crash (fingers and everything else crossed I don't) the project will be able to continue whilst I fix.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Space Cadet, by Madi Payge (Find her at $100 Reward Tier)
FREE PAINTINGS FUNDED:   301 (Over $100,000 value)
REWARD PAINTINGS CHOSEN: 91 (Over $30,000 value)
***
Our project is now becoming much more permanent! We have a website and plan on making this an ongoing event! See our website at http://paintingsforstrangers.com/ for more info!
What is my project? 
I want to give away hundreds of original paintings to strangers in our community (Salt Lake City), completely for free. I am working with 5 local artists, including neo-surrealist-psychedelic-cubist artist Alex Lucas, who will help make these paintings. It only costs us $10 to give away one painting. By backing my project, you are paying directly for the canvases and paint used to make the paintings that we give away. 
Dax, from our video, as he receives his free painting
Additionally, the artists that I am working with have agreed to make approximately 100 reward paintings for you!
The 100 Blank Canvases with Hunter S. Thompson and Crucifixion Lady by Murder
Project Plan:
Make reward paintings (July 2014 - February 2015)
Fulfill reward paintings (February 2015 - June 2015)
Make and give away free paintings (June 2015 - June 2016)
*************
Note: If you do not opt for a reward painting, each $10 that you donate will fund one painting for a stranger.  
Similarly, each $10 that you donate above the level of your reward tier will fund an additional painting for a stranger.
*************
How many paintings will we give away to strangers?

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This project is relatively low risk. There is more than enough time to fulfill the painting shipments, there is very little capital to deal with, and I have already negotiated cheap packaging for the canvases. If we finish sooner than anticipated the canvases will be mailed early.

Other than that, the only real risk is that a canvas is damaged in shipping. That would be a tragedy for all of us. We are going to minimize this risk by using packaging that is right-sized and by carefully wrapping each canvas for protection. Using right sized packaging will also help minimize our carbon footprint by producing less waste and making the transport as efficient as possible.

If a canvas does get damaged, please understand that we won't be able to send you a new one for free. We don't have a lot of money. That said, we would love to work with you to get you a new painting for as little cost as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello from Sweden!
First of all, we were featured in Kickstarter's blog alongside some of the most successful Kickstarter projects in history!!! Kickstarter backed our project so we sent them a painting and they put it in their blog! Here is a link! https://www.kickstarter.com/blog/this-week-in-kickstarter-51?ref=email 
Some of you have been wondering about the status of our project! As of last month, all of the reward paintings have been delivered! Great news!

Hello!

To keep everybody updated, I have mailed out about half of the reward paintings so far. I will have them all mailed out by May 20th. I am using USPS to ship since they are the cheapest, although they have given me estimated arrival dates as far out as 3 weeks in some cases. I figure this will let us make more free paintings for strangers though.

This brings me to my next update: I will be gone over the summer until August. That is why I need to ship these paintings by May 20th. This also means that we won't be able to work on the Free Paintings for Strangers phase of this project until I get back.

Hey Everybody!!!
I've got some photos for you! I have an appointment this friday to get these packaged and will start to ail them out sometime next week. This is just the first batch, I will mail out the second batch in April, so don't worry if you don't get your painting yet!

If you are local and haven't picked yours up yet, please contact me!

Here are some shots of the progress we are making! Murder is doing some very interesting pieces where he lines up multiple canvases and paints them all at once, just like a classic street art piece on a wall. Some of you will be getting small excerpts of the underground graffiti world! Here are some images:

Hello! It's been a while since the last update, so here is the next one!
Some great news: Murder recently had an artistic breakthrough due to this project, so expect to see him using a completely new technique in his paintings! I will post images of his new method/style once he completes more works using it.
Next, it looks like we will be able to start fulfilling rewards earlier than expected. Most of the rewards are due in May, June, or July, but we are now expecting to be shipping out perhaps 15-20 paintings in January to February. I will message you beforehand to confirm your address. Otherwise, everything is on track! We have a lot of work to do, but my artists are 100% dedicated to these paintings and this project!

Hello Everybody!
Thank you so much for supporting our project! We are in our last few hours and wanted to thank each and every one of you for making this possible! We have come a long way! This was our third attempt at the Kickstarter project, and it finally worked for us!
Let's try for one final push! Share the project on Facebook, tell your friends and family, do whatever you can! This is a team effort, and you are a part of it!

Hello,
I am proud to announce that another artist is joining our team! Her name is Madi Payge, and she is absolutely incredible! Lucky for you, she will be making a limited number of reward paintings! If you have not backed the project yet, you can get one of her paintings at the $100 reward tier.

campaign.story:
Bow Ties by Rukas The Cat 
Our company is a small husband and wife run business. We first began making bow ties for our cat, Rukas, because we couldn’t find what we were seeking in the pet accessory industry. Crochet bow ties allowed us to give a certain warmth element. Each bow tie is hand made to ensure quality.
We will need your help with several aspects of the company. The pledges will help us establish a website along with getting our name out there through marketing. You will also help fund materials and the work that will go into these bow ties. 
Our Bow Ties fit neck sizes 7-10 inches approximately. Please make sure to measure your pet’s neck before placing a pledge. Bow ties are not limited to feline use only.
Bow Ties by Rukas the Cat are made with hand picked yarn and are available in limited quantities. The crochet collar uses a button to secure in place and ensure the purrfect fit anywhere on the band.
Bow ties are meant for fashion purposes only. Our products are designed to unbutton under stress but please keep your pet’s supervised while being worn.
100% Acrylic yarn
Hand-made in the USA
Care: Machine wash on low. Do not bleach. Tumble dry at low heat. Do not iron.
Let your furry friend express their personality with one of our hand made bow ties! With several color combinations, find the purrfect fit.
The cat
Rukas (pronounced Roo-kiss) is an adult Himalayan cat that was adopted May 2013. He had been previously abused, but through the much love poured into him at the Old Bridge Animal Shelter, Rukas left that life behind. He now resides in NJ and loves to sport all of his bow ties, along with his angry face. Rukas enjoys car rides, boiled chicken and sitting on his cat castle.
Here are the available bow ties! 
 BONUS DESIGNS:
"Party Animal"
Kickstarter Pick
Rukas says, "These bow ties will make you look like a boss!"
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With every great product, comes an obstacle in achieving success. The difficulty with this project is getting the word out and building our brand in the pet community. Once that is done, our difficulty will be keeping up with the demand. Each bow tie is personally hand-made. We will definitely need to expand our employees in the future.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Spaceteam Admiral's Club is a new way to support innovative, accessible, independent games. By directly supporting Henry you are helping to bring free games to the world for a whole year.
We came so close last time, reaching 81% of the goal with over 1400 backers. This time, with your help, I'm sure we can beat it.
The Admiral's Challenge
To promote the campaign the Admiral and I are issuing a challenge to Spaceteam players everywhere. Join us for the first-ever worldwide Spaceteam tournament... and win actual medals! The tournament will run from June 4th to July 6th and everyone is welcome to join.
Find a tournament in your area, compete for global high scores, and unlock special in-game rewards: http://spaceteamadmiralsclub.com/challenge
I'll be working on two brand new games, which are still in the prototype stages but I can share the ideas with you now:
Blabyrinth is a cooperative local multiplayer game for phones and tablets (like Spaceteam) about working together to follow clues and find secret treasure in a mysterious labyrinth. It will feel a bit like the board game Escape: The Curse of the Temple. I’m also inspired by Spelunky, Escape the Room-style games, Indiana Jones and TV game shows from my childhood The Crystal Maze and Knightmare.
Shipshape is a single-player game for phones and tablets about exploring a quirky galaxy in a spaceship that you snap together from modular components. It’s designed to be easy to play with simple gestures. It’s inspired by the board game Galaxy Trucker and the video games Escape Velocity and Star Control 2.
Exclusive features for backers: if you join the club at the Ambassador level or higher you'll unlock extra features in both new games that won't be available to anyone else.
Spaceteam will be getting some new features:
Accessibility options allowing you to adjust the game difficulty
New Translations: Russian and Hebrew are in progress, with more coming soon...
Exclusive member-only features like the Lexicogulator! (see below)
Spaceteam is my first project as an independent developer (“indie”). It’s a cooperative party game for phones and tablets in which you shout technobabble at your friends until your spaceship explodes. You can get it right now, for free, on iOS and Android. It has won several awards and is being played by children and grandparents, teachers, therapists, businesses, and medical schools. See the Spaceteam Retrospective for a look at Spaceteam’s success over the past year.
Put your own word lists in the game and share them with your friends! You’ll have access to an editor that lets you change the words and phrases in the game. Business buzzwords, medical jargon, inside jokes, whatever you want! 
The Physical Package comes with:
a "Be on my Spaceteam" button to encourage spontaneous Spaceteam adventures!
an embroidered NASA-style mission patch
a 3D lenticular membership card
a printed certificate with the Admiral's Club gold seal (so you know it’s authentic)
The Digital Package comes with digital versions of the rewards from the Physical package, and also includes:
the Spaceteam soundtrack
a set of Spaceteam ringtones/sound effects
Exclusive features in Blabyrinth and Shipshape: The Physical Rewards tier also includes special member-only features for both new games.
The next best thing to actually being in space is manipulating Magnetic Astrocouplets on your refrigeration unit. You will become a physical embodiment of the technobabble generation algorithm. Isn’t that something you’ve always wanted?
Design and upload your own character to use in the game! No longer will you be forced to annoy your teammates by repeatedly leaving the waiting room and reloading until you get a speckled felinoid wearing a lab coat.
Spaceteam Control named in your honour
The Lexicogulator will let you customize the words in your own private games and share them with friends, but how would you like to name an official control to be used by Spaceteams across the planet? Over one million people have already downloaded Spaceteam. They could be activating the Chen Flushclamp or the Johnson Hyperspigot. Why aren’t they??
Spaceteam Medal named in your honour
Spaceteams everywhere will be awarded a medal or trophy of your choosing. Will it be “April’s Medal of Awesomeness”, “Emily’s Commemorative Space-plaque”, “A Crystal Statue of Sara”? Only you can tell… me. And I’ll put it in the game.
**New!** : Leave your mark in Blabyrinth and Shipshape
In the brand new "Fleet Commander" tier you can now leave a personal touch in the upcoming games as well. In Blabyrinth you'll get to name a character and a treasure, and in Shipshape you'll get to name a planet and a sector. I can't give too many details yet, but you'll hear more as the games develop.
**New!** : Your Name in the Credits + Experimental Test Pilot Program
At this tier your generosity will lead to your name being immortalized in the credits as a Producer, or indeed whatever title you prefer :)
You will also be invited to test early versions of the new games before they're released to the public. You'll get a sneak preview of what's to come and can also influence their development by giving feedback and suggesting changes.
Discussion Forums
Connect with other Spaceteams across the galaxy. This will be the best way to keep up with Spaceteam and my other projects. You can share stories, ask questions, and make new spacefriends! You’ll get a special badge in the forum indicating your support level.
Discussion Forum: http://spaceteamadmiralsclub.com/forum
Developer Diary
I’ll be keeping a Captain's Blog (at least once a month) and sharing inside information on my development process. I’ll post about game design, programming, as many business details as I can share, and anything else I might learn along the way.
Secret Handshake
What? Nobody said anything about this you ask too many questions.
A stand-alone, private version of Spaceteam with your own words and graphics, to share with your group. Write it off on your company's budget as a team-building tool!
You'll get a game that plays like Spaceteam, but looks and feels the way you want, at a fraction of the cost of contracting a company to build an app for you:
New words
New graphics
New characters
New sounds and music
New logo and app name
I’ll provide templates, instructions and support for your custom assets and work with you to package them into a personalized version of the game for you.
PLEASE NOTE: On iOS your app will be delivered through Apple’s Volume Purchase Program for Business. Make sure you are eligible by visiting http://enroll.vpp.itunes.apple.com/. On Android it’s much simpler: I can just send you an APK to install directly.
VIP Reward
New to this campaign is the limited-access VIP tier, which lets you "dine at the Captain's Table". Visit the Spaceteam crew in Montréal and we'll take you out to some of our favourite places and then play board games with you. You can earn the coveted "Captain's Orders" achievement by playing Spaceteam with us. As a final bonus... and please don't take this lightly... I will give you my hat.
Reward Matrix
If you press the right buttons on this page, one of these columns could belong to you:
Rough Schedule & Budget
About Me
I’m Henry Smith (@hengineer on Twitter). I worked as a programmer in the game industry for 10 years, at BioWare and Irrational Games, on games like Dragon Age: Origins, Dead Space 2, and Mass Effect 3 before quitting my job in 2012 to start my own adventure. I specialize in UI (user interface) but I love playing with all aspects of game design. I also love board games and they’ve been inspiring a lot of my ideas lately.
I share my experiences as an indie developer on my blog.
I really hope the philosophy behind the campaign makes sense to you too and that together we can make it work…
...as a spaceteam!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The project is structured to minimize risk by giving me the freedom to make smart decisions about my work and pursue opportunities that might come up. I can't predict exactly how much time or money a specific game will take, but I *can* predict how much money I need to live on for a year. I'm actually expecting the contents of the year to shift slightly during the flight...

The schedule may change for exciting reasons, eg. to support a special Spaceteam event, or to accommodate a small collaborative project that seems cool. Or, I may have underestimated how much time Blabyrinth will take, but Spaceteam has taught me some valuable lessons about project scope and I plan to reuse most of the Spaceteam networking code, which will save time since it's the most difficult part of a game like this.

Whatever happens, I'll be sure to share it with you and it will all be documented in my Developer Diary.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
My silence on this blog has been unprecedented, but that seems to be true of so many things in the world right now so I hope you'll forgive me. Thankfully my family and I are all safe and healthy. I certainly have less time to work now than I did before the pandemic, but mostly I've been quiet because I'm working on a contract project that I still can't talk about yet!
Blabyrinth is still on hold, because "Project M" (not its real name) is taking all of my time. I had once hoped to split my time half-and-half but that turned out to be wishful thinking. But don't dismay, the wait won't be for nothing: when this project is finished it will be another local-multiplayer game to keep you distracted, and shouting at each other!

What's Happening?
👋 Hello. It's been several months since my last confession—I mean blog post. I usually try to update more frequently, but... well, you know. Things are happening.
Spaceteam VR is out now!

Big Money
I'm a bit late posting about this but back in November at the MEGA+MIGS festival here in Montreal Blabyrinth won another award, for Innovation! And to my surprise it came with some money which was presented as a GIANT NOVELTY CHEQUE! Thank you so much to MEGA+MIGS and Ville de Montréal (the award sponsor)! ❤️

Blabyrinth on Tour
For the last couple months I've been travelling a lot showing the Blabyrinth demo at festivals. First there was Berlin (AMAZE), Toronto (TCAF), and Montreal (ComicCon). Then Portland (XOXO), Boston (BFIG), Montreal again (TeaCade) and LA (IndieCade). The game was also shown briefly by volunteers (thank you!!) in London at ERIC (the Escape Room Industry Conference). And next weekend there's one more local Montreal conference: MIGS.

Spaceteam News
ESL Speech Recognition
Educational variant Spaceteam ESL and its French counterpart Astronautes FLS are getting a new feature: Speech Recognition! Now you can get immediate feedback on your pronunciation in Practice mode. I'm using Google Speech-to-Text API which is more appropriate for rather than exact pronunciation so it's not perfect for our needs but it's close enough. The new versions are in review and should be ready for the new school year on September 3rd.

updates.update_userinfo: Berlin, Toronto, and a special announcement...
updates.update_content: I have some big Spaceteam news to announce...

When we last spoke I was preparing to show Blabyrinth at DemoNight here in Montreal. It didn't go perfectly: the music didn't work and there was confusing video lag between the two devices, but it was a good learning experience.

Blabyrinth at DemoNight
Just a quick note to say that Blabyrinth is about to have its first public appearance!
DemoNight is an annual event here in Montreal where 15 unreleased games from indies and AAA studios have 5-minutes each on stage to give a live demo (no recordings or promotional footage allowed). Blabyrinth will be there along with games from other cool indies and also bigger companies like Ubisoft.

Blabyrinth
The game is getting more stable and I'm steadily improving the generator. My day-to-day work often consists of: generating a random level, exploring for a few minutes and inevitably finding something broken, and then stepping through the construction algorithm one piece at a time to see what caused the problem.
You can now officially play Spaceteam using video chat! You'll see the other players' faces and hear their voices while you play. It's not the same as them being in the room with you, but it works :)

campaign.story:
"What began as a project inspired by a series of Youtube response videos, Jenny Drumgoole’s “Make & Do (Happy Trash Day!!)” series quickly shifted toward a social critique of power, social structure, and audience. This project hinges on the artist’s interest in the City of Philadelphia’s department of sanitation and its trash workers’ rights. Drumgoole held weekly celebrations of “trash day” and created an aesthetic world built around her main character, Soxx. The resulting installation is an in-progress work that breaches the art world, existing in a real-time context."
“Happy Trash Day” began in June of 2013 as a surprise thank you for the sanitation workers on my block in Philadelphia. Since then, I having been having more elaborate Happy Trash Day celebrations for the sanitation workers of Philadelphia in many different neighborhoods throughout the City. 
Here’s what happens. I pick a location and find out what day the trash collectors come. That morning I arrive and setup balloons, banners, signs, and refreshments and wait for the trash collectors to come to their surprise party. (links with more info/press below)
The sanitation workers have been without a raise or a contract for more than five years. Happy Trash Day, in all of it’s spectacle and fun, is also a means of drawing attention to this.
Next month marks the one year anniversary of the first Happy Trash Day, so I would like to create a month long blitz of Happy Trash Days in various locations throughout the city. Each event will have a different “theme” and I will make a video from each event.
The funding will allow me to organize a blitz of eight really special Happy Trash Days over a 1-month span in different locations in Philadelphia. I need the funds to cover the production costs that are associated with each event. Refreshments, decorations, party favors, documentation, signage, glitter, beans, floats, etc.!
The final event in this one-month blitz will be where I walk my life-sized paper mache trash collector from my home in East Kensington to Philadelphia’s City Hall where I will present it to the mayor on the day that trash is collected at City Hall.
Each Happy Trash Day will be documented and will be used in my “Make & Do, Happy Trash Day” project. Until now, I have paid for everything on my own. I have had some really great people help in the past with time, documentation and things like food, but I need your help to make this REALLY GOOD…the trash collectors deserve a super amazing Happy Trash Day month!
Happy Trash Day info/press: 
http://www.nbcphiladelphia.com/news/local/Happy-Trash-Day-Could-be-Coming-to-a-Philly-Neighborhood-Near-You-229558841.html
http://phillylabor.com/local-artists-to-throw-happy-trash-day-party-for-sanitation-workers/ 
http://articles.philly.com/2014-03-31/news/48708489_1_trash-collectors-sanitation-workers-trash-workers 
Transcript of most recent speech for Philadelphia City Council (see pages 72-76) http://legislation.phila.gov/transcripts/Stated%20Meetings/2014/sm032714.pdf

campaign.story:
Jim (H. Jon Benjamin, the voice of Archer, Bob from Bob's Burgers, and many other things) has an embarrassing death and awakens in the afterlife. 
There, he's granted what he wanted most on Earth: great sex, delicious food, bottomless alcohol, and other hedonistic desires. Naturally, Jim is wary of his new life. Once everything he ever wanted comes so easily, he starts to rethink his existence. 
Jim begins to question everything and must make a very difficult decision.
Jim's Bath - Great sex, any way he wants it.
HELP TWO YOUNG FILMMAKERS 
Fangso Liu and Haines Landry are young filmmakers who have experience making films, but Limbo is an opportunity to make something on a slightly larger scale. Getting the support of H. Jon Benjamin and Dan Mintz is an amazing first step, but without your help, Fangso and Haines can't make this happen. If you've ever questioned what the afterlife could be, please support them by backing and sharing.

IT CAME FROM REDDIT
The short story which Limbo is based on originated from /r/WritingPrompts (written by Adam Spielman, "DrowningDream"), which makes this (as far as we know!) one of the first films of its kind!

MEET JIM
H. Jon Benjamin is an actor, writer, and comedian. He’s perhaps best-known as Sterling Archer. He’s also known for Bob’s Burgers, Jon Benjamin Has a Van, Home Movies, Important Things with Demetri Martin, and Dr. Katz. 
In this project, he’ll be stepping IN FRONT of the camera so you can see his face.
What will he do? How will he feel?
THE STORY
Limbo is an adaptation of an untitled short story written by Adam Spielman. While the script has been modified slightly to fit the screen, the journey and themes are faithful to the original tale.
Adam has a loyal online following of thousands, a following that continues to grow after the release of his first novel, Jarmo. We were thrilled when Adam granted us permission to adapt his short story to the screen. We believe it will resonate widely because it's both funny and thought-provoking.
Jim's Beach - Endless walks in sunshine.
Jim's Tree - Perfect weather and personal time.
THE TEAM
STRETCH GOAL - $50,000
Making a quality short film costs money. We have invested what we can already, but the more we raise, the more awesome the film will be.
This is both a thought-provoking comedy and a visually striking art piece. Raising $30,000 (before Kickstarter and Amazon Payments fees, which are around 8-10%) will allow us to make this film, but on a VERY limited budget. If we're able to raise more, we'll be able to make a number of upgrades. These include:
- A nicer camera, which will greatly enhance the film. We could shoot the film on any camera, but we would love to shoot it on a Red Epic with Cooke lenses and MoVi steadycam rig. 
- More equipment and effects for the many unique, surreal, and complex shots we have in mind. 
- An expanded location and production design budget to really take your breath away and transport you to a different dimension. 
If we reach $50,000, we'll:
- Film and edit extensive behind the scenes footage from set and send it to everyone who contributes $5 or more.
- Send personalized Blu-rays to everyone who contributes at least $300.
COST BREAKDOWN OF A 6 DAY PRODUCTION 
Production Budget Transparency
(PRE-PRODUCTION) 
The first draft of the script was written at the end of January, and we have been working hard every day since then to develop this story. Meetings, revisions, storyboards and legal advice take time and money, but the production team have already footed this bill and it hasn't been included in the production budget. 
CAST 
This figure covers the salaries of every cast member as well as travel and lodging as necessary. We have five speaking roles and a small handful of featured extras. Most of the featured roles will be on set for more than one day, and are working for SAG minimum or something comparable. 
CREW 
These are the people who actually make the film, people who work twelve hour days and have experienced longer quite often. It’s twelve hours of non stop heavy labor, and most of them have paid years of dues working for nothing but lunch. We've all been there. This figure includes their wages, which we are doing our best to be generous with. Even so, it’s well below union minimum and it’s really more of a gesture than a working income. 
LOCATIONS 
Shooting on location is incredibly expensive, especially in an unforgiving and competitive place like Los Angeles. Yes, we can shoot this in somebody’s apartment or back yard, but that would hardly do this story justice! We've scouted out some of the most beautiful landscapes Los Angeles has to offer in order to bring everybody from real life to the afterlife in the most visceral, transformative way. Filming at a friend’s place costs a handshake, but in most real-life cases it costs insurance, state permit, location fee, on-site supervisor’s fee and sometimes a fee for the fire department and/or police to show up and make sure everything is running safely and smoothly. Just to put things in perspective, one of our locations charged $25,000 to a Hollywood feature for one day, and that’s just their location fee! 
CAMERA EQUIPMENT 
If nothing else, you NEED a camera to make a live action film. It is the only absolute prerequisite. We have dreams of slow motion and Steadicam work, but only at our stretch goal of $50k. If we reach our initial goal, we will still make a beautiful film, but we will largely be limited to what our cinematographer owns. Even so, lenses cost a fortune to rent, and a great deal of lighting is necessary to transform a space and make it believable. 
ART DEPARTMENT 
Locations provide only the foundation of a film's world. Sometimes, they’re enough. In our case, we are working with a fantasy that takes place in an imaginary afterlife. This takes a learned, talented and visionary production designer, but without tools, props and wardrobe, this vision will never be realized. People working in this department are incredibly resourceful people, who scour every corner to find aesthetically useful things that people just throw away. It’s recycling at its best, and it’s a difficult and dirty job! Even so, it’s almost never enough to tie a look together, usually not even close. Many elements must be bought or rented, and transported to set. 
MEALS 
An army runs on its stomach, and a good stomach needs good food! This figure includes meals and craft services, which is basically an on set snack bar. We are feeding between 15-30 people depending on the day, for six days. Even without a budget, you have to feed cast and crew, and lunch alone costs close to ten dollars per person. Assuming cast and crew is only 15 people for all six days, that still amounts to $900 for cheap lunches, and that doesn't even include water or coffee. (6 AM call times are common, 6 AM wrap times don't surprise. People need energy!) 
POST PRODUCTION 
We have an incredibly short shooting schedule which requires near-perfect execution. That being said, being effective in post production is essential, since we can’t afford pickups. With the post production budget we have in place, we are calling in favors, hoping we nailed every shot on set and have minimal sound issues.
INSPIRATION
A few films (of many) that are thematic and visual inspiration for Limbo include The Seventh Seal by Ingmar Bergman (1957), I <3 Huckabees by David O'Russell (2004), What Dreams May Come By Vincent Ward (1998), and Idiocracy by Mike Judge (2006).
The Seventh Seal inspires many of the existential themes and cinematography. 
What Dreams May Come - a wonderful palette of colors and production design - inspires the look of the film. 
Like Limbo, I <3 Huckabees and Idiocracy represent the oafish, tortured nature of human existentialism, and how fun it is to laugh at our internal problems. 
They're great movies - you should check them out if you haven't already.
Jim's Poster - He hopes to see you at the screening!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is an extremely ambitious project and there are always risks and challenges when making a film. Weather could turn nasty. Equipment could fail. Crew could an drop out. Festivals could reject the final product. The caterer could give everybody food poisoning. That said, we have an incredibly talented and experienced team that has successfully completed many projects and will navigate any challenges that arise.

Our goal is to have the film completed by September 15, the 2015 Sundance Film Festival submission deadline. We'll be filming in and around beautiful Los Angeles for six days in late July, right before Comic-Con. 

We've decided that an additional $30,000 is the absolute minimum we need to execute the film, cutting production down to the bare necessities. If we're able to raise more than $30,000, the film will be even more polished! 

This is why we'd love you to contribute whatever you can and be part of the team! Thank you!!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello backers!
We are excited to announce that "Limbo" is finished! We will be sending out rewards over the next few weeks. However, we kindly ask for your patience on digital downloads. We are aware this is ultimately the product you signed up for, but it has come to our attention that distributing the film to the public before its festival run will result in disqualification.   
We are still allowed to hold the private screening and launch party in LA for backers and crew and will be sending an email with details soon.

Hey backers!
That's a wrap on production and we're moving into editing. We're excited to bring you something probably a little different from what you're used to. We couldn't have done it without you, so thanks for all your support!
Just wanted to say thank you to everybody involved, we're very happy to be here, and we look forward to getting THERE. We couldn't have done it without you, and now this is your project too!
Hey everyone - We've officially attached actress/comedian/writer Natasha Leggero as Lucy, the reigning mistress of Limbo!

Well this is it, folks! 
We're on our final 12 hours, and it's been great seeing so many people support our little project. 
Speaking of which, did Cyril Figgis just put in his two cents? Well, it was more than two cents, but I guess we'll have to find out at the premiere!

Please share with your friends, we've come so far and we only have three days left to go-- and three weeks before shooting!
