campaign.story:
The Film:
This will be a direct cinema feature documentary about Denver's Colfax Avenue. This 27-mile street is the funky equator of Denver where the city's remarkable geographic and cultural personality is concentrated. Much of the city's boom and bust cycle is represented in the architecture and people on this strip that reaches from the eastern plains of Aurora almost to the foothills in Golden, passing many notable music venues, clusters of immigrant restaurants, the Bugs (now Bigs) Bunny motel, and YES, Casa Bonita. This is Denver, the Queen City of the Plains!
Casa Bonita!
My Credentials:
I have been working in the film and television industry for nearly 15 years now as a sound technician and b camera shooter. I have worked with some of the best in the industry and learned much from them. Amongst the many shows I have done, the most popular:
America's Deadliest Season, the precursor to Deadliest Catch. Before everyone really knew just how dangerous this stuff really could be. I shot with one of the best cinematographers in the country, Emmy Award winning: John Mans.
The Cove, by OPS. This film won the academy that year for best documentary. 
Biggest Loser, Season 9. I worked on this great television show when they came to Colorado Springs to work out with Olympians like Apolo Ohno and Julia Mancuso. It was great fun.
Total Outdoorsman Challenge. I have actually done audio and shot b-camera for every singe episode of this fun to watch series by Warren Miller Entertainment. 
Trading Spaces
Carter Can
30 Days
X-Games
Nike, Brand Jordan, Disney, Motorola, American Express, Home Depot, HGTV, ESPN...
I have been working and learning over the years what to do and what not to do. I will be prepared to get this film finished. 
The people behind It:
Excellent local talent from both the musical and film production sides have agreed to work with me. I have the incomparable Brook Aiken, Director of Photography for the Academy Award winning film The Cove to shoot a bit with me:
Me and the Cove Academy statue. Heavy.
I have Warren Miller's post production audio guru Kelly Gary doing my post audio.
Warren Miller crew in Olympic bobsled (that's me in the middle).
 And I hope to have the great cinematographer and post colorist Jon Firestone doing post color.
The Music:
Musically, I have a list of local greats assembled to join me in creating the music for this film. Nick Urata of Devotchka will possibly be playing with me in the studio for the film. I'm hoping to get him on the trumpet. There will also be stand alone numbers from Tom Hagerman from Devotchka, Dressy Bessy, Slim Cessna's Auto Club, Magic Cyclops, Jeep MacNichol of Mr. Anonymous' new thing, The Plates... And the Manxx! Musically, this is going to be excellent fun. 
As backers, even at the lowest level you will receive the satisfaction that you were able to bring this work to life. You will be able to go to the theater and watch something you helped create. At the higher levels, backers will enjoy not only this but you will be able to share your private screening experience with friends and pass around the DVD. You were there at the inception of a great film. And it will be. 
The numbers: 
To show you what I expect to spend on each aspect of this production I have prepared a pie chart (mmmm, pie):
Colfax budget, to the decimal.
 I have gone over this many times to make sure I'm on track to complete the film with enough in the coffers to submit to the festivals and screen it for you great folks at the end.
At Telluride Mountain Film.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I'm no spring chicken in the film industry. I've been working as a sound technician and B camera operator for nearly fifteen years now. Come hell or high water I will finish this film in time to submit to at least four festivals by the fall of this year. And bring it to theaters by late winter 2015. With your pledges, I plan to rent and buy all of the necessary gear, feed the poor folks I intend to drag around with me and pay the industry crew who have all given me great rates all in the name of getting this done and through the gate on time. 
I will be dedicating three months of my time to getting this done and another two weeks every month thereafter until it has been submitted to at least four festivals (I've got BIFF, Sundance, SXSW and Big Sky in mind for this). I'm sure it will take all of my will and attention during this time. I also plan on having it theater ready by early next year so that I can show it at at least two Colorado venues and send out 1000 DVDs to you, the good people helping me.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Last night we reached 100. Though we're still a good distance from the goal, this is giving me the confidence to move forward. If we reach our goal I will send you first 100 pledges each a Colfax t-shirt designed by me as a special thanks for your support. 
If we can now branch out a little and find a new set of eyes and ears, this may give us the numbers we need for the home stretch. If you each could email or private message five to ten of your friends or colleagues who you think may be interested in this project, we will close in on the goal prior to the last week of the drive.

Hello, good people! I will be playing a short little song, previously unheard, on KGNU.org today from about 11AM to Noon Mountain time. If you live in the Boulder/Denver area it's FM 88.5, tune in, and let friends know too, it should be fun.
If you live out of range you can stream this feed at KNGU.org.
And I thank you all for giving me the power to keep this campaign floating.

updates.update_userinfo: We have over fifty backers folks!
updates.update_content:
Thanks, you initial backers for this boost in confidence. It means the world to me that you all came to help in this first crucial week of funding. We are at a projected success rate of 73% now so there is still a lot of hard work for me to do to get the rest of the world on my side. But I'm hitting it hard every day to get it done.
I have walked Colfax these last few days and found something endearing and sweet about all of the people I have been assembling to make this film come to life. From the coy car salesman at Andy's Car Land to the talkative but frank Rosalyn Redwine at Winning Coiffures, to the tough but engaging smoking and cross eyed trio of inebriated counter clerks at Nick's Liqours; this story promises to be nothing but spectacular.

We have a confirmation on our first private screening in Colorado.
The esteemed director of CU Boulder's IFS, Pablo Kjolseth has given us permission to screen early next year at Muenzinger Auditorium in Boulder. We don't know the dates yet but we will when the think gets closer.
Thanks, Pablo!

I feel like it could just be so great... with everyone's support. 
I walked some of West Colfax today and found some deep stories amongst the regular folks there. The pawn shops, the auto shops, the bowling alley and dozens of motels all blistering with identity and life. It isn't going to be easy picking the stories to tell because there are so many.
A simple stop into one of the most famous aspects of this great street yielded this:

campaign.story:
THE CONCEPT:
Metal Shop Fantasy Camp is not just another class — it is a life changing experience!
In this world of rapid technology, many people have forgotten (or never learned) how to create things from scratch, with their hands. Secretly we all crave a return to the basics. We work in community gardens. We make incredible meals for our families. We play our music on the weekends and fill our souls. But something is missing...
Metal Shop Fantasy Camp fills that void. We provide an entirely different opportunity:
To become a modern-day god or goddess by learning how to harness the raw power of fire and metal!
Hellfire and Brimstone, Zeus, Athena, Hades and Artemis will have nothing on you when you learn to weld.
Our classes focus on rapid learning in an intimate setting. We teach our students, whether the novice or experienced welder, to build from the foundation up while having fun and marveling as a project takes form.
Our inaugural workshop, "How to Make a Cube," serves as a launchpad for building bigger projects. Students learn all the skills necessary for metal crafting, from measuring and cutting, to clamping, welding and fine finishing. From this foundation it is possible to build almost anything out of metal.
How to Make a Cube
OUR MISSION:
We are establishing a state-of-the-art facility in NYC dedicated exclusively to Metal Shop Fantasy Camp. This will allow for more intensive projects and the capacity to have more flexibility in the number and timing of our metalcrafting experiences. The workshop space will require some customization in order to ensure the best environment for metalworking:
proper electricity for running heavy machinery
plenty of lighting
proper ventilation
building out and customizing the physical space
liability insurance
Campers will require an array of equipment to safely and successfully complete their projects:
power and industrial tools (welders, grinders, clamps, etc.)
fabrication tables
welding helmets
safety clothing & gloves
miscellaneous hardware
Upon tailoring the new workspace, we will offer additional experiences focusing on more functional items and projects of larger scope. We will also host a "Heavy Metal Weekend," a three-day course in which students will construct a large-scale project from one of our custom designs.
Scheduled Studio shop hours for Campers that have completed the basic courses to hone their skills and create their own projects with the fabrication knowledge they have learned.
THE BENEFITS OF METAL SHOP FANTASY CAMP:
Metal Shop Fantasy Camp offers numerous benefits to the students who participate in our experiences:
learning how to build with metal, from scratch, using your hands
the ability to think in a 3-dimensional capacity
a fundamental understanding of basic building blocks and how to expand upon them
a discovery of unknown or latent skills
a deep sense of pride and accomplishment as a project comes to fruition
You become an official welder.
How to Make a Cube
 THE REWARDS:
We have compiled an assortment of "Thank You's" for your generosity in helping us establish a new home for Metal Shop Fantasy Camp. All items are custom made in our Greenpoint shop. We have also offered a few opportunities to "do it yourself" through our various classes so you can experience firsthand the wonders of Metal Shop Fantasy Camp!
Please check out www.metalshopfantasycamp.com for a behind-the-scenes peek at the Metal Shop Fantasy Camp experience. We have also generated substantial press including an interview with , CNBC, The Fabricator magazine's Back Page, Man's Ambition, and the Examiner, to name a few.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Safety is a major concern and we always want to be on guard in making sure everyone is safe both from physical injury and air quality. Insurance is also going to be a major expense to meet along with the basic expenses of running a business in New York City.

Growing class sizes to 8 people is going to require some finessing as we are comfortable teaching up to four students at this time with the equipment we have now.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
New Stretch Goals-
$30,000 - Lemonade Cubes Unlocked!
Made with dehydrated lemons and raw, unrefined cane sugar, nothing else!
$10+ pledge level receives 1 free lemonade cube
$20+ pledge level receives 2 free lemonade cubes
$55+ pledge level receives 4 free lemonade cubes
$90+ pledge receives 6 free lemonade cubes
$45,000 - Green Tea Cubes Locked
Made with pulverized green tea and raw, unrefined cane sugar.
$10+ pledge level receives 2 extra cubes (1 lemon, 1 tea)
$20+ pledge level receives 4 extra cubes (2 lemon, 2 tea)
$55+ pledge level receives 8 extra cubes (4 lemon, 4 tea)
$90+ pledge receives 12 extra cubes (6 lemon, 6 tea)

Hi Backers!
Have you ever been so late in the morning you didn’t have time to prepare your coffee?

Are you familiar with airplane coffee?

Need a replacement for your crappy office brew?

Want an easier way to make your Campfire Coffee?
We are Natalia and Allen, founders of Jiva Cubes. We use high-quality Colombian coffee and combine with raw, unrefined cane sugar, Panela, to form a cube. Think of a sugar cube, but with coffee! 
"Wait, but I don't like my coffee sweetened!"
This is something we heard all the time last year, during (and after) our last Kickstarter project. Since we used sugar as a binder it was impossible for us to make a sugarless cube. We refuse to use any artificial ingredients to hold the cubes together and we couldn't find anything natural that worked. So, we decided to use a minimal amount of raw sugar (less than a gram) to hold the cubes together. We tested the cubes with people who take no sugar in their coffeeand once we were satisfied Jiva Black was born.
Now, there is a Coffee Cube for everyone!
A smarter way to coffee = Whether you are saving space in your bag on your next hike, you are saving cash by watching your afternoon latte budget or you are going green by using fewer pods and conserving energy; Jiva Cubes is the smarter way to coffee.
Value³ = We packed convenience, portability and quality into a tiny cube! We create a cube that lets you avoid the entire process required to make a cup of coffee. We even let you skip the clean-up.
 We work with a single estate that boasts 4 generations of coffee and sugar cane cultivation in the famed coffee region of Ocamonte, Santander. We take our coffee seriously so we can control quality from from seed to cube!
 Check out pictures of our Colombian adventures and learn more about our coffee, raw sugar (panela), and cacao!
Jiva Black is for those who drink their coffee black.

Full Nutrition Facts
What our backers say:
"Thank you again! They have been delicious and a great addition to bring to work! I've enjoyed the coffee as iced coffee so far!"
- Heather & Jim
"I've just received my cubes in the UK! I was absolutely bouncing off the walls in excitement. They taste more like filter coffee than instant to me, and they are exactly the right amount of sweetness. They're smaller than I expected, though that's not a bad thing at all since they're super portable."
- Elizabeth A.

"For someone like me who ends up traveling a lot, these make a GREAT substitute for the nasty tar they try to serve on airplanes as coffee.
- Keith R.
"I have NEVER liked instant coffee and now I can no longer say that thanks to these amazing cubes! Life Changers :) I'll be back for more."
- Danielle G.
"I still use the Keurig...to heat up the water for my Jiva Coffee Cubes!"
-Kevin J.
"I travel a lot in a VW camper and the cubes were a big hit last summer. I'm looking forward to showing the new flavors."
- Jerry B.
More things our backers say
 Covered By:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This isn't our first rodeo. We're no strangers to Kickstarter and what it means to deliver on a promise.

 With your help, we tested our first batch of cubes. We had to go to Colombia to find a new manufacturer and deal with tons of issues while there, but we managed to get cubes to our backers. Check it out here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/jivacubes/jiva-coffee-cubes

Then we added flavors to our coffee line and tested hot chocolate cubes made with fancy cacao. We delivered cubes to over 2,700 people but only after going to Colombia for a month to pack the cubes ourselves and see the cubes home! Check it out here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/jivacubes/jiva-coffee-cubes-and-hot-chocolate-cubes

Every project brings risk for delays and obstacles, we know this better than anyone. However, we are tenacious folk and we have been working really hard to perfect our cubes and our process. We have been working with the same providers for over a year so things are a bit more streamlined. If there are any bumps, we'll let you know, but rest assured that were here to make sure this is a great experience for you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: New Coffee Cubes Launch - New Formula, Now Made in USA, Discount + more
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone!
  We are happy to present our new coffee cubes to you!
     We’ve been out of stock for the last six months because we recently moved all of our manufacturing from Colombia into the United States. The transition was much harder and took much longer than expected, but the end result was well worth it. This move allows for tighter quality control, greatly reduces the amount of time it takes to restock, and the cubes themselves taste much better!
 
We sincerely appreciate all of your patience with us during this large move. I think many of you will be very impressed with the new cubes. We could not have done it without your support!

updates.update_userinfo: Black and Lemonade are now available!
updates.update_content:
Hey Cubistas!
The cubes have finally arrived in Miami and will be cleared very soon. We are expecting to begin shipping early next week!
A few announcements:

Hey Cubistas!
We apologize for not posting an update sooner. We wanted to provide you with a more concrete timeline, but there have been some minor delays that made that difficult.
All the Classic and flavored coffee and Hot Chocolate cubes are already here in Miami. The only cubes we are waiting for are the Strong Classic, Black, and Lemonade cubes. The Strong Classic were sent with the first shipment, but they were not sealed properly so they all needed to be replaced which slightly delayed our shipment.

Hey Cubistas,
The surveys have finally been sent out! If you are having issues with it, send us a message and we'll see what we can do.
It turns out that Kickstarter now allows backers to change their addresses on the survey even after they have submitted them (that will definitely make it easier on all of us). If you move or anything like that then you can just modify your survey on your own.
Thank you!

Hey Cubistas! 
Thank you!!!
A long time and many requests later, the Black Cubes and Lemonade Cubes are in production.
What’s Next?

Hey Cubistas!
We hit our $30,000 stretch goal so Lemonade Cubes are a going to be a thing now. That means if you want you can choose lemonade cubes as one of your boxes. A box of lemonade cubes will contain 24 cubes. Depending on your pledge level you will automatically receive some free lemonade cubes. You will be one of the very first people to try these cubes so your feedback will be important to help us improve them.

campaign.story:
-Ella Wheeler Wilcox
Too often we make decisions based on convenience or ease, and seldom we face the chance to rise above it all in pursuit of virtue. BANDITO is about a boy who doesn't choose silence, it's about a boy who goes to extraordinary measures in order to save lives. 
This is a film about the path to true courage, the power within each of us. If you believe in this message, please show your support and contribute to the realization of this film. Every dollar truly helps. 
Our film is carefully crafted to connect with all audiences. This is a story that everyone can relate to, a call to action that everyone is ready to hear. Our movie will entertain, as well as reinforce the important message that within each of us lies a great capacity for courage that can change anything.
Since the death of his parents, all 14-year-old Jamie wants is to feel capable. To feel in control. To feel like a man.
When his older brother Scotty is headed out with a local gang to hold up a semi-truck, Jamie tags along, convinced this is his chance to prove his worth to himself and his brother.
The night of the heist, as everything falls apart, Jamie finds himself becoming the kind of hero he never could have anticipated. 
OUR TEAM HAS ALREADY RAISED $12,000 FOR THIS FILM!
But we still need your help to reach our goal and bring this film to the silver screen! Your generous support will go towards:
SPECIAL EFFECTS -   Weapon effects and pyrotechnics require strict safety protocols and experts on set.
VISUAL EFFECTS - Although we'll utilize pyrotechnics, most of the blaze will be done through CGI. For this, we'll work with experienced visual effect artists in post-production and on set.
LOCATIONS/PERMITS/INSURANCE - We've choosen incredible locations that will bring this story to life. Our main characters live out of an auto-body shop that we will shut down for production. We are also closing down the road on which key action occur.  
PICTURE CARS & ART - Our picture cars are characters in the film. We can't have a truck robbery without a truck! We need your help to get an actual semi-truck (with a licensed truck driver) as well as other picture cars. In addition we plan to use high quality cinematic props and costumes.
EQUIPMENT -  Our goal is to make a very ambitious project on a micro budget, but we will not compromise on the quality. With your generous help, we can rent camera and lighting equipment to make BANDITO look beautiful.
Our producers have the experience to ensure these funds are used properly and to their maximum potential. No dollar will be wasted. Every team member is working for free, out of love for this story, so every cent is used to enhance the production value.
To express our sincere appreciation, we have created amazing, meaningful rewards for all of our funders. If you love this idea, but can't back our film -- don't fret! By sharing this Kickstarter with friends and fellow movie lovers, you are helping us reach a larger audience! We are excited to bring this inspiring story to the world, and we thank you for support in any way. 
Concept art by Stephanie Bow
Evan Ari Kelman, DIRECTOR
Evan Ari Kelman has worked in film for over 10 years, joining SAG at 9 years old. Since then, his films have been screened in festivals around the world, and featured on video aggregation sites such as Dailymotion. His first film at NYU, 'Delicate', won Best Director at NYU Campus Movie Festival. Kelman has done commercial work for Nickelodeon, Converse, Viacom, and others. He currently is the Short Content Director for James Frey's production company, Full Fathom Five.
Parker Hill, PRODUCER, EDITOR
Parker is a dedicated and experienced filmmaker, with a renowned eye for detail. Parker recently wrote and produced, 'Please Reply' a short film now in festival circuit.
Sebastian Savinto, PRODUCER
Sebastian is the founder of Virtuoso Picture House, an award winning film production company. He has produced over a dozen independent films, commercials, and music videos. Sebastian is currently a student member of the Producer’s Guild of America, East.
Check out his website - http://www.virtuosopicturehouse.com/
1. How do you plan on setting a semi-truck on fire?
Although there will be some small fire elements on set, the majority of the fire will be done with computer generated effects. This is achieved with the help of a VFX supervisor on-location, as well as smoke and lighting effects. An excellent example of how this works is illustrated in the recent film "Skyfall":
Stills from SkyFall
Official Bandito Playlist
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This film is being crafted with great passion by a very talented crew. You know that old adage -- when hard work and love come together, there is no ceiling on potential. 

Still, this is a very ambitious student film with many moving parts. Stunts, effects, and emotionally demanding performances are just part of the puzzle. In our drive to tell a truthful, resonating, and emotional story, we are preparing for any and all conceivable hiccups in production. Our high standards push us towards over-preparation. No detail is overlooked.

Our entire team is working for free, because we recognize the importance of getting this story out there. Now more than ever, people need to remember the deep, resounding courage that sits within each of us.

That goal is what drives us forward -- not money. Our time and talents are poured into this project because we believe in it. We believe in what we can do with it. 

We hope you believe in it too. 

No one is saying it will be easy -- no one thinks it will be. We're calling every favor, every free meal, every friend we have, to get this film made.

It is with the generous support of our community and the world at large that this film will become a reality. 

It's with YOUR support -- that this film becomes a reality.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Exciting News! BANDITO is Now Playing on Short Of The Week!
A year and a half ago, an incredibly talented team followed me out to Pennsylvania, with a script, a cast, a semi-truck, and a dream. That dream became a reality because of YOUR involvement, belief, and support. Making this film was a wonderfully satisfying and exciting experience for everyone involved, and I'm so happy that together we made something truly noteworthy. This film has screened around the world, winning awards and inspiring audiences with its storytelling and style. I'm so grateful to the cast & crew who gave this film their all, raising the bar of what an undergraduate student film could accomplish.

updates.update_userinfo: If you haven't heard the great news yet... (Plus a link to our new trailer!)
updates.update_content:
Tribeca Film Festival Announces Bandito as Official Selection for 2015 Lineup!
That's right, you read that correctly! Our film Bandito will World Premiere this April at the prestigious Tribeca Film Festival in New York City! 
For those of you who are unfamiliar with the festival universe, trust me when I say this is big news.

Hello backers,
I've got some great news -- THE FILM IS FINISHED!
That's right, the movie you've helped me to create is finally done. I know you're excited to see it, but I must ask you to be patient awhile longer. In order to remain 'world premiere' eligible for festivals, we cannot publicly screen or share the film at this time. Once our festival season is complete, I will share more information on how you can see the film. In the coming months, I'll also be posting festival screening information on our page, so you can check out the film at a local screen near you.

updates.update_userinfo: Bandito Updates PLUS Our Official Poster!
updates.update_content:
Hello incredible Bandito backers! It's been a little while since you've heard from me, but don't sweat - everything is going excellent!
If you're following our Facebook page, then you already know that we completed filming several weeks ago and are now in the post-production stage. This process begins with a rough cut and ends with the final cut, with special effects, ADR or Additional Dialogue Recording, compositing, sound design, color grading, and many other steps in the middle.
We did it! We've surpassed our goal!

Introducing the Cast of Bandito!
We have been so incredibly lucky with our casting. Bringing together these tremendous actors on-screen will be an exciting and rewarding experience. I can't wait! And luckily, I don't have to much longer. Each day production is getting closer, and with 4 days left on the Kickstarter, there's still time to help Bandito be everything it can be! Keep up the hype!

Start the Countdown!
In the past few weeks, we've made some incredible progress. We've locked all of our locations, major cast members, crew, and picture vehicles.
We're now less than TWO WEEKS from our first day of principal photography, and my team and I are emboldened by your support as we plan the details of the shoot.

We did it! We've reached our Kickstarter goal! I can't say enough how grateful I am to the community that supported and promoted this project. Thanks to so many of you, this film is being made! AND, with 14 days to go, we have the unique opportunity to make this film even better!
ANNOUNCING OUR STRETCH GOAL: $2,000 MORE TO REACH $10,000 GETS US: -A Fisher Dolly is a standard of modern filmmaking. Tracking, dollying, this machine can do everything to highest standards. -Steadicam is a godsend for filmmakers looking to cover many angles in a single shot. You've seen this used in pretty much every movie and TV show. This system is operated by a professional operator, adding that touch of experience.

campaign.story:
Our Kickstarter campaign has ended, but you can still order your own OTTO at nextthing.co/otto
Meet OTTO
OTTO is a real camera that does all the things your phone camera does, all the things you wish your other cameras could do, and tons of things you never even expected.
OTTO is also a tiny, portable linux computer! 
We built OTTO to show how much you can do with a digital camera, when you’re invited to play with how it works. Not just by adding filters or post-processing, but by actually being able to change how the camera behaves!
As featured in:
OTTO at Maker Faire (winner of Best in Class and Editors Choice)
How OTTO works
OTTO lets YOU decide how it takes pictures. Besides being the only camera that makes animated GIFs, OTTO’s an image making machine that can transform into hundreds of different cameras with a quick tap. GIFs, time lapses, impromptu photo booths, or something brand new, OTTO is ready for adventure!
OTTO lets you take photos with a real camera, while still being able to easily share them to your favorite people. Photos taken with OTTO are viewed and shared from your smartphone.
Choose new MODES for OTTO from a huge library of options, each of which offers a totally new way to make images!
Whats a Mode? 
MODES are what makes OTTO different from every other camera. Modes are like tiny apps that define how OTTO makes pictures. In other words: modes change what happens when you press OTTO's shutter button or turn it's built-in crank.
OTTO ships with a library of built-in modes to do fun things like shoot animated GIFs, or set up an impromptu photo booth. Using your smartphone, you can change between any of these built-in picture-taking modes, or pick user-created modes from the in-app MODE GALLERY.
What YOU can do with OTTO
Because you can change OTTO's software, you can do hundreds of cool and unique things with your OTTO!  Below are just a couple examples of what OTTO does:
Make GIFs!
  OTTO has a rotating crank that pops up and folds out from its top. Crank to make a GIF. When you're done, rewind the crank one turn and your GIF is done. OTTO automatically shares your brand new GIF with your phone, so you have it where you need it. Making GIFs has never been easier!
But of course OTTO is more than just GIFs. OTTO is the full power of a tiny computer, right in your camera, meaning YOU can create modes for hundreds of unique image, and video styles!
Place a geolocated MAP right into your travel snapshots
Snap Magic Eye® style STEREOGRAMS in real time
Drop "Deal with it" SHADES on your friends via facial tracking
See the world through DELAUNAY MESH triangulations
Capture good times with PHOTOBOOTH mode
Bend time with dynamic TIMELAPSES
Want OTTO to do even more?
We do too! OTTO is designed for experimentation. 
We built OTTO because we wanted to create new ways to play with digital cameras. Making GIFs on the fly, talking to sensors, and uploading photos to your favorite social site are all things that any camera could do, if only it “knew” how -- so we created OTTO, the camera you can teach new tricks!
Every part of OTTO is made so YOU can tweak, extend, and hack it. 
Tweaking OTTO
OTTO’s modes have tons of detailed settings that you can adjust from inside the smartphone app. Without any special skills, YOU can completely change how OTTO’s modes react to your input. Once you’ve made your tweaks, your settings are automatically sync’d to OTTO. Then you can put your phone away, go outside, and enjoy taking photos that are really YOURS!
 EXTENDING OTTO
OTTO’s customization isn’t limited to software. By attaching an Arduino-powered FlashyFlash to the USB port hidden under the OTTO logo plug, you can easily add electronics to completely change how OTTO works.
FlashyFlashes are simple plug-and-play circuit boards with a paired OTTO mode to let you take unique and amazing photos. High-five-triggered camera? Easy. GIFs that know how loud that concert was? No problem. Robot camera vision tool? You bet. By adding an Arduino to your OTTO, the possibilities are endless, and easy to try.
HIGHFIVE
A quick Arduino sketch lets the FlashyFlash use the capacitance of human touch to capture a photo the moment you make HIGHFIVE contact. 
High Five Cam: the setup... and the result
 COLOR SAT
Using a piezo mic attached to the FlashyFlash, COLOR SAT reveals the sound of the scene where a photo is captured.  The saturation of each frame of the created GIF is changed to match how loud it was when the frame was captured. 
Color Sat: the setup... and the result
HACKING OTTO
When even bolt-on hardware won’t get you where you want to go, OTTO is ready for adventure. Using the OTTO SDK, you can modify every bit of OTTO’s software. Recompile the kernel, load it up with additional Linux packages, or just peek under the hood and see how it all works.
OTTO’s hardware is similarly built to be modified and explored by the adventurous, with full documentation and Eagle files available. OTTO is the only camera built from the ground up with hackability in mind!
OTTO IS THE FIRST PRODUCT BUILT ON THE NEW RASPBERRY PI COMPUTE MODULE
OTTO is powered by Raspberry Pi, the same flexible, low-cost computing platform we used to prototype our first cameras. We built our OTTO prototypes using the Raspberry Pi because it was the easiest way to test our ideas out without the need for proprietary tools or spooky non-disclosure agreements. Turns out, when trying new things in software and hardware, joining a community that’s already 2.5 million strong is a great thing! 
With plenty of documentation and active forums, we are extremely proud to say that now Raspberry Pi hackers can hack on something they can carry everywhere.
With the help and encouragement of our friends at the Raspberry Pi Foundation, we are excited to announce that OTTO is the first product to be powered by the brand new Raspberry Pi Compute Module, a thumb-sized system on module identical to the Raspberry Pi Model B, but in a much smaller package meant to be embedded in products.
Designing OTTO
The OTTO prototype family
 OTTO was built because we love traditional cameras -- the kind people half-jokingly refer to as “real” cameras -- Leicas, Rolleiflex, Voigtlander, and especially the humble Holga. We love the feeling of holding an old rangefinder camera and shooting in the middle of a crowded street or way out on a desolate trail. The way those cameras fit in your hand, their sturdy feel and carryable size all lead to an unyielding urge to get out there, explore, and shoot more photos! 
At the end of the day it’s really that feeling we love more than any particular camera, so we designed OTTO to be the camera that you want to grab and shoot with. We hope you’ll love it as much as we do.
LITTLE BIG DETAILS
 OTTO is powered by the Raspberry Pi Compute Module, with a Broadcom BCM2835 SoC. That’s a 700MHz ARM 11 core, with dual core video co-processor and 1080p30 native H.264 hardware encode/decode, advanced Image Sensor Pipeline, 4GB on onboard flash memory, USB 2.0, and lots of other goodies. 
Image capture is done though an f/2.0 35mm equivalent optical glass lens onto an Omnivision OV5647 5 megapixel ¼” 1.4µm backside illuminated pixel CMOS sensor, capable of images up to 2592x1944px, HD video up to 1080p30 / 720p60, and VGA 640x480 at 90 frames per second! We think it’s quite a little powerhouse.
YEAH, BUT HOW GOOD IS OTTO?
As a camera, THIS good:
5am Dave, no filter :)
… and as a prototyping platform, OTTO is as good as the thousands of amazing projects folks have already built with Raspberry Pi.  With the added benefit that we've done all the boring stuff for you.  Now you can take your projects anywhere.  
OTTO will never compete with a DSLR in terms of megapixels but we think OTTO has a lot more fun ;)
We think the future of photography isn't just greater fidelity, but greater flexibility. 
Reward Levels
$5: Help make OTTO a reality!
We have been committed full-time to making OTTO since last November, but we just plain can’t do it without your help! Every single dollar we raise on Kickstarter helps a LOT, and any pledge you can make helps us go farther! Are YOU as excited to see what people do with OTTO as we are? Help us make it happen!
$25: 1 FlashyFlash Bare Prototyping Board
The FlashyFlash is a 3” round prototyping board with a mechanical mounting tab styled like a vintage bulb flash. Meant to break out pins from an Arduino Pro Micro and let you quickly solder together circuits to extend what you can do with your OTTO camera, you can also just use FlashyFlash as a nice round prototyping board for a freestanding Arduino project. Requires soldering skills.
**Does not include Arduino!**
$30: Hand-printed OTTO Bag
A 100% cotton tote bag hand-printed by us with our OTTO logo and a picture of OTTO. Be the coolest kid in the grocery line! :D
$50: 1 Flashy Flash with Arduino-compatible board
The 3" FlashyFlash ready to be wired up and used to turn your OTTO into a high-five camera, sound saturation camera, robot-driving camera, or anything else you can dream up! Includes:
+ Camera Shoe Mount
+ Yellow PC-SYNC style micro USB cord
+ Arduino-compatible board mounted in sockets
*Requires Soldering Skills!*
$60: 1 B.O.B. Pi Shield with LiPo Battery
If you’re wondering how we were able to make a reliable, rechargeable, self-powered camera based on the Raspberry Pi, here’s our secret weapon! The B.O.B. (Battery On Board) Shield for Raspberry Pi is everything you need to turn your Raspberry Pi model A or B into a real mobile device! Includes:
+ 2A 5V DC-DC Boost Power Supply
+ 2700mAH 3.6V LiPo Battery
+ 500mA LiPo Charger
+ Soft Power (Safe Shutdown) Circuit
+ Prototyping area & Linear GPIO, SPI, and I2C breakouts
**Does not include Raspberry Pi**
$99: 1 ODK OTTO DEVELOPER KIT
The ODK is an early prototype for OTTO. A laser cut acrylic case, side-mounted crank handle, 96x96 color OLED screen, B.O.B. Pi Power Shield, and all the little hardware necessary to assemble a DIY portable Raspberry Pi project. Includes:
+ Laser-cut acrylic body KIT including assembly hardware
+ Assembled B.O.B. SHIELD
+ Plug-in modules for a crank arm, shutter button, and power button
+ 96x96 color OLED module
+ 2700mAH 3.6v LiPo Battery
**Does NOT include Raspberry Pi or Camera Board**
$149: Early Bird OTTO
VERY Limited special “Early Bird” pricing for our first backers. These cameras will be the first to ship out, and as special THANKS for getting our campaign moving, we’ve lowered the price of OTTO for the first fifty! 
Choice of Silver/Black or Black/Blue OTTO.
$199: 1 OTTO Hackable Camera
 FULLY ASSEMBLED CAMERA, READY TO USE! OTTO does it all. Hackable, powerful, playful, and (dare we say) adorable, OTTO is the first digital camera ever to be designed for user modification. OTTO shoots animated GIFs, still images, videos, and much much more! Powered by Raspberry Pi and encased in durable anodized aluminum, OTTO is simply the best way to make digital photography fun again. Includes Raspberry Pi Compute Module.
*Special Kickstarter-Only Pricing!* 
Choice of Silver/Black or Black/Blue OTTO.
$249: 1 OTTO + 1 Assembled FlashyFlash
ALL THE THINGS! Get a fully-assembled OTTO camera, AND a FlashyFlash with an onboard Arduino, so you’re just minutes away from building any camera project you’ve been dreaming up!
*Special Kickstarter-Only Pricing!* 
Choice of Silver/Black or Black/Blue OTTO.
$5000: CUSTOM OTTO MODE + OTTO
If you have a camera project, art installation, or event that you you want to see through the lens of a custom-built OTTO mode, we’ll work with you to make your vision a reality. Plus you get the whole kit and kaboodle -- a signature edition OTTO in a color of your choice, and a FlashyFlash pre-assembled with the circuitry necessary to realize your custom mode!
Manufacturing OTTO
We've built dozens of prototypes over the last five months, and worked closely with manufacturing engineers in Shenzhen, China to figure out how to produce lots of OTTOs. We have a tested pipeline for low-volume production, and are continually improving our designs and software to make volume production and quality control as smooth as possible.
Timeline
  The OTTO Team
Thomas Deckert, Dave Rauchwerk, and Gustavo Huber are three friends in Oakland, CA who like making electronics, art, and designer-y urban interventions of many types. We took the early prototype GIF cameras to China after being selected for the 111-day HAXLR8R hardware accelerator program. While abroad, a lunchbox-sized crank powered GIF camera prototype was developed into the camera you see here! OTTO! :D
Our backgrounds range from Product Design and Mechanical Engineering to Software Development and Electronics, with a good bit of manufacturing experience thrown in too. We are very excited to show everyone just how much fun OTTO is!
Thanks!!!
Our Investors & Mentors: 
HAXLR8R
Sean O’Sullivan 
Cyril Ebersweiler

Our Hacker Friends & Supporters:

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Making stuff is a lot harder than thinking it up. There are literally thousands of tiny decisions left to be made in order to get OTTO into your hands. We are actively refining OTTO at every opportunity, and know from experience that some of these refinements will come during manufacturing. The risks inherent in volume manufacturing are real, and we take every precaution to prepare for and actively address them. With the support of our manufacturing and distribution partners we are well equipped for the challenges ahead. ¡VIVA OTTO!

campaign.story:
Last year we hosted the first North American Parkour Championships with a single camera live stream. Thousands tuned in for free!

2014 North American Parkour Championships
Sunday May 18th
5:00 pm - 9:00 pm
Origins Parkour Facility
Vancouver, Canada
The best Parkour athletes from across North America will be competing.
This includes athletes from Tempest Freerunning (LA), Apex Movement (Colorado), Mexico, Montreal, and even pros from right here in Vancouver, Canada!
The NAPC is still completely financed by Origins Parkour Facility and we have spared no expense. To take this year's event to the next level we want more coverage! Isn't it time to see a legit parkour competition with all the bells and whistles that come with a professional sporting event? If we can reach our goal we will be able to have multiple camera angles, live switchers, live commentary, and it will all be broadcasted live on the internet! Simply pledge $5 Dollars or more and you can view it just like a sporting event on pay per view!
This is an all-or-nothing campaign, but THE SHOW MUST GO ON! If we don't reach our goal everyone gets their money back and we will do a single camera shoot just like last year! Next year the goal is to have sponsors for our broadcast. This is your chance to show the world that we want parkour events like the NAPC to be recognized just like other professional sporting events!
If we reach our goal the recording will be uploaded to be viewed for FREE after the live broadcast. If you pledge $5 Dollars or more you could be one of the few people to see it FIRST and LIVE!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is a LIVE screening of the event so anything can happen! We have experience doing a live stream before, but that was with only one camera! This time we will be using multiple cameras, a switcher, and have a commentator giving play by plays of the event.

Our unofficial motto is "the show must go on!" So if unexpected things occur at the event we will make sure we keep the cameras rolling! Parkour is all about adapting to challenges. We jump off high stuff and scale buildings. Making fast changes when a landing goes awry requires the same kind of composure it takes to deal with technical malfunctions during a live event! We got this!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Thank you once again to everyone who contributed and bought tickets to watch the 2014 NAPC's. Due to some unexpected expenses with the event we weren't able to order the shirts right away for those of you that paid extra. They just came in today and we are excited to send them to you guys as a bonus. If you've been waiting for a shirt please send us your address and we will ship it to you the next day!

Hey Y'all! We hope everyone enjoyed the broadcast. We're sorry it started late. There were some technical difficulties with sound on ustream's end. You can still view the live stream recording using the link and ticket code you were sent if you donated.

If you are waiting for a t-shirt we appreciate your patience as we are currently having more printed.

Have a beautiful Summer!

Viewing codes will be sent out later today, so that everyone who contributed $5 or more will be able to tune in. If you didn't contribute you can purchase a pay per view Here: http://www.ustream.tv/channel/north-american-parkour-championships---2014

campaign.story:
PROJECT:
As newly minted Masters of Fine Arts, we will enter the Los Angeles art world together as a community by organizing a post graduation exhibition at the beginning of June.
This is our first opportunity to bring the work we have made in school to an outside audience. Many of us have never shown work in LA before and this show will act as a professional platform to inaugurate our participation in the art world. Because this show is entirely student organized, we have limited funds. Our school provides us with $5000. This sounds like a lot, but barely covers our anticipated budget. In reality to put on a show of this size involving so many people, we need approximately $10,000. This covers everything including posters and promotional materials, a website, an exhibition catalog, space rental, insurance, opening reception, and most importantly hiring a curator. 
Help us reach our goal of $5000! Help us organize our first show in Los Angeles! Thank you for your time, your love, and your contribution.
REWARDS:
Pledge $5 or more
An LA -themed animated GIF. We love LA and we will show you how much with a series of flashing images delivered to your inbox.
Pledge $25 or more
7 Minutes in Heaven. A live, performative phone call full of advice and musings from our beloved Patrick Ballard and troupe.
Pledge $50 or more
One way ticket to LA. An original screen print of a one-way ticket to LA. Please come for a visit and to see our exhibition! We can only afford to bring you one way...
Pledge $75 or more
LA / Art School -themed beach towel. This custom designed, limited edition utilitarian towel will be useful when you show up at LAX (our airport is very close to the beach) without a return ticket.
Pledge $100 or more
On-demand custom reviews of anything in LA. Can't make it to town for our show? Pick anything in LA (an art show, a particular taco truck, a dive bar in Sun Valley, a sunset on the Venice boardwalk) and we will create a 2 minute original video review of your thing. Each review is an original artwork and arrives as a DVD.
Pledge $250 or more
Exhibition catalogue. This publication designed by our classmates in the Graphic Design Program will feature the work of everyone in the show as well as an essay by our curator.
Pledge $500 or more
Collaborative original sculpture. You provide us with three words (prompts) and we will collaboratively transform your idea into a sculpture. This unique artwork will be accompanied by a video critique of the work on DVD.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Funding a group show designed to include everyone in our graduating class is a huge challenge. In previous years, students have organized fund raisers with a focus on the sales of donated student work and while this method has proven effective, it is limited mainly to those in the Los Angeles area. We wanted to extend this idea to our communities, friends, family, and colleagues outside of Los Angeles.
We designed the rewards in such a way that their production relies on the collaborative spirit of the community we have formed over the last two years. The very act of continuing to work together on these rewards, post graduation, adds to the social infrastructure of our graduating MFA class of 2014. And this is enabled by your contribution! Thank you for your support.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

In addition, we are proud to share that Catherine Wagley of the LAWeekly described our show as "tight and worth seeing." You can read the short text .

campaign.story:
Three years ago I launched a project called This is not a Kickstarter shirt (the name is inspired by this classic shirt, a high school favorite). Five hundred and thirty-two lovely humans from around the world backed it, and in return they got a T-shirt that they helped make.
Since then I've come across the shirt in the wild a handful of times. I met a woman in London two years ago who was wearing it. And just two weeks ago I met a woman at Kickstarter's Block Party who was happily wearing it:
See how happy she is?
Meetup CEO Scott Heiferman even wore the shirt while meeting Mayor Mike Bloomberg. Celebrity-approved!
It's 2014, and it's time to get the band back together again. The project will work the same as last time: the final stats of this project — as determined by you — will be printed on a shirt that we all get. 
The shirts will be printed on very soft, Alternative Apparel organic cotton shirts. It comes in two colors: white and green.
Like what you see? Want to join in? Then back this project! Thanks!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the second time running this project, and I feel confident that it will go well. My first go-around the biggest challenge was stuffing and mailing envelopes, as this update showed: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/yancey/this-is-not-a-kickstarter-shirt/posts/122924

This time I will be getting help with shipping and mailing to ease that pain. I expect this to go swimmingly. Fingers crossed!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:

Our T-shirts are making their way to everyone around the world. At this point most US-based backers have gotten their shirts, and folks elsewhere are beginning to receive theirs. Dear Backers!
I'm happy to announce that today Amplifier, our fulfillment partner, is shipping our shirts! Everyone should have theirs within the next two weeks. Exciting! Hope everyone loves them!
xoxoxo
Yancey

Hello backers!
Today I'm happy to share the finalized designs for our two shirts. There are two options: a white T with black letters, and a green T with white letters. Here's a pic:

Hey folks —
I hope this finds everyone well. I wanted to share quick update on the project's status. 
Two weeks ago I got back samples of shirts printed in our intended colors. I ended up being unhappy with them. The pictures on Alternative Apparel's website are more vivid than the shirts actually are, so I'm switching to a different fabric and this week ordering a new batch of samples.

Hello backers,
I’m thrilled to report that today “This is also not a Kickstarter shirt” was successfully funded by all 604 of you! Woohoo!
I’m in the process of getting sample shirts made in both colors, and will share pictures of them both once they arrive so you can decide which color shirt you want, your size, and other details.

Hello backers,
We're at the halfway point of "This is also not a Kickstarter shirt," and there are close to 400 of us so far. I wanted to share a few quick updates:
I'll be ordering an initial test printing of the shirt in both colors in the next few days. I'll share pix of how they turn out.
The plan is to use white text on the green shirt, and black text on the white shirt.

campaign.story:
If you’re not yet acquainted, Comic Neue is the font that saved Comic Sans. See www.comicneue.com for more information.
The world wants this font
I tweeted the website to 200 followers on Monday morning the 7th of April. In 24 hours it was trending worldwide on Twitter, in a few days it was featured in news publications around the world. It started a global conversation. The response has been amazing.
Let's make Comic Neue rad
Comic Neue isn't finished yet. Currently it only holds a basic set of characters that support English. If funded, Comic Neue will support German, French, Spanish, and all 41 languages covered by ISO 8859-15 and 8859-2. 
The current version of Comic Neue is rough. If funded, technical aspects such as anchoring, metrics, and kerning will be refined by a professional type designer, turning Comic Neue into a high quality typeface.
Forever free, la-di-da!
The new and enhanced Comic Neue will be provided for free on the www.comicneue.com website, and submitted to the Google Font Library.
Rewards
By contributing to Comic Neue you'll get your hands on the font well ahead of the general public release. See the Timelines section below for dates. All contributors will also be recognised on a Contributors Board, which will be featured on the Comic Neue website and in a beautifully designed souvenir book that tells the story of how Comic Sans was saved.
Souvenir Book
The souvenir book will be a beautifully designed token commemorating the point in time when Comic Sans was saved (!). It will include the story of Comic Neue, selected interviews, a detailed look at the font's characters, illustrations, and the Contributor Board.
Collector's Poster
A Collector’s Poster will be produced for those who want to own a limited edition piece of Comic Neue, This poster will be illustrated by me, and will be printed by a specialty printer in Kyoto, Japan to produce an amazing, individually numbered collectors item.
Speaking Engagement
The final reward is a speaking engagement. I will tell the story of Comic Neue to your audience, big or small. I will promote your event over a double-page spread in the Comic Neue souvenir book. I will provide a copy of the souvenir book for every audience member in attendance. Note in addition to the pledge, you will need to cover the travel costs and accommodation for me to speak at your event.
The funding goal
If the funding goal of $10,000 is reached, support for over 40 languages will be added; and the anchors, metrics, and kerning of the font will be refined by a professional type designer. Additional funds will go towards the bonuses outlined below.
Bonuses
If $15,000 is reached, full math character support will be added. Complex math equations become basic arithmetic when set in the light and breezy Comic Neue.
If $20,000 is reached, manual hinting will be performed. Hinting affects the way the font fits into the pixel grid of your display. This becomes critical when a font is used at smaller sizes. A certain degree of hinting is applied automatically to a font, but manual hinting produces the best result.
If $30,000 is reached, the form of each character in Comic Neue will be assessed and refined by a professional type designer. Comic Neue will become a true work of art. Improvements will be made under the original font creator’s supervision.
If $80,000 is reached, an italic version will be created and added to the font. Comic Neue currently features oblique variants, which is simply the light, regular, and bold weights set at an angle (12°). Italic is more cursive in nature, with aspects of hand-writing in its forms. If this bonus stage is reached we can create a truly beautiful, flowing form of Comic Neue. 
If $130,000 is reached, Comic Neue Extra Bold will be created and added to the font.
If $180,000 is reached, Comic Neue Condensed will be created and added to the font.
Timeframes
Any milestones achieved ahead of schedule will in turn be delivered ahead of schedule, with the exception of the font's public release date. 
Mid June
End of funding period.
August 1
1. Comic Neue font released to contributors.
2. Comicneue.com is updated with a Contributor Board.
3. Comic Neue souvenir book digital copy emailed to contributors.
September 1
1. Collector’s edition poster mailed to contributors who pledged accordingly.
2. Comic Neue souvenir book mailed to contributors who pledged accordingly.
December 25
Comic Neue released to the general public as a download on the Comic Neue website.
Speaking engagement timeframe
Date and time to be negotiated with those who funded accordingly. 
Bonuses
Timeframes for bonuses will be determined with the type designer if and when they are funded. Expect a two to three month time frame per bonus. Contributors will be kept in the loop via updates.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have shown you my dedication to this project by working on the current version of Comic Neue over three years, launching it, and standing by it while being scrutinised by the world’s media. I am as excited as you are to see this project carried through to completion. Emails will be sent to contributors whenever there is an announcement to make, so you’re always in the loop. Feel free to contact me directly if you have any questions. I’d love to chat.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Join us on facebook! 
KANGAROO LIGHT is a playful, practical personal light. It has been ingeniously designed to be programmed and fit your lifestyle, illuminating those darker moments.
Kangaroo Light is arduino compatible, allowing you to customize your light making it fun and de'lightful for all! Its flexible, hexagonal shape make it versatile so it fits your exact needs. The white high quality silicone exterior make it 100% splash proof and easy clean, allowing you to get creative and use KANGAROO LIGHT where and when you like.  
Some of the lighting uses include;
+ Private reading light
+ Ambient lighting
+ Portable camping light
+ Personal torch
+ Place mat
+ Night light
+ Bathroom light
+ Bag Light, illuminate the inside of your bag and locate your things on the go.
KANGAROO LIGHT has an interactive nature, making it playful and magical.  Its flexibility allows you to fold it, bend it, roll it and adjust it to your needs.
Our aim behind this ingenious lighting device is to bring fun, functionality and magic together, whilst creating a personal and portable light.
This mesmerizing light is set to light up your life in every way.
High quality silicone exterior.
 The perfect travel companion.
......even for sweeter dreams.
WHAT ARE THE BENEFITS OF KANGAROO LIGHT ?  KANGAROO LIGHT is a multipurpose personal, programmable light designed to illuminate when, where and how you desire.
It has been designed to fit your lifestyle on the go.  Pop it in your bag, or simply roll it up and carry it in a pocket. The lighting applications are simply endless.
HOW DOES IT WORK AND INTERACT?  KANGAROO LIGHT has a flexible white high silicone exterior which is splash proof. It has 24 built-in LED lights which emit a soft glow on one side.  Arduino compatible, allowing you to completely customize your personal lighting companion by programming a whole spectrum of gaming opportunities. Its Lithium-Ion battery offers 2,5 hours of non-stop light and is rechargeable via USB Port. 
An incorporated accelerometer and touch electrodes enable different types of interactions and mesmerizing illumination modes (turn on, turn off, random flicker, change intensity, pulsing etc.),  turning it into a playful customized, lively companion. 
KANGAROO LIGHT has been designed by STUDIO BANANA THiNGS in collaboration with The Innovation Quarter at Bangor University (UK).
WHO ARE WE?  We are STUDIO BANANA THiNGS, a multidisciplinary, dynamic and young international team of designers, architects, geeks, dreamers, keen observers and ambitious guys and girls who have a passion for creativity.
WHERE ARE WE AT?  The design and technological development of KANGAROO LIGHT are accomplished, production studies are well on their way and the logistics and fulfillment side of things are under control. 
We have gained a lot of experience from our two successful KICKSTARTER campaigns; OSTRICH PILLOW and OSTRICH PILLOW LIGHT, and we are ready to bring our latest dream to you by October 2014. 
Want to join the KANGAROO LIGHT community?  Keep your finger on the pulse with all our latest news via:
www.facebook.com/studiobananathings
Tweet us @StudiobananaT & #kangaroolight
Distributors and Retailers: we’re always excited to hear from you guys, so don’t be shy and drop us a line via distribution@studiobanana.com
Press and Marketing: ping us via press@studiobanana.com, we look forward to working with you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Perfection and outstanding levels of customer service are our focus; and we like being frank with our fans and supporters.

KANGAROO LIGHT is a new innovation and like all KICKSTARTER products you will be the first to receive it. When you see KANGAROO LIGHT in retail, you can show off to your friends you made the manufacturing possible. 

Don’t be shy, share your experiences, we love hearing from you so we can make things better.

Moving from prototype to production brings challenges at times. We aim to deliver a fabulous product to you, so if we experience unexpected issues at the manufacturing stage we would prefer to delay the delivery a little, and adjust until we are things are perfect. We are sure you understand and will appreciate this in the long run.

During our previous KICKSTARTER launch we encountered some hurdles and aim to avoid these 100%. Of course international customs, certification, logistic delays, and Force Majeure may occasionally show their ugly head. However, rest assured we will be working full throttle to avoid any issues on our end. 

EUROPEAN SHIPMENTS OUT OF EU

campaign.story:
Click here to back SUPERHOT with PayPal!
The campaign is over - huge thanks to all our backers! For more updates remember to visit our website, follow us on Twitter or like us on Facebook!
It all began in August 2013 during the 7 Day First Person Shooter game challenge, where we decided to make something that really stood out in the genre. Our concept was a title that felt dynamic and satisfying, while not requiring superhuman reflexes. Something like a game of real-time chess, except that all the pawns are out there to murder you. We released a public demo...
You can also check out the video reactions to our prototype: [Markiplier] [OfficialNerd³] [CupQuake] [JackSepticEye] [FavijTV] [JackFrags]
... and then - the Internet went crazy. We have been featured on Kotaku, The Verge, Rock, Paper, Shotgun, and WIRED among many others. SUPERHOT made it to the front page of Reddit (twice) and went through Steam Greenlight during a single weekend. Thanks to the amazingly positive responses we've decided that we want to develop SUPERHOT into a full blown game!
SUPERHOT is a unique, stylized FPS game where the time moves only when you move. With this simple mechanic we've been able to create gameplay that's not all about reflexes - the player's main weapon is careful aiming and smart planning - while not compromising on the dynamic feeling of the game.
You're not hiding behind cover - you're dodging bullets flying past you like in The Matrix. You're not waiting to reload a gun - you're picking the next firearm from the hands of your fallen foes. You're not waiting until your wounds heal - in SUPERHOT a single bullet means death. However, there are no reload screens - you're instantly back in the middle of the action. 
SUPERHOT wouldn't have made it this far if not for the support of gamers, the press, and fellow developers. Since the original prototype we've basically rewritten the game from the ground-up to make it more expandable, dynamic and resulting in a much smoother experience. 
During these eight months we've fixed a lot of the problems with the original version of the game, heavily reiterated on the art style, and experimented with fun scenarios for the players to "solve" - shootout in a subway train, showdown on the top of a skyscraper in rain, jumping into a moving elevator, and more.
We've still got a lot of work (new mechanics, more levels, better animation, rigorous testing and optimization) ahead of us, but the core of SUPERHOT is in place and it's unlike anything you've seen before.
Turning to Kickstarter ensures that we have access to a constant stream of feedback and ideas, while maintaining control over the development. We have the skills and experience needed to complete the game and we've been working on SUPERHOT non-stop for the past eight months, but we need your help to make it even better!
The initial goal of $100k will allow us to cover the costs of living for the team, purchase required hardware, software licences and assets that will allow us to finish the game faster, and to hire additional help - graphic artists, animators, level designers and sound technicians - that will assist us in making SUPERHOT a complete game. All funds over $100k will go directly into making the game better and covering the costs of promoting the game on various gaming events around the world.
Story driven single-player campaign. SUPERHOT is more than just a shooter with a gimmick. We want to deliver a solid, interesting campaign built around a carefully constructed, not overly in-your-face story.
Improved visuals. We are keeping the original game's minimalistic artstyle while making everything look a lot better. SUPERHOT is all about style.
Infinite mode. A lot of people have asked us for an endless, arena-style mode that will allow them to play SUPERHOT for as long as they want. Master the game's mechanics and get ready for the ultimate time-bending challenges.
More weapons - shotguns, machineguns, grenades that change the way you play around with the time-bending mechanics.
More enemy types - thanks to improved AI the foes will use tactics and be able to work together to hunt you down.
More levels - imagine fighting in the middle of a motorway during rush hour, or close combat in an elevator - and other amazing, movie-like scenarios.
Slow-motion explosions!
Oculus Rift support. Dodge bullets flying right in front of your face and lean behind corners for increased immersion!
And a lot of other surprises!
 Piotr is a seasoned team leader with a portfolio that pushes the experimental boundaries of puzzle games in titles such as Rektagon and Tetravalanche.  
Jakub is an experienced programmer with a portfolio of games released for various platforms, including PC, PS Vita and Nintendo 3DS. 
Luke previously worked at Wastelands Interactive (Worlds of Magic, 1946). When has free time he tends to participate in (or organize) various game jams and visit gaming events.
Marek is an electrical and software engineer with a track record of crazy projects like an iPad-integrated cat feeder, smoke emitting helmet or a baloon-controlled Flappy Bird game.  
Tomasz is a co-founder of our partner company Blue Brick who worked with and managed international teams developing big R&D projects - from mobile and automotive to telecom.
Marcin is a visionary graphics artist with a flair for experimental video game design and theatrics. Illustrates comic books when no one's looking.
Piotr has ten years of artistic experience in video games and animation, he creates awesome things in 3D and walks his dog in time left to spare.
Huge thanks to Julie Heyde (Bandello) for a lot of different things; to Karl Flodin (Twitter / Soundcloud) and AdhesiveWombat (Twitter / Soundcloud) for making awesome music for our video; to everybody that assisted us while creating this campaign; and finally, to the awesome Unity Engine team for helping us out in many ways :)
For $14 you receive a key for downloading SUPERHOT once it's released on Steam, access to our secret, backer-only forum where you can keep in touch with the developers, and immediate download of our digital pack of goodies (includes the downloadable, standalone version of the original SUPERHOT prototype and a pack of wallpapers and ringtones).
Access to the forums will be sent out in a survey after the campaign is finished. Click here for the digital pack of goodies.
By pledging $25 and more you get a digital artbook and a digital download of the game's official soundtrack in FLAC quality. You will also receive all previous rewards.
This tier will get you exclusive, Kickstarter-only beta access to SUPERHOT at least two months before it gets released anywhere else. We're currently planning to release beta access in 6-12 months, depending on our progress. Also includes all previous rewards.
Backing at least $55 will get you a set of awesome SUPERHOT stickers and badges, along with all previous rewards. Add $5 for international shipping.
At this level you'll receive one limited edition SUPERHOT T-Shirt (male and female tees available; pick one design from the two below), along with all previous rewards. Add $10 for international shipping.
These t-shirts were designed by the wonderful Emma Tolley (etall on Tumblr) and Marcin Surma (xulm on Tumblr)! Be sure to check out their other works, they're really good :D
By backing this tier you'll get a set of amazing, high quality SUPERHOT posters (we'll be talking more about these in one of the updates) along with all previous rewards. Add $15 for international shipping.
Pledging at least $200 will allow you to play the latest versions of SUPERHOT before anyone else - you'll have firsthand access to (potentially unstable) alpha versions of the game, and your feedback will shape the game. We're currently planning to release the first alpha version before the end of the year. Also includes all previous rewards. Add $15 for international shipping.
This limited tier will get you a signed, boxed and DRM-free copy of the game once it's finished; and your name will be prominently featured in the game. You also get all previous rewards. Add $20 for international shipping.
By backing this level you'll get a chance to work with us on designing an in-game achievement for the game itself. Think of an amazing challenge for the players and give it a fun name like "Mike's Trickshot" (your design will be subject to review). You also receive all previous rewards.
This tier allows you to help us design one stage for the endless arena mode that will be included in the final game. We will be open to your design, and you will get to name the stage (although both are subject to review, so it's fun to play). You also get all previous rewards.
Only for the biggest fans of the game. You'll receive a unique, hand-crafted by us, electronic device that (while not allowing you to stop time when standing still) might be a mystery tied into the game's plot. Additionally, you will get to co-design either a stage for the endless arena mode, or an in-game achievement. You also receive all previous rewards.
If you have any additional questions feel free to let us know - contact@superhotgame.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Quality takes time and we want to deliver an exceptional game. We will have an iterative development process - make a small chunk of the game, test it extensively, make changes, test it again, etc. This process can require a longer development time, but the rise in quality is worth the effort.

Project management is vital to teamwork, and we have considerable expertise in this field. We previously developed a range of software products - from complex statistics solutions for education to mobile applications. We are accustomed to working with a fixed budget and schedule, and this experience will be invaluable when working on SUPERHOT.

The costs of living in Poland are relatively low, so meeting our goal should give us enough money to complete the game without the need for additional financial support. Our primary goal is to deliver a great, unforgettable game.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Thirty months in the making. Thousands of hours put into development and design. Tens of thousands of avid backers from all over the world. Millions playing the prototype and prerelease versions.

Would be cool with two variants of the speedruns, one in real-time and one in game-time?

@Contemplar. I agree, there should be variety. The time mechanism can work for just about anything in standard games, and take it to a higher level. Stealth, for example: you can become virtually invisible by making sure that you're in the place an enemy or camera isn't currently looking. That would only work if the game can throw attacks you can't avoid at you (such as area attacks or lasers), and stealth solves it. It's also possible to take platform game style elements, where you have to avoid obstacles by precise movement.

campaign.story:
"A New Movie... About A New Generation"
It's 2014: forty years have passed since the Ramones first played CBGB; thirty-nine since John Lydon joined the Sex Pistols; thirty-six years ago Steve Ignorant claimed that punk was dead and three years later Wattie claimed it wasn't; thirty-two years ago Class of 1984 was released and thirty years ago it was Suburbia. Now it's The Ungovernable Force, showcasing the subculture and its oft-misunderstood opportunistic nihilism and basic humanistic ethics over sanctity and conformity.
Ungovernable Films - taking motion pictures back by force
The Ungovernable Force
The Ungovernable Force will be our second feature film, the first being Honky Holocaust, which is now finished and entering its festival run this summer! Honky Holocaust was a militantly anti-racist exploitation film; The Ungovernable Force will be our punxploitation mondo film with a tongue-in-cheek satirical approach against neo-fascism and economic inequality and the dangers of non-negotiable sanctity! Here at Ungovernable Films, we like to have fun making our films and to have a final product that the audience will have fun watching. 
The Ungovernable Force (2015)
And we mean "fun" in the most crude, exploitative, tongue-in-cheek way; to stay true to our heroes and influences like Roger Corman, Lloyd Kaufman, Jack Hill, Dario Argento, George Romero, John Carpenter, Wes Craven, and the other legends from that generation of b-movie, b-horror, horror-comedy, grindhouse, and exploitation filmmakers, we recognize what we honestly look for in film and assume that our audience wants the same thing, so we aim to give it to them, and then give it to them again, and then again, and then we cut out everything that isn't fun or shocking or gross or funny and what's remaining is our film (what's left, of course, includes all the blood, violence, nudity, sex, humor, gore, guns, shoot-outs, fire, and anything else that is safe and acceptable to see on screen but not always in real life).
Why $12,000 is our goal:
But now we want to bring it to the next level, and we want to do it with our heroes. For The Ungovernable Force, we're getting some pretty big names to grace our film with their presence and talent, namely Tony Moran, the original Michael Myers from Halloween, Debbie Rochon, "Scream Queen of the Decade" for the 1990s, Bill Weeden from Sgt. Kabukiman and Troma's Citizen Toxie: Toxic Avenger IV, Lloyd Kaufman, co-founder of Troma Films and creator of The Toxic Avenger, Merle Allin of The Murder Junkies and brother of GG Allin, Apache Ramos from The Warriors, Steve Lake of anarcho-punk legends Zounds, and Steve Ignorant of the godmothers/godfathers of anarcho-punk CRASS, Mensi from Oi! legends Angelic Upstarts, among many others. Unfortunately, the cost of flying our heroes and legends into Boston to appear in our film, putting a roof over their heads, food on their plate, and fulfilling their incredibly humble day rates is bringing our budget from about $1,000 - $2,000 to well over $10,000. In order to do The Ungovernable Force the way we want to, we'll need upwards of $20,000, but we're willing to put every penny we have into this film and pinch those pennies all the way to the final day on set, bringing our absolute minimum budget to $12,000. 
Why you should contribute:
First of all, this film is going to be a lot of fun to watch, let alone make, and we figure that with a potential cast like this, and by featuring some of our local favorite talent, raising $12,000 was a challenge we can handle, and we're asking all of you - our devoted past, present, and future audience - to show us that we were right! After all, who doesn't want to see a bunch of punk rockers and homeless militants team up to defeat a fascist cop who spends his shifts raping and killing innocent homeless women? Oh, and did we mention there are monsters? Well, there are. And they're voiced by famous and legendary UK Punk Rockers. Yea, we won't be holding back with this one...
The rewards are pretty great too, ranging from grateful mentions in the credits and on our website to speaking roles with awesome celebrities, tee-shirts, DVDs, tickets to the premiere, and a bunch of other really cool stuff. Check out our full list of incentives and see what interests you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've produced quite a few films and know as well as any other filmmaker, independent or otherwise, that film productions can bring with them, every day, setbacks of the completely unexpected nature. Cars breaking down on the way to location, talent and crew getting lost or running late on the way to the set, technical difficulties of any and every kind, dangerous or even just prohibitory weather conditions, the problems faced by any filmmaker can mount without warning, but we've learned to face them and push through. While we expect to face the unexpected, that's not to say that we don't cross our fingers every day, hoping that the set will run smoothly. But then again, it never does. So if we don't have to add finances to our list of concerns, we might just survive this production and have the incredible fortune of doing another!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Thank you!!!
Sincerely,
